A76s1wdzUKLqg-2GwOHz3A.text: Awesome place! One of the best atmosphere is on the south east side of Las Vegas with the spectacular view services great menu is fantastic and you must try the Montecristo

9WF8AYETtcdo0u6vAweE7g.text: Super cute, chic brunch spot. I was there for a birthday and our server took good care of us. The biscuits/jam were to die for!

K2fMs3VCIq2dlNCUomskxg.text: I am new to LV coming from Miami. The Stove was recommended to me by a friend I work with, I loved the decor, the view was amazing and the server was very welcoming and sweet. We ordered the Poutine Waffles and Arugula with poached egg. However, after being advised that the food would take 30 min or so because it would be "prepared fresh" and waiting with high expectations. My bf and I could barely enjoy our food because of the overpowering amounts of salt. Again the service and overall ambiance are amazing. Might go back for a Mimosa brunch with the ladies but definitely wont be back to eat.

OcU2Kjx-bj2QYaz5t7NR6A.text: From start to finish between the wait and receiving my food to check took two hours they really should tell people when they get there exact wait times and food times would have left if I had known

r-fri9PJheWJxOLxVTKXrQ.text: Location:  Excellent location, all though parking could be a factor when everyone finds out about this place. Gives off a midwestern vibe with the decor and makes you feel right at home.   Menu:  It's an interesting menu with all different varieties to choose from. My favorite is the Dirty BLT, great combination of Jalapenos, Avocado, Bacon, Tomatoes and Lettuce.   Staff:  Very friendly and knowledgeable in what they're serving.

PWzyVqFXRroXFjZjtmeDDA.text: Worst Restaurant ever!  Created account just to review.  Mediocre tasting food. Sour and old.  3 chorizo tacos for 7 dollars.   No personality and long af wait!  2 hours for food on a quiet day.  TRASH

oAAc3GINWNZnqP1pvmDwSw.text: The original wait time was estimated at 40 min. At 40 it was extended to 15 more min, then to one hour. Several groups including of the same size that came after us were seated first. The table we got was in the back had to squeeze in between a display item and seated near an open door during the summer in Las Vegas. Fo. I really wanted to like this restaurant, the tea room seems to get good reviews maybe I'll try that  Tried again and our food sat in the window for so long it was cold, too bad beautiful restaurant seems like lots of potential

9sjmW9tou_ZWffCFxzJhYA.text: This place is such a gem. There's typically a 30-45 minute wait on the weekends, but it's worth it. They have some incredible vegan items on the menu and we've always been happy with our orders received great service. Check this place out if you're in the area!

tJJOw73M4zeT5Fz5ZWt5nw.text: If you're hungry stay away from this place. My girlfriend and decided to go here on a whim because we were on that side of town. It took about 30 minutes to get seated. The person who seated us said the waitress will be at our table shortly. We sat there and watch person after person pass us by. I finally said something after 15 minutes of waiting at our table for someone to  possible get us some drinks. I practically had to yell our our drink orders (mind you it was only water) just so she could hear me. She finally comes back and puts the drinks on the table and literally threw our utensils on the table and walked away without even asking if we were ready to order. So once again here we are waiting to order. I looked at my girlfriend and finally said we are getting the hell out of here. I walked up to the hostess, told her where we were sitting explained that we just ordered water and we are leaving. She looked at me with a disgusted look and said "well what do you want me to do about it"? It took me everything to not explode in her face. Who in their right mind says that to a customer. I will never go back to this place. We ended up going to Sunrise Cafe.

Yna8-xsJkWMBUFhMTGm-Dg.text: While I want to give them a better star rating for the quality of their food, my dissatisfaction comes from the wait list/waiting program. In the beginning their online wait list seemed to work great, now I'm still waiting to receive a notification from almost a month ago. I figured I would give it another try since the first 3 times I used it, it worked great. Unfortunately again it's failed me. I called and spoke with one of the hostesses who agreed that it's definitely faulty but the best advice would be to put the name on the wait list then show up because if you're "in front of us, we will seat you." Well that's disappointing to hear since I'm waiting to get my 10 minute warning text, like I'm sure most other people that read the website is as well. So basically all the people that do that, even being after me on the wait list, are getting seated for being there, it's frustrating and disappointing to know. While the food is good, I can honestly say Craft Kitchen, which is literally less than a mile away, has a way better wait list system and the food is equally as good. I would suggest going there instead.

Vk-cUQGwrpeg4sOeGInzKw.text: A fun breakfast and lunch restaurant with a great view of the strip. Interesting food combinations and a fun menu with excellent food. Fun place. I give it a 9 out of 10.

xAMuJXzNJAXcL2MTYYr3Iw.text: The food here is simply wonderful. I had the Benedict and man, that sauce was amazing. My table mates were equally impressed with their dishes. Make reservations. I can't stress that enough. The place has great food and thus is often very busy. I saw the folks at the table next to us got an amazing mug of unicorn hot chocolate. I'll be ordering that on my next visit.

aNbHkfBoqiW7FDb6mon3HA.text: When you walk in you feeling like your in a "Pinterest" wish list. The decor is modern country chic. The food presentation is very very sexy. Everything we ate was delicious and flavorful. The only thing this place needs is more square foot. I'll shall return for more.

gVTpjAK7qcvIjv8uEijECg.text: I wanted it to be better than it was. It could have just been my experience, as I've heard good things. It's very cute, close to my home, and the staff is nice. Unfortunately I went for brunch today and found the service to not be the best. Everything took a very long time. My coffee finally came out when my cousins were almost finished their specialty hot chocolates, and the server had me set a timer to press the French Press at the right time. Then even after I pressed it I had to request creamer and sugars and then remind the server again to bring them. The table was never bussed throughout, so appetizer plates were left filling the table as we ate. No one checked on us during the meal, and even after. We sat for a while with our plates and had to request someone bring a box and the check instead of the server coming by. I understand brunch is usually very busy and I'm not one to complain much, but the service unfortunately lacked. I hope if I try it out again it'll be better!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Crabby Patty. I wish this was better. I found it overall a bit too salty.
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Short Rib Empanada. Delicious!

b7ABBp5hAy-8_4n2YIFE3Q.text: The food, presentation and service was all outstanding.  We had the prosciutto frittata, Salmon Benedict, waffles, blueberry scones and peach mimosa.  Chef Scott is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

dyerzSXl_V4HL7yuxIq_mg.text: I wasn't referred to go by anyone this time but my fiance wanted to try it. We used their website to get a table said wait was 75 mins and were like 7th in line but I was fine gotta be patient right. Well we got seated at the patio very quickly. However no one came to our table until my fiance asked the busboy at another to table if we can get a server. I wouldn't have asked and just waited for the server. We ordered corn dogs, chicken and waffle and crab benedict. The food was slow and they weren't very busy a lot of empty tables. The food was slightly above average. The service was subpar. I would not go back anytime soon.

Wizo8TBdX1gYeIHY9ZEcsw.text: OH MY GOD!  Seriously, the best breakfast I've ever had. The corned beef was perfect. My family and I are divided on whether Stove is better than Urth Cafe in Cali, I totally think that Stove is better. Must try!

FAN5pp_p-pMDJ72NqqEZHQ.text: I had been looking forward to dining here for many months.  I wasn't expecting the place to be so beautiful and quaint but to my surprise it was more than that. We walked in and it was very busy which is a great sign.  We chose to sit at the bar and Zoe was so friendly.  We enjoyed the atmosphere so much that having to wait almost an hour to get our food was forgotten.  I highly recommend the Croque Madame and the chicken fried steak as long as you specifically ask for it to be cooked towards the well done side. I will definitely return and I think The Stove is going to be there for awhile.  Meaning that location has been occupied by numerous other concepts previously.  Thank you to the entire staff! You are amazing!

Ak3tdr_JCYWiVtaCNlCcog.text: Loved it. Adorable atmosphere, our server was wonderful and most of the food was outstanding. There were a few things that were not to our taste ( The deviled eggs for example, the egg yolk is not mixed in with the other ingredients to create a smooth filling it's more like a hard-boiled egg with a topping. I'm just not a fan of hard-boiled egg yolk) but the PB&J egg biscuit is everything! I did go on a Monday so it was not crazy busy like it may be on a weekend. I would recommend that and I love that there is a brunch option place that is open every day. I love brunch!

dt0zjDRitU944LNuM3qs8Q.text: It was our friend's 38th birthday and a party of 10 came at 11 am to celebrate. We planned over a month ahead of time. I come to find out it that it was a complicated process to book a large party on a Sunday but we let that go because we were excited! When we got inside, 2 friends slipped on the floor and almost knocked themselves out but we laughed about that and continued on. The service was slow, food was good (once we got it) but our waitress was seemingly annoyed and unhappy with her job so we felt it throughout the 2 hours. We tried to disregard (for BDAY purposes) her demeanor, but it got hard to ignore and when we paid 21% gratuity for our bill - it seemed VERY hard to stomach....but we did. We never asked to speak to management but we weren't coming back. THEN a girl (who did NOT give us any impression she was management...no professional attire or name tag etc etc) came over and ASKED US how our meal was so we told her... it was the truth and hard to hear but I was impressed that they came over to get that "feedback". This "manager" told us they brought in 4 people to help work that day (that didnt normally work there) and that OUR server had many complaints against her. They apologized MULTIPLE times and gave us coupons to come back and try again. I was willing to do so. Then ...right before we left, a man with a dirty apron on (I come to find is the chef/owner) walks over, leans over us on table and says that he has complaints against us and we are cursing at his staff and we need to leave. We are perplexed. We apologize to the 2 tables around us (just in case we were too loud)...who proceed to HUG US and take photos with us outside (I have proof in my phone) and say that THEY DID NOT COMPLAIN, and that is that. My bday friend asks hostess who the man was that asked us to leave...he is owner. She leaves and then got called twice by management saying they are pressing charges against my bday friend. The management said they called the POLICE and had someone later call and impersonate the police! No "physical altercation" ever ensued. Our friend and LV lawyer was a guest at the restaurant and with us in the car and laughed at this, but it is still not okay for a business to behave this way. It's become a crazy bullying fiasco. We wouldnt have EVER come back (due to bad service) but now I look at this place as a NIGHTMARE! Dont trust a place that will walk over and ask for your feedback and then string you up for it. Why are they so defensive?! Think about it. Use your best judgement.

LHqlgTp5UteyfXykfUNyRw.text: Really upset about my experience...   We did the online wait list, says there wasn't a wait. We got there and had to wait 10 minutes.   The server didn't come til about 10 minutes after we sat. We actually saw him rolling into his shift as we were walking through the door.   They didn't have anymore sugar in the raw... we had the last 4 packs... coffee wasn't hot at all.  We ordered the cowboy nachos to start... really weird combination. Didn't have onions like it listed... good sauce... but don't recommend.  Our entrees literally took 45 minutes and I believe it was because the chef took our food to the wrong table. I'm guessing who was "VIP" because they were giving that table a lot of love -- which btw came in 15 min after us and got their food before us...   So I'm guessing the chef had to remake our entrees because our plates were put down on the wrong table... at this point I didn't care for them to remake the entrees. We've waited soooooooo long!  I don't think we'll be coming back... especially for the price we paid wasn't worth the service & the wait.

Ln6O0MTivThTjOSuSq08Mg.text: The food was really good. The food poisoning on the other hand.....not so good.   Spent my entire weekend on the toilet.  We smelled a fishy smell when we walked in but assumed it was the seafood they use. Not sure if it was cross-contamination or what but needless to say I will it be returning.    Also the service was atrocious. Marco asked if had ever been there before and we said no.  I'd assume he would then explain the menu or recommend something. Nope. Just took our order didn't even ask if our toddler wanted to eat.  We had to stop him and order scrambled eggs and sausage.     Of course it took 40 minutes for the food to come out and guess who's food took an extra 5 minutes.  You guessed it the scrambled eggs and one sausage link for my son. I could have made that in 4 minutes.  No wonder the table beside us immediately took their food to go as soon as it was brought to the table.    Then after my fiance took my son to the car, the plates were cleared from the table, and I sat there for another 8-10 minutes, Marco finally asked if I wanted my bill. No moron I'm just sitting here by myself for no reason at all.  Again since we'd never been there I didn't know if I was supposed to go up front or wait for him.    The end result is even if I didn't get sick eating their food the service would warrant never returning.    Go to Craft Kitchen up the road if you're looking for this type of food.  Better coffee, similar food, much better service, and of course no ramped vomiting and diarrhea.

CyHL6qrG-JG-MDt399meLw.text: I rarely leave reviews this low, but I went one other time thinking the first time was just a bad day.  It also feels weird because everyone has left such glowing reviews.  It's a long one...  1st visit: This was a few months ago, but we arrived around 9:30a.m on a Saturday expecting the rumored 1.5/2hr wait, but it must have been some a holiday weekend or something because it was dead, so we were excited to sit right down.  There must have been maybe four other tables in the restaurant.    No issues with the server thus far.  He was prompt and polite.  We ordered coffee and the grilled biscuit and jam.  The coffee was VERY good and the biscuit was NOT very good.  It honestly tasted like a stale biscuit warmed up, dry, crumbly and bland.   We ordered the Bangers & Eggs and Croque Madame.  While waiting for our food we see the whole front-of-house staff, including the chef, come out to do what you could basically call a "pre-shift" and stood around the service table tasting and discussing a dish.  What do you think happened?  Yup, our food stood in the window the entire time.  When our food arrived is obviously slightly warm instead of hot.  The banger dish was ok, but what are you to expect from bangers and eggs? The Croque Madame tasted like it would have been good if it was hot.  Croque Madame comes with a bechamel sauce which doesn't do good things as it cools.  We were honestly too aggravated to complain and just wanted to leave.  This was an avoidable issue which IMO makes it worse than just some food coming out wrong or waiting a little long.      While I can't completely blame the server, he should have been aware and the chef should know he has food being prepared.    2nd Visit: About two weeks ago we decided to go back.  Every restaurant has an off-day and everyone still raved about this place, so we said let's do it.   We waited a little over an hour, which is fine as we expected it, so I'm not factoring that in to my rating.    Things were seemingly on the up and up, the coffee was great like last time.  Our server was awesome.  I wish I remembered her name, because the owner should be happy he has someone like her.  She was a tall brunette with glasses.  We asked to start with the french toast and for the mains we were going to share the Country Fried and this Indian style chicken sandwich.    The french toast came promptly and it was good.  I'd say a 3.5 on a sale to 5.  We were feeling good about our experience thus far, but as the first  45 minutes passed by we started to get aggravated.  Our server brought us a savory pastry because we were waiting so long, so she allayed our frustration for the moment, but as another 40 minutes passed I got up and was going to ask for the bill so we can leave.  Nearly an hour and a half? Unacceptable.    The food was OK.  The country fried was solid and the biscuit was warm fluffy and delicious which only reinforced the one I got the last time was a stale one they warmed up.  The chicken sandwich was pretty solid as well.   Again, the server was great and comped half of our check, and I promise we still tipped on full price; she deserved it.  As someone who used to be a server I know this doesn't fall on her.  She told us there was a 30 person party, but again, coming from the industry that's no excuse.  When you have a party of that size you plan for it and around it.       All-in-all we will never be back.  Henderson is booming with breakfast/brunch places, so while the food was good on the second visit it simply isn't good enough to justify the wait or the experience.  Yes, it's a cute place with a great atmosphere, but that only goes so far.    The competition is growing and with established breakfast places like Served, Kitchen Table or Weiss's Deli, there are simply better options for the half the hassle.

3MMpLTrfRQrEy_ncLY3d1A.text: The food is so good, I wanted to eat it twice.  Luckily, there was so much of it that I got to take half my delicious fried chicken sandwich with me. My honey looooves breakfast, but I like lunch, so I am always looking for places that serve both at once.  The Stove had the diverse menu and hours to please both of us.  The menu items looked like very creative twists on old favorites, which is always a good formula for a menu. I definately agree with other Yelpers who have written that there is some kind of disconnect between the front of the house and the kitchen.  We got on the online wait list, but later learned that it expires every fifteen minutes.  The hostess was dismissive and did seem overwhelmed by the volume of customers.  We were preemptorily shuttled to a side room to wait in a private event room, with others.  We were called in order, but it took about 20 minutes.  Next time we decided to arrive early.  It is also mysterious that half the restaurant is closed during the breakfast hours, with many vacant tables in view for people ordering tea service, which starts at 3pm.   The waiter also seemed rushed, but was helpful in chosing the dishes.  I ordered a Mimosa made of champagne and peach puree, which was kind of like a healthfood Bellini (in a good way). Unlimited Mimosas are available for a reasonable fee ($17.00).  This is Vegas, after all. The food was worth waiting for.  My husband's traditional Eggs Benedict were perfectly cooked and the sauce was creamy and lightly flavored with lemon.  His hashbrowns were sumptuously seasoned, and the muffins just browned.  My Indian spiced fried chicken sandwich with carmelized onions was spicy-yummy.  The fries crisply tasty, and a simple side salad had a vinagette dressing that tasted home made.  The dishes were hearty and tasty, everything you want in a breakfasty lunch.   We will be returning to The Stove with high expectations, but at an earlier, less crowded hour.

Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Indian Fried Chicken Sandwich
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Waiting........

eXDpW6upNdJ1hDnOGmUBxg.text: I wanted to try The Stove for the longest time so when my friends and I planned brunch last week, it was the perfect opportunity. This restaurant was cute and had a fresh, clean aesthetic. However the hostess service leaves a lot to be desired...I put my name on the waitlist online around 12:30ish and we didn't get seated till around 2. We had gotten there pretty early so we decided to sit outside in their patio area since it was a nice day. I kept refreshing my name on the list to keep track of my spot. After continuously refreshing the page, I saw my name off the list...no name call or text. We went inside to let the girl know and she put us back on the list only to wait another 30 minutes for a seat. Once we were seated, the waitress told us it would be another half hour to make food since it was made to order. Cute place and decent food but not worth that ridiculous wait.   + 1 (food) + 1 (ambiance) + 1 (waitress)

KtCDRaL_ROQys6t27DqMrA.text: Went for brunch and service was poor. Our server poured us water then we didn't see him for over 10 minutes...and the place was not busy.  We ordered the deviled eggs and were served hard boiled eggs cut in half with mayo on top. Not sure if they were going for a "deconstructed" dish or just got lazy but it did not taste or look good. Regardless, it was not deviled eggs. My pork eggs benedict was cold and the biscuit was hard and anything but flaky...Exactly what I expected after seeing it sit in the window for 6 minutes (yes I counted).   Maybe it was an off day but I would not go back because of the service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Hard boiled eggs not deviled eggs.

0aBQ-Jp5wHkrfG0Jw0t7gQ.text: This is a very cute little brunch spot, be careful tho, the wait on Sundays sometimes gets crazy!   They have a lot of cool options on the menu, my friend had the chicken and waffles, (which was massive). And myself, I usually opt for a eggs benedict. I was disappointed to find that there were no vegetarian options on the benedicts to choose from :( I always just sub out the meat but it would be nice to have a dedicated one.   Besides that one issue no complaints from me :)

VH49_0tWISvtyj_uOF1cNw.text: We went here today for breakfast, and we will come back tomorrow with friends. Yes, this is good!!!  Great service, really modern interior design, most of the food is good, especially their daily donut and savory French toast. Management is attentive and greets every table ... my new favorite breakfast spot. And I will come back with my girlfriends for their noon high tea which needs to reserve 24 hrs ahead and starts at 10am.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Lavender latte... a bit lack of flavor
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Daily donut - very unique and delicious

7YpDfTC1-B6bpYPqKdEPCg.text: We ate here and had a great time. The views are nice and the food is good, but not great. I would go again and try other options. The service was great. I just expected more from the other reviews. And really wanted this to be our "to-go" breakfast place.

BavfzUe-8PogtXWXIvCWxw.text: The Stove is new, so I want to give them the benefit of the doubt (with an extra star) and hope the handful of issues I experienced were due to still working out the kinks.   We went for Sunday breakfast and I would imagine I'll be back again to see if they have improved, but I'll definitely give it a couple months. If I do, hopefully this review improves.   My first pet peeve was inconsistent and inaccurate menus. I really hope (and assume) they are temporary because they are cheaply printed on standard copy paper. I was told some pastry items (like the $7 donut) weren't available anymore because they "didn't work out", but then the server said they did have a donut; however, he was unable to actually describe the type of donut beyond it having classic glaze.   Despite my issues with the menu presentation/info, there are some very creative dishes for both breakfast and lunch; there's a whole section devoted to benedicts with properly poached eggs! (It's been my experience that LV chefs/line cooks have a hard time with poached eggs if they're even on the menu).   I did the suckling pig benedict; it was good, with potential to be great. First of all, after already dealing with inordinately long wait times for our food, I watched my benedict sit in the window under a lamp for several minutes while it waited for a waffle. As a result, a decent portion of the hollandaise sauce had cooked and was now scrambled eggs. I addressed it immediately with the expeditor and he said "I'm sorry, would you like me to make you another one?" ... No, definitely not, especially when I waited 20+ mins for this one!! Why he didn't offer to bring me fresh hollandaise, who knows?? Secondly, the dish is accompanied by a mixed greens side salad. I received a (warm), wilted, soggy, over dressed pile of greens that would have been a welcomed relief to the richness of eggs benedict. Unfortunately, it was inedible.   Taylor tried the churro waffle. Also good with the potential for greatness. The portion was two medium sized waffles so plenty of food, but the waffles weren't even slightly crispy, not even close..I've had more structured frozen waffles. While it's not great and of itself, when topped with macerated berries, whipped cream, and a syrup/glaze the waffles lost all integrity and were mush. The churro waffle didn't need too much assistance from regular syrup, but they do have vanilla bean and bourbon maple syrups to choose from and they were pretty incredible!   Lastly, there's the dining room. Following suit with the majority of local restaurants, table arrangements are cramped and crowded with terrible building acoustics, so it's annoyingly loud. There's a spacious bar area and two semi-private dining areas, but the main floor is a zoo. As we were leaving, a band was setting up, I couldn't believe it! Definitely not what I associate with a relaxed Sunday morning. If that band had started before I received my meal, I would have asked for a manager and subsequently left.

Mc3aOE_HaZcKKVINFR2npg.text: Some of the best vibes and views of vegas. Went here on Sunday with the family and it was the highlight of the weekend! I enjoyed the Ham Benedict, the croque madame And the chilaquiles! They were ALL amazing. Don't sleep on the pastry basket, the flavored mimosas or the cotton candy French press. What I really love is that they serve brunch EVERYDAY! Heck yes!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Assorted pastry basket

GN5Hxgc1czeaNXAJ3gfNbQ.text: Went here the other day celebrating my 30th the food was great and service was perfect I ordered the crabby patty egg Benny so good  *** but there was a crab shell in it that almost broke my tooth it hurt really bad made my eyes water so just a note to the kitchen to be more careful   Can't wait to go back!

ZzS9KqhDTRVxYdNxojX3Kw.text: As a gay man, I have a lot of expectations when it comes to a bottomless brunch place, and The Stove met EVERY. SINGLE. ONE. from the service to the food to the aesthetic, i'm HOOKED! this is my new brunch spot. p.s. ARELY IS THE SHIT!

ABbXvlVW9mxNu4kOiWQLyA.text: Great setting for breakfast!  Enjoyed a quiet relaxing breakfast with my wife on a weekday morning.  Nice service too!

WLITIOSrUMNnrx_WVAM2-g.text: Love love love this place! What a great place for breakfast/brunch! I recommend trying to come before 11, because after that there will most likely be a wait.  This place truly is unique to the valley, with the coffee bar, selfie booth, tea room, and amazing view. Plus, the food is fantastic! All fresh ingredients that the chef has paired perfectly with some interesting combinations. This has been added to one of my favorite brunch spots in Henderson

Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

miLRC9cHAQ-N4mwDMJ5wrQ.text: AVOID AT ALL COSTS!! Was excited to come here but severely disappointed with both the food and the service. Came here with my fiance and couldn't believe the way we were treated. Our waitress was so incredibly rude from the moment we sat down that we almost left several times. And the food? BLAND! Anyone that gives this place 5 stars   clearly has no clue what great food tastes like. With so many amazing places in town, don't waste your time or money here!!! The owner should be ashamed. And looking through the other reviews, this type of service seems to be the norm here.

toK3I7z5TDhYucCnlj3ajg.text: I absolutely love the feel of this place. Every time I walk in, the energy hits me and I feel like I'm on the beach. The food is creative and delicious. I'm so happy I love right around the corner.

6ZD3YA8722KvrumGH7yZ7g.text: I cannot wait to come back to the Stove to try more food! There were so many options it was so hard to decide but I ended up getting a traditional Benedict and it was amazing. You could tell the ingredients were so fresh and made from scratch. My friends got the vegan sandwich and also the frittata and they were both blown away by how good they were. We will definitely be back! The hibiscus mimosas were also phenomenal.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Traditional Benedict

2u885u8LHTPs7k1Zb6MO4g.text: Fantastic breakfast and brunch experience - serving up classics along with unique dishes. Attention to detail here is key to the their success. Love the presentation of the Lil ' Brunchers served in a lunchbox (my daughter thought that was special)! The Noble handcrafted syrup infused with bourbon or Tahitian vanilla is a great compliment to their hearty flapjacks. From egg tacos, to smoked Dem Fancy Egg, and pecan pancakes or chicken and waffles there's plenty to please a crowd. Henderson has a new breakfast and brunch gem with The Stove taking over a previously unsuccessful space. Don't forget to check out the photo booth before you leave, for a fun snapshot keepsake! Private dining is available and weekends has a live musician playing for the crowd.

hoMtSMRq8pGrnD0P0w03zw.text: Today my boyfriend and I decided to eat here for brunch, and it was a 10/10 experience! The atmosphere is fun and welcoming, and their aesthetic is spot on! The staff was friendly, especially our waiter Tony. He was very genuine, hardworking and gave us great food recommendations! My boyfriend ordered a peach mimosa with the honey toast, while I had the chiliquiles. Both were very delicious and definitely didn't disappoint. We left full and extremely satisfied and we're already planning on what to try next!

JgZpEKTuGyaNLfjmnO5jIw.text: Divine food. Brie pancakes? You'd think that would never work, but it does. Huge portions. Half of my pancakes needed to go home with me. Nice, fluffy texture. No mixes here!   Love the selection of teas. Also riddle me this: Who in Henderson offers a proper afternoon tea? This place does! Can't wait to try it.   Killer location. The view is lovely. The decor is charming. Very French Nouveau-Provence crossed with casual California.   Great service. You know that everything is made from scratch and that takes time. And yes.....that means please don't expect to be in and out of this restaurant in less than an hour. It's not going to happen and there's no problem with that. Plan accordingly.   People say that this location is jinxed and the turnover of restaurants in this building proves it. I give a firm no to that. Here's my reasoning:   If the service and especially the food quality keep themselves at the highest standard and something new and different is being offered that no one else offers, I don't think that people will stay away. Support your local charming and adorable new restaurant.

AFAQAMAIhbbmZ4MNpIZNtA.text: This morning, we came here without a reservation and were able to get sat pretty much right away which was nice. However when we sat down it took our sever about 5-7 min to come over to us and the table next to us. It wasn't busy so this was a slightly longer than average wait time to be greeted, we had enough time to look at the menus and decide what we were eating. The server came over, we ordered 2 waters, one hot tea, one cappuccino and one OJ, and our breakfast dishes. After 12 min of waiting the OJ and tea come out and she says "the cappuccino will be right out" (mind you we still haven't gotten any water) ... after waiting for about 5 more minutes my boyfriend gets up and asks a server to give us some water, and 5 minutes after that the cappuccino comes out, it took an extremely long time. When she dropped it to the table she did not bring any mixing spoons or sugar which is usually standard for most places. We asked for sugar and and spoon and only got sugar, the table next to us experienced the same exact thing and we both used our forks to mix out cappuccinos, after being here for 30 min our food came out, I asked for ketchup and never received it. Also the table next to us had ordered a cinnamon bun as a starter and they ended up getting their dishes the same time as us without ever receiving the cinnamon bun. The food quality is ok but the service here is EXTREMELY slow and the staff does not be seemed to properly apprehend a guests needs which makes a dining experience pretty crappy!

R_dNPfDQcFbUQWjxeHTO-Q.text: Arrived at 11:15. Was told it would be a 40-45 min wait. Ok. We waited 15 minutes and finally asked how are the other people that are waiting being served drinks. Ok, you have a bar, oh so nice to SAY something. We ordered mimosas and that took another 20 mins. 11:50 oh drinks. We were finally seated at 1:15. Now please imagine this wait with a 3 year old. Thank God her Mom brought snacks. Little bit did really well and was such a trooper. Ok, now we are finally seated and our waitress informed us that it will be another 45 minutes to an hour plus for our order to go even go through. I asked if they could at least make the single pancake for our 3 year old and we could wait for our bacon, eggs and toast. Yeah, she said no. My friend asked why wasn't this disclosed that we would have to wait over 3 hours to be served food when you knew we had a kid with us and there was the blame "oh she, the hostess must not have known how busy we were and we do have two big parties. I guess if you're that stupid you must think everyone else is that stupid to let such stupidity come out of your mouth.  I don't think our service could have been more lackadaisical and inconsiderate. Just be honest from the start like at least at the end when a single pancake for a hungry 3 year old was too much for you guys to handle. You just made a 3 year old cry because we had to leave without food after two f*cking hours!!!.. I F*cking Hate this place.

87MG1h0uwFKmdQsHrPaHHA.text: I recently joined two friends here for lunch and really enjoyed the food we shared. I'm looking forward to returning to try even more of the menu.   The Stove has a dining room for seated service and a tea room. The entire restaurant is surrounded by windows making it a bright, open space.   The Mexican Egg, a Mexican twist on a Scottish Style Egg was very good. The egg was perfectly cooked and the flavors were excellent. The potatoes under the egg were notably delicious. The Blueberry Muffin was moist and delicious.   The Muffalata Sandwich didn't look exciting, but packed a ton of flavor and heat. The Indian Sandwich was unique and delicious. The chicken was juicy and well seasoned. Both of these had a nice combination of flavors that I enjoyed. The Poutine Waffle was both yummy and unique in presentation. It wasn't served on top of a waffle, but with pieces of waffle mixed in with the poutine.   I loved the atmosphere and the food items I've tried so I'll definitely return. The tea area looked like a fun space to relax with a friend too.

m00PQPDpXuyYehS4EoaWLA.text: The Stove is easily the most anticipated restaurant opening in Henderson, featuring the partnership of Antonio Nunez and Scott Commings with an expansive menu of innovative breakfast, lunch, and brunch dishes, in addition to a tea lounge and a decadent selection of pastries. The space itself is as well thought-out as the menu, with a table honoring the previous incarnation as a Kerry Simon restaurant to the vertical gardens for fresh garnishes and the reservable meeting spaces in back, not to mention a selfie booth to further push their social media advertising campaign. The staff at the Stove have put out beautiful, delicious dishes accompanied by attentive and personable service across three visits in the past month- once for pastries, again for breakfast, then for a birthday brunch.   Favorite dishes include the Maharaja fried chicken sandwich (conceived by another favorite local chef, Hemant Kishore), the Suckling Pig Benedict (sweet, savory, salty- it's got everything!), and the Pecan Pie Pancakes (go big or go home). Brunch fanatics burned out on the same basic dishes across town will be intrigued by the Mexican Egg, Poutine Waffle, and a super-spicy Muffalata sandwich. If you only have time to grab and go, anything warm with fresh blueberries will absolutely make your day, and I highly suggest pairing it with a super-strong (both in flavor and caffeine) iced lavender coffee.   If the dish names, descriptions, and photos aren't enough to lure you in, I'm happy to keep coming back for more myself. Despite the trek clear across town, I find myself suggesting this spot for a meetup every couple of weeks. Next visit, I plan to check out their afternoon tea!

-dADpQX3naDyi8djD4Mo2Q.text: Another breakfast/brunch spot in Henderson and it's mighty good.  Four of us had brunch here last Saturday.  It's rare that when we order so many different items that they'd all be spectacular but that's the case here.  Each one was as good as the previous item.  We started with some pastries.  This isn't something I'd order but there were four of us and we split everything.  The Madeleines were standouts.  Next came the PB&J egg biscuit with a fried egg, peanut butter mousse, bacon jam, and jalapenos.  We were then brought a vegan chocolate chip cookie to see how good that tasted.  Great!  Next up was deep fried bacon--thick cut Applewood smoked bacon with maple dipping sauce.  The maple dipping sauce has a tang that takes a bit to reveal itself on the palette but then stays for a while.    Next up were the brie pancakes--with the wonderful pancakes topped with melted brie, apples, and lemon zest.  One might not think the brie would work but it does.  Then came the Monte Cristo--brioche filled with country ham, swiss cheese, and fried in pancake batter, served with house jam.   Next up was my favorite dish of the brunch and I ate way too much of it and it still wasn't all finished--the Poutine waffle with cheese curds, French fries, gravy, caramelized onions, smoked pork, and scallions.  This is the only way to eat waffles--with gravy on fries with cheese curds and chunks of waffle throughout.  Not exactly Canadian but perhaps better!  Eh?  Next was a dish called Foie and Cherries--amaretto french toast, red wine soaked cherries, toasted almonds, and orange zest.  Excellent flavor to the wine soaked cherries and the foie was outstanding.  I don't generally order French toast but if I were going to, it would be this!  Naturally, we had to have some kind of dessert to finish the brunch items and we got a Mexican ice cream--fried house made ice cream, churro waffle, dulce de leche, orange zest, and cinnamon sugar.  As I said at the start, any dish is excellent.  However, my recommendation would be to skip the pastries and go straight to the poutine.

She had the gf French toast which was great and I had the gf bread with the crab Benedict. We finished with the creme brulee oatmeal which was super tasty!! We loved everything and will definitely be back. It is definitely a little loud during peak hours but so beautiful and fun! The service was great and they have a cute little selfie room!

UMMooVWwVZAr3hVXKttZzg.text: I wanted to love this place because it is SUCH a cool, and unique restaurant in the heart of a Henderson. They really spared no expense with the decor, and it looks like a restaurant you would find elsewhere. They even have a patio with fire pit, photo booth, and a tea room!!   We were lucky to have reservations for our large party for Sunday brunch, and were seated in the tea room. Others that came through the door without a reservation were told a 1.5-2 hour wait (holy!) The tea room is BEAUTIFUL and such a cool place to have a private event.   The menu is sizable and even though they have a handful of vegan options, it is very meat heavy (lots of dishes with chorizo and pork). They must not have a regular liquor license as all the cocktails are made with sake. I would've had a mimosa but felt the prices to be a bit steep for drinks. I do like that they have a proper espresso menu which is always a bonus in my book for breakfast/brunch places.  Now for the food, it was really just meh. We had a party of 10 and 2 really disliked their food (orders wrong or poorly cooked and even had them fix the items to no success), 2 really liked their food, and the rest just said everything was executed so-so. I went with the avocado toast and it was something I could've made (better) at home. The toast was super thin, the avocado was mushy like guacamole, and it just wasn't worth the $11.  I would like to give this place another chance once they get up and running properly (it is still a very NEW restaurant) but I won't be rushing back in the near future.

vGbXQoaBLdIFnyu22EOW9w.text: Prior to  coming to the stove again I wanted to plan for a high tea party with my friends for our January birthdays since they take reservations and I did their High Tea before in  their twisted tea room. ( this is where it got frusturating and confusing) So about a week and half ago I called asking to make reservations for their twisted tea room. I was told they don't do the High tea anymore because their was not enough demand for it. Understandable.  So I was redirected to a group sales coordinator Alisa (702) 499-2552 to make general reservations and she told me it was only for 8 or more. Ok...since I had a part of 6 will just be there since its a first come first serve. Told everyone to meet up at 10:00 am. Waited about 10 minutes. Ok. not bad. Our waiter, Alec tend to us.   So I vented to our waiter about my experience prior communicating about getting rid of the high tea. All of a sudden I am hearing new information that its 10 or more people to do the high tea????? So is the stove doing a high tea? and what are the limitations? where is the direction of the restaurant going? hmm. Our waiter said he will confirm with management but never clarified.   Moving  forward, I ordered a bunch of items on the menu. To Drink I ordered the cappuccino and their famous Unicorn Hot Chocolate. Super Sweet. Butternut squash ravioli. Very good. I did not care for the toast and over-easy egg. Butternut Squash ravioli should speak for itself. Then I ordered the Matcha French toast. Love how its not too sweet. But too much toast. Our server can sharpen his Anticipatory guest service skills. I asked for my water to be refilled but did not refill our waters at all. Over, all service was OK. It can be improved.  Leaving the restaurant my friend saw photo booth which I did not see the first time I was there. Little highlight.  Overall, I really don't know if I am coming back. Its one of those experience that  I did not gravitate. hmmm.

O781U_irtLzicMALytJ5eA.text: Finally Henderson is getting more fun brunch places (a lot of the hip/Instagram-type coffee shops/cafes seem to be in Summerlin). This place definitely has an Instagram-worthy atmosphere and nice ambiance, with a beautiful view of the Strip. I wish it were open at night because I think it would make a nice happy hour spot. This place seems like a perfect place to book private events. I love that they have a vegan menu for my vegan friends and would only recommend that they add a dairy-free pancake option or consider a vegan chik'n and waffles (both kids and adults would go crazy for this, it's easy, and there's only a few places in town that offer it). My waiter was super friendly and since a few of the menu offerings weren't available, my friend and I surprisingly got a discount on our bill. They also asked for our feedback at the end of our meal, so this is a place that definitely cares about their consumers. I'm interested to try their afternoon tea. Hopefully they have a vegetarian afternoon tea option. Thanks for a nice birthday brunch experience the Stove!

P4iiV8LRlVnYrOV9yODOJA.text: Well, don't heed the hours of operation. We came in at 2:40 and they apparently closed early due to lack of customers, even though they're supposed to be open till 4. So make sure to call ahead and be sure they're actually open, since the staff has the ability to shut down at will. Looks like I'm sticking to squeeze in from here on here  We went to your location yesterday the 7th, wasn't aware they moved the date of the 4th of July. Also your employee is the one who informed us they closed early due to no one coming in for the past couple hours.

oRLy6blL5bp1J5gbekdtXg.text: I was here for a birthday brunch for two of my coworkers - and what a surprise this place was.  Entering in I can hear the clinking of silver ware & the bellows of the patrons enjoying their meals as the food aroma hits me.   There's a very eclectic decor that is keeping my eyes busy as I wander around to find my friends.  The smiles of the wait staff is friendly and genuine and our champagne bottles are already open and ready for mixing with an assortment of fresh fruit juices: mango, orange, blackberry, & hibiscus.  Mango and hibiscus ended up being my favorite.  The food menu selection is just as eclectic as the vibe of the restaurant. I felt like it was a "stick to your ribs", country home style  cooking with with a bit of poshness mixed in from caviar topped deviled eggs with Parmesan truffle shavings to deep fried Fois Gras in waffles.  It was our first time here so we decided to try each other's plates and some of my favorites are: short rib empanadas, the butternut squash raviolis, and of course the Fois gras.  Mixing your own mimosas will be a challenge - we've had to order another round of napkins because of our clumsiness.   This is the perfect place for brunch, the food portions are appropriate and the staff is friendly.  I will be back again.  Cheers  :)

Ao2QpvuUA8ulS9hIJm66fg.text: Walked out.  Waited more than 30 minutes to get a matcha tea and after an hour of waiting for our food (which probably shouldn't have taken more than 7 minutes to cook), we walked out.    First, let me start by saying that it is highly likely that the terrible experience we had at The Stove was largely due to our server.  While he was initially timely in greeting us and taking our drink order (my wife had a coffee, I ordered a matcha tea), it took more than 15 minutes for my wife to receive her coffee (which tasted burned).  I never received my tea.  After 30 minutes, I asked the server about it and he said that they were just preparing it.  I mean, seriously, matcha tea is just powder and hot water.  Either way, I cancelled the order.  Thereafter, we never received any updates about our food or had any return service from the server other than a visit to our table 15 minutes later to tell us that our food was "three tickets" away from being fired.  20 minutes later, we decided to walk out.    As to our orders, I ordered the squished eggs and my wife ordered the egg tacos.  Seriously, these orders shouldn't have taken more than three minutes to cook, but we understand that there was a large crowd, so the ticket times would be a bit longer.  However, more than an hour?!?  I understand that this was largely likely an issue related to our server.  We saw a table that was sat 30 minutes after us receive their food after waiting about 20 minutes.  Generally, if a restaurant is in the weeds and running long ticket tickets, they have servers pass out small bites to patrons. For example, Sunrise Cafe passes out its grilled muffins, which is a nice treat. Given the issue with the tea, I do not think that the server put in the order.  Either way, the server reflects on the restaurant and this review.  On the bright side, after I informed the hostess that we were walking out and I wanted to pay for the coffee, they informed the server and the expo (likely the owner or executive chef) that we had the issue.  Apparently the food was ready and in the window.  We were going to refuse the food, but the server was insistent that we at least get to try the food despite the long wait.  The server packed up the food and bagged it for us to take out.    In terms of the actual food, it does taste damn good.  The price point of this restaurant is very attractive given the overpriced food at Craft Kitchen and the pricey brunch places like Jardin or Bouchon on the strip.  As to the tacos, they are basically Mexican street tacos with soft scrambled eggs and pickled red onion.  This dish should literally take like two minutes to make (the scramble was not the Gordon Ramsey scramble that would take much longer).  As for the squished eggs, it was quite delicious.  However, it's a two minute dish.    As noted, the server was likely the largest issue here.  I did see people walk out who enjoyed their meals.  The women sitting next to us did not seem to enjoy how long it took for them to receive their bill and then how long it took to run their check, but that was likely a server issue again.  The decor of the restaurant is nice, but FireFly should get the most credit for that.  After FireFly, a dinner place was in this location.  From what I saw, most of the TI was already in place from those two entities.    Either way, despite the food being quite good and the price point being extremely reasonably, we will not be coming back.  I can get better tacos at Las Cazuelas, go to Black Bear Diner or Egg Works for the usual breakfast fare, or any of the number of places around the valley that offers innovative "upscale" breakfast without having to wait more than 20 minutes to get a coffee, and almost 1.15 hours for the food.

ETykVvYjj4JkF3NWHhw8pw.text: Absolutely never again! The decor is cute and menu is unique but the service is excruciating slow. It took 15 mins to place a drink order. And an hour to get our food. I ordered oatmeal and my husband ordered a burger. I saw several dishes sitting in the window for 15 mins or better waiting on the rest of the tables orders. I watched my oatmeal sit there forever waiting on my husband's portion. As you can imagine, it was like cement by that time. After waiting an hour for our food, I was not asking for a replacement. The kitchen has serious issues getting food out in a timely manner. No one is moving with any sense of urgency. We have a breakfast date every Fri and we were looking for a few different places to try. We will never come back here. Never!

JaJ8hVnxBV9vU5Q53RG99g.text: The food was good and it has a very great view if you're sitting in the back. It's a bit pricey but it's somewhat worth it.

ezhFfAqI4ydv08nO3TlEGw.text: It has an eclectic feel, healthy food, and friendly staff. Good place to change it up and have lunch if you're tired of the same old diner scene and want a fresh atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Vegan section
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

kcVLXqlhPfY29wZu0ZqOOw.text: Upfront: Food was pretty good; service was AWFUL.   Details: plan for an extremely excessive wait. We put our names on the wait list with a "1 to 1:15 hour wait" and were seated after two hours. In the interim we tried to get a drink at the bar and simply couldn't - it was like being invisible. During this ordeal we were treated to the sounds of a member of the wait staff losing his damn mind about "how I can't deal with this anymore, this is f***ing bulls***" etc etc....  When we were finally seated no one came to take our order for 20 minutes. But someone did show up to slop a little water into our glasses and slam them onto the table of for us. He graced us with an eyeroll when we told him we didn't need one of said water glasses filled. That was top notch.   After our server finally showed up things got better. We put our whole order in at once because we were famished, but more importantly didn't want to risk another 20 minute interlude before seeing our server again. She was great by the way, but she never did ask us if we wanted to order follow up drinks. At brunch.   When the food showed up, it was about as advertised - delicious. However the chorizo on the "Mexican Egg" I ordered was not cooked. To be clear, it wasn't "undercooked", the entire inside was truly raw. Yum. Otherwise though, all the other dishes were good.   Bottom line, if you can get in the door without an absurd wait, and you didn't have to drive across town to try the place, the food is worth it. But if you check and find the wait is around an hour - just go to Eat downtown. The food is better, the service is excellent, and the people are happy.   Note to Management: fix your life. 1) do something about either your wait times (see next fix), or the math you're doing to give your estimated wait times. Preferably both. 2) you have an incredible amount of wasted space (potential seating, ie less wait time) in front of the serving counter which you are using as a finishing table for dishes, which your SERVERS ARE FINISHING! You are probably the only restaurant I've ever been to where a dish leaves the kitchen without being finished. And definitely the only restaurant that wastes 25 sq ft of dining space to do it. You are also storing a Mac book on said table. Must be the off-hours office? 3) general tidiness - the first thing I saw walking up to your place was the "mimosa garden" which still had an "under construction" sign...but was littered with empty plastic cups and champagne bottles. Classy.  Start prioritizing your customer experience over whatever dumb crap you're currently prioritizing.

F_1T6CVWpglHyvohuYVNrQ.text: Wonderful decor with a great view of Las Vegas (if you get the right seats).  Reasonably priced and a creative menu.  Comfortable seating arrangements.  Four of us visited on a Tuesday morning, so we were seated promptly. We ordered some pretty simple dishes: Grilled cheese with tomato soup, a traditional two-egg breakfast, waffle and chicken and a bowl of oatmeal.  Our server was mechanically effective, but didn't seem interested in building rapport with customers. In fact, every employee looked as though they were engaged in forced labor. There was no warmth.  Considering the restaurant was one-third full, the kitchen was slow.  We could see the waffle/chicken sitting on the cooks' window for a while before anything else came out.  Three of us were served together, but some of the food was lukewarm.  The last person to eat? Oatmeal. Yes, a bowl of oatmeal arrived several minutes after everyone else's dish.  Unless someone in my group insists, I don't foresee going back.  Too many other great places to have breakfast. One of my favorites is Rise and Shine in Southern Highlands, Bacon N Truffles at Eastern and Pebble is good, too. I think this restaurant is in the "new and shiny" category and the proximity to Anthem puts it adjacent to a lot of consumers who have limited neighborhood choices, thus the crowds.

SEZmGnmx9DbqSJMc2cW7fQ.text: It was a disaster. It was loud and the service was mediocre. The food was good but you can get good food all over town...without rude servers/management. I dont recommend! You wouldn't want to be there...fall on the slippery floor and then have the management call and threaten you afterwards....no bueno. Heads up.

yyPsCwHA_XiqHr3TEZ_OJw.text: I tried coming here a few months back and the wait was over an hour long so we left and went somewhere else. We ended up trying to go back on Black Friday which worked out perfectly. It was probably a 10 minute wait and that was because we had 5 people in our party this time.   The stove has a super comfortable feel and a great menu. I would definitely go back to try more things.   The reason I have it a 4 instead of a 5 is because when we asked how much a bottle of champagne was we were told $18 and when we got our bill it ended up being $22. Another reason is because it is a bit pricey.

bS7kDX5A3cbyQoejLr99lw.text: Finally made it to The Stove.  This is a must eat brunch spot so many delicious options.  My lavender latte was to die for!
