QUmPuYU012RpZhyhhY8SjA.text: The food took 2 hrs. The bottomless champagne was not bottomless. They are under staffed. Bathrooms were a mess and not serviced. The food was lack luster. The monte cristo was terrible all batter not enough meat. A complete let down.

N0BFIyaM-0l9vHXzCNrtWg.text: Overrated food, poor service and pretentious crowd. Wanted this to be our new local spot. Both times been treated like sh*t on arrival. Won't go again.

Id2mpoKDViD0BKYWBzURNA.text: Went here for my birthday brunch and it was amazing! Would totally recommend! They even gave me a free mimosa for my birthday! So kind!

Qit5MoVV2aKK_vJejLBQFA.text: This review is based on 3 visits to The Stove. The first visit was quite pleasant. My companion and I were the first arrivals of the early morning so we got the full attention of the staff. Initially I was wowed by the cute decor, unique location, and delicious food. It was a great experience all around. I told everyone about it and vowed to return.   My next visit was mid morning on a Saturday with one friend. I signed into the waitlist online and when we arrived they sat us pretty quickly. But it went downhill from there. We were ignored for about 15 min even though only half the tables were full, in a small restaurant. There seemed to be only 2 servers? We ordered quickly, but waited about an hour to get our food. Our beverages were never refilled, and the waiter didn't even check back to let us know things were backed up in the kitchen etc. the food was pretty good, although mildly overpriced. I gave them the benefit of the doubt thinking it was just a bad day.   My third visit was last Saturday and it will be my last. Again I signed in 20 min before arriving, and when we got there it again looked half empty. Yet they had us wait for almost 10 min. After sitting, my mother and I sat for another 10 min before I had to flag the hostess down to fill our water glasses. She asked if the server had been by, and I said no. Another five min later the server came and took our order. We waited AN HOUR. For breakfast. I have worked in food service and never in my life have I waited even 45 min for a breakfast meal - even in a jam packed restaurant - and this place had many open tables. After an hour I was getting antsy, as the server had not checked in with us ONE time or filled our glasses. I had to flag her down and kindly ask what was taking so long. She said it should be out in a few min. Another 10 min passed before we got our food. Overall the whole experience took nearly 2 hours which is just incredibly mind boggling considering how small the place is.   Additionally, we were sitting right next to the table where an employee was putting finishing touches on the food. He wasn't wearing gloves, we never saw him wash his hands, and on more than one occasion saw him swiping his nose and sweat with his hands.  While the food may be tasty, I feel that this place does not live up to the expectation. Terrible service kills any positive vibes it has going for it.

1yVP8p0bixGi4l74px6Uiw.text: Has so much potential but lord help you if you are expecting quick service and tasty food  We were excited to try the The Stove and put our party of 4 on the call ahead listed for a Saturday morning. We had a REALLY hard time finding the place as the signage is tiny and unreadable. The parking lot is also insane with dead ends and not a lot of options.  Once we made our way up the restaurant, we waited about 15 minutes for a table. The waiting area is terribly small and you end up feeling like you are intruding on the people seated at the tables next to you. It is not a pleasant way to start a meal.   When they went to seat us, they put our table of four at a two top table that they had shoved four seats at. The seats next to each other were literally touching and would have only worked for two small children, if that. When I pointed this out the hostess, she said that this was how they arranged the table with no indication that she found it unacceptable. We offered to turn the table diagonally so that it would work for four ADULTS and immediately what felt like the entire wait staff descended upon us to chastise us about how we were NOT allowed to shift the table. When I explained that there was no way four adults could sit at the table the way they set it up, they seemed to agree but said it was a fire hazard. It was then I realized that this was not their first rodeo with customers trying to sit comfortably at their impossible child table. We then were told if we wanted a different table (you know, one you could actually sit at) we would need to wait again. We should have left, but alas, we did not.   After finally being seated at a normal adult table, the experience continued on its downward trend. Service was absent, at best. The drink glasses are child sized and never refilled. The wait time was inexplicably long and the food was both bland as hell and way too spicy.   They are trying to be Craft Kitchen but fail at it spectacularly. And I have to agree with a fellow reviewer. I watched their expo guy using his bare hands to put garnish on. Not great.

HGChjwZ44L5ONcGgW6mjWw.text: Best brunch in the city in my opinion! Great menu options great service! This place uses fresh great ingredients. You'll be able to taste the difference from other places!  lots of healthy options  to choose from also!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Vegan burrito

4JC9MRv53tbiGtZycel9CQ.text: An absolute cute and adorable restaurant.   We dined here for breakfast we saw it was new and we'd never been.   Service was impeccable thanks to Colin our server. He was an absolute delight and came to our rescue by recommending a few items from the menu when we were indecisive.   We ordered the following:   * .. Croquet Madame ( the best I've had is in a little French bakery down in Palms Springs- so when I find this item on the menu I have to give it a go ) - this was pretty tasty. I don't like runny eggs, but it was perfect. I can probably do without the salad they offer. Maybe some fruit or hash brown would go better. Lol   * ..  Poutine Breakfast - combo of waffles, French fries, pulled pork, cheese curds, and gravy sauce *eyes widen* I know! Very interesting dish at best. This was a recommendation by Colin. We gave it a try and were pretty impressed. Mixture of sweet (waffles with syrup) and savory (French fries and pulled pork) . Needed a bit of spice, but we got that squared away with the hot sauce options they offered.   Overall great place. Super cute, service was great and entrees were delicious!   * .. Chilaquiles with green sauce - a bit salty, but I think that's because the tortillas were chips and not actual cut up tortillas .. But still very flavorful   * Punkin Pancakes : Sweeeet, but sooooo good. I wanted to order an additional batch and take these home so I can enjoy them with a nice warm coffee all cuddled up on my couch.

2NuUiMofjwBbl3GHKzo42Q.text: Oh yeah, I definitely love this place. A lot of my reviews are 4 or 5 stars because I typically only write reviews for places I truly love. I really love The Stove, the combination of the delicious food and the cute atmosphere runs at exactly my speed. It should be a 5 star review for me, but let me explain later why I rate this place with only 4 stars.  I found The Stove while scrolling through my Instagram feed and seeing a friend of mine saying she was "finally able to come here". Here pictures were cute, so I decided to check them out on Yelp. Everything looked great! The Stove's like 40 minutes away from where I live, but I will definitely be making the trek back here regardless. I'm definitely excited to come back here and try other things they offer. They're definitely a step up from The Egg & I but more chill than Mon Ami Gabi. A good middle. If they had a more central location, surely I'd be back sooner.  They have a hydroponics station set up, which is totally cool. I didn't get a chance to go look at exactly what they were growing there. Perhaps some of the salad that came with my meal came from there.  They managed to take the second floor of a building with big windows that overlooks the Valley and it's gorgeous. The decor is fancy and you absolutely feel like your in "The Brunch Scene" surrounded by champagne flutes and fluffy pillows and fleur-de-lis wall paper. It's a beautiful thing. Colin was our server, and he's the right person for the job - he's really nice and talkative! He helped us figure out to order too, which was great. I think he directed us to the right dishes, which was good since they have a pretty big menu.   I came here with my brother for a very late lunch (around 4 pm) on a day that we were both randomly off. Apparently we missed the hoopla earlier that day because it was the first day of school and all the mothers came here after dropping off their kids to have a bit of fun. Haha, I can only imagine how exciting that would've been. We were here when things were winding down, near closing. There was only one other table occupied when we were there. They have a lot of tables! That's a good thing. Hopefully when it's busier, that means there is less of a wait? They also have a patio, which intrigues me, just not at quite this high of an outdoor temperature. No, thank you! I'll try again in the fall when it cools down.  I ordered the Crabby Patty Benedict. It came with the usual two halves of the English muffin, each with a poached egg, hollandaise sauce and nice, big chunks of crab on top. Then under those, there were about 4 tablespoons of seasoned potatoes. Next to the Benedict, there was a small salad. In terms of the taste, wow. Everything on the place was soooo good. I wish there were more of a description for what goes in each of those parts of the dish. The salad was light, but whatever dressing they used was really good, I'm not even sure how to begin describing it other than "good". The potatoes were BOMB. Very well seasoned - not plain at all. Their potatoes are not the usual house potatoes that i was expecting. They were not crispy, but instead mushy - and in a good way! Like the almost-mashed potato. Yum. The Benedict was of course the star of the dish. Real crab on top, the hollandaise was perfect and the egg was poached nice.   Here's where I determined The Stove to be 4 stars. Honestly, when my plate came to me, I was hesitant that it was going to be enough to fill me and my instincts were right. Though everything tasted marvelous, I hardly left feeling full. I totally cleaned that plate and for $16, it just could have filled me up more.  My brother had the berry waffles. They were really good! I had a bite and the maple syrup they serve with them was delicious.  I also got a mango mimosa, which I was totally stoked about and it was great! They had a lot of other champagne cocktails that also had my eye. Next time.  All in all, I love the look and feel and taste of the place, I just need bigger portions. Still coming back though!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Berry Waffles and the Crabby Patty Benedict

jhfTnDBO4ZwL-LKwIffj1w.text: I absolutely love this place. I brought friends and family for brunch on Friday and ate there again on Monday it was that good. Everyone is very friendly and the food is unreal! There is a little bit of everything on the menu. The table side bananas foster was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

lSEBWX8Xt7iFdDjcCJ-r8Q.text: This is for the tea room only. I want to start off by saying the manager fixed the situation by comping the meal, but I still want to write this review on what happened and what went wrong.  I want to express after the overall experience it seems the establishment would not be good for high tea and the employees don't seem to understand high tea. First off, the tea room is a room nicely decorated in part of the restaurant. But I don't think it will ever be good for high tea, or afternoon tea, because it's supposed to be a refined, relaxed affair that you take slow. People could disagree with me here of course; it's a matter of preference. The loudness of the restaurant made the environment feel rushed and stressed as I had trouble getting the server's attention when something was wrong since I was shouting and they couldn't hear me. You also have to almost yell to order your food.  Now to the mistakes. We got the $18 afternoon tea ("FORMAL TEA") so that's $18 per person. The food tier came out before the tea, when they said the tea comes first, then about 5 min later you get the tier. The server put the wrong tea cups on the wrong dish in front of us, which the boyfriend and I promptly switched the tea cups to the right plates. Still not sure if this was on purpose since it's a little "mad tea" in here. That's not a big deal. The tier was missing our cucumber sandwiches, which I had to point out. The crumpets were gross... doughy, undercooked in the middle and oddly slightly damp on the outside. We informed them the crumpets were doughy in the middle and were promptly brought out doughier crumpets. When I cut the crumpets in half the knife was doughy.  We asked why there wasn't clotted cream and they were out of it. They offered us jam and butter - yes, shouldn't this all be brought to the table? The jam and clotted cream were mentioned on the menu. It was odd we had to ask for these things, like they were extra. There was no sugar on the table at any point, and no spoons at our table to stir our tea. I stirred my tea with my fork, since I asked for almond milk. Isn't afternoon tea all about the experience? I'd like to have everything on the table to sort of look at and soak in while I enjoy my tea. They wouldn't bring us our teapots until they were done steeping, so we were forced to wait with our tier until we got them. Other tea places I've gone to have implanted little hourglasses that they leave on your table so you know when your tea is done. It seemed like they were determined to leave as little on our table or something.   Other issues: -they charged us $9 for a refill on our tea. $9. They also didn't tell us it wasn't unlimited. You charge me $9 for a refill, you better be telling us beforehand.  - we were expecting a discount at least, since everything seemed to be going wrong, we kept having to ask for things they forgot and were obviously disappointed. Instead they charged us $9 for a refill and full price on everything else. -manager was walking around asking if everybody was happy. This was only when we were able to voice all our concerns at once and get the meal comped. -Desserts seemed cheap and not thought out. One nice one on a display spoon and a Madeline cookie. Considering the other items you get, (crumpet, scone) why would I want more bready items. Give me a chocolate mousse, a petit four, tiramisu! Not a Madeline cookie.  -one tiny sandwich cube per person. (They forgot the cucumber ones, so at first we only got the Brie and marmalade) I'm talking like a tiny square piece. See photo. Very underwhelming and kind of felt skimped -nothing actually wow'd me, the cucumber sandwiches were gross because the bread they used was thick af and the cucumber slices were like they were trying to cut down on expensive cucumber (sarcasm here) -one tea menu on table but two regular menus for 2 people -VERY LOUD  The good: -they've got hats you can wear to look the part in this afternoon tea experience -one server was good, one was gone 3/4 of the time -very hipster. Servers wear suspenders and plaid shirts.  -nice choice of teas. Tea was good. Seemed knowledgeable about the tea -Loved decor, especially on the restaurant side. That part was packed.   Manager gave us something to take back so he would personally make our experience better next time.  Update since manager responded: I just want to make everyone aware that I've never been charged $60 a person for tea anywhere in Vegas. There's a place in China town that charges around the same as this one.  Also, we ordered what was called the "formal tea"  Twisted tea on their menu is when you can get alcohol instead of tea. So that's kind of confusing

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Teapot
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Scones would be better warm, crumpets sucked really really bad...

9BiszN1tRcC32FlqpkBJHw.text: Great place for breakfast, brunch or lunch. Everything is so fresh and gourmet!  Just make sure you give yourself plenty of time. Even if you use the their online waitlist, the service once you get seated can take an EXTREMELY long time. Every time I go it seems there's been an excuse as to why the food service is so slow...server called out, a cook called out, something's not working in the kitchen, etc. get your Stove together and this would have been a 5 star rating!  But then again, as I've implied above, I keep going back. The food is just so darn good!

re4YMB7amKJlCqjuFfCaWQ.text: If your a Henderson local you already know about The Stove, I'am a out-of-town'r that got a tip about this place.  Wow, i would be 300 lbs if i lived close. The menu is unique to say the least and very fresh. They even grow there own herbs, right next to the kitchen.  I have always wanted to try chilaqulies and they have that with there shredded pork and your choice of red or green sauce, i picked green. Kind-a disappointed, came out quite dry and hard to find the sauce, the pics i have seen have the sauce all over it, the pork was great, but the whole thing was very dry.  I do recommend The Stove and if your looking for a "different" style breakfast you won't be disappointed.   If you order what i had, ask for extra sauce.

S5apEovrhsUxs_O23EmH6g.text: Came here for brunch this past weekend and it quickly became a new favorite spot! The food was delicious and the service was phenomenal as well. The only downside is the long wait but I'd suggest waitlisting early in order to avoid a long wait.

FGYO3PZxvan7EgoTG4Qgtw.text: I went for brunch for one of my friends birthdays. It was nice and cozy and the menu was pretty good. I got the brunch chiliquilles (I think that's how you spell it). It was pretty good but WAY to dang salty. I decided to order a side salad to take the saltiness away.. probably should've ordered fruit instead though. Our waitress was so nice and was frequently at the table asking us how we were or if we needed anything. It was an overall good experience. I would go back again but maybe order something else

mNSYaipokSMHeqcyHCgUcQ.text: Ok, I finally was able to pull myself away from ordering the breakfast items here and try lunch items.  LOL  The Dirty BLT is awesome, and the pork sandwich is even better...generous amount of pork and the apple butter is a great touch.  And chef Antonio always seems to find time to stop by and chat and make sure that you're happy.   Oh, and what used to be more of a secret, but word is getting out - Pop Up Dinners!  They transform the place on select evenings for a truly unique dinner experience complete with cocktail/wine/beer pairings.  Nothing in Henderson like it.  I work on the Strip and I'm now telling tourists to make the trip to The Stove, it's that good!

Y9DWDQAcsf2va1hPHbTjWg.text: Great Food and very kid friendly!  Coffee with cotton Candy was my favorite but my kiddo loved the unicorn hot coco with birthday pancakes. There was so many yummy items on the menu the any one could find what they crave. Make sure to put your name on the waitlist before heading over or your wait time will be long. This place can get very pack. Look forward to coming back

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

FfbM8VzyYZH58fzy0l64qw.text: I had been here for tea and had a great experience and was waiting till I came back for food too white a review. Wish I could speak about the food but wasn't able to get any, and after being treated like we weren't valuable customers I won't be back to try again.  I called at 11:50 and asked about the wait time. Was told it was an hour so I put myself on the list and we waited an hour (an hour that were could have gone somewhere else) and arrived. I read told that even though I had been on the wait list for an hour that it would still be another 40 min to an hour. SERIOUSLY???? 2 hour wait for food? I guarantee the people standing waiting were not waiting for that long. When I questioned the hostess I was told "the wait is always that long. It doesn't matter if you put your name on the list". Then why the hell did you tell me on the phone that if I put my name on the list it would be fine. Horrible

U_E6ochunROPWtNgOYznow.text: Only 4 stars because the service could be improved. We went on a Wednesday around 10:30a and there were less than a dozen people in the restaurant and it was S-L-O-W. But what they lack in service, they make up for in delicious food! My hubs got the farmhouse which was two eggs, potatoes, toast and choice of meat for a great price. I got the brussel sprout has and omg - it was fantastic! Definitely try it out but don't be in a rush to get somewhere.

ACw0yLe13maVsxgW0TqDOg.text: SERVICE: EXCELLENT   DECOR: Very L.A., Melrose loved it!  FOOD: Probably will never go back.  Maybe I had high excpectations, due to a 2hr wait  the prior sunday.  Long waits mean  good food right? .. must be excellent! Well no it wasn't.  The food wasn't terrible but I would say not good, but okay.   I had the  *Chiliquilies ($14) our waitress said it was what they are known for and their customers love it.  I had other choices in mine but went for the house favorite.   My boyfriend had the *Brussel Hash ($13 ) the sweet potatoes were mushy everything was mushy and his portion was very small.  And the flavors nothing stood out.   As for my *Chiliquilies good portion however, the chips were not just mushy but they were stale. I get it the Mole would make it wet but the parts that were dry was stale. The pork was dry and didn't have much flavor and there were loads of salt too salty for me and I enjoy my fair share of salt.  To make things worse it was luke warm more towards cold. I was sad. I love eating and I love putting amazing flavors into my mouth.  It wasn't worth the calories. I sooo wanted this place to be my new brunch spot.   Maybe I'd come back for coffee or tea just for the ambiance.   Btw sign is small and is hard to find it's upstairs.

szVLCeVmgR8rbmc4fnWtiQ.text: *update: finally got a text, almost 2 hours later*  Was excited to try this place but I guess not this time around. I was advised I would receive a text message & the wait was about an hour & a half for a party of 5. We waited an hour & 40 minutes for a "text" that we never received. Left annoyed & hungry. Wish I could give this place 0 stars for their bad customer service.

XauY8GS73CvPcuBODA0C1A.text: Stopped by for weekend brunch. The whole experience was meh. The place was certainly very busy, but also extremely noisy. The service was pretty good--we got our drinks and food fairly quickly. The menu was on stapled pieces of paper; a bit strange. There was a lot to choose from. What I ordered was OK--not great, not horrible either. Not sure if I had a great enough experience to come back.

xz1V_Km_Jp-H7YVFmSD7Mg.text: Ok the service is as slow as maple syrup being poured though a strainer. The food is way overpriced, ie $17 dollars for 3 small breakfast tacos? Seriously WTH? There are breakfast/brunch places on every corner these days and this place is on the bottom end. Forgettable to say the least, won't be back for sure.

82EWp22c9CzhvOrfM9viqA.text: Let me start by saying I've been to this place several times before today where the service has always been a little slow. However, I've always overlooked that because the decor and food was always great.   Today was a totally different experience. First I didn't go online and put my name on the wait list. Huge mistake! As a walk in we were put on the end of the list, were told it would be a 30 min wait. No biggie right?!? However, it took over an hour to get a table while all that time saw group after group walk right in and immediately sat down. I'm all for online check in, but when you have a paying customer live in your establishment you would think they would do something to honor your wait time.   Once we were seated my family ordered our meals right away (you know, since we had over an hour to look at the menu). My usual favorite "Avocado Toast" came out and was 1/2 the size it normally was, 2 out of the 3 pieces of toast were hard as a rock while the other was soft and barely toasted. My husband did not get the bacon that came with his meal, and when it finally arrived at the table was completely raw. My sons sausage was burnt to a crisp and barely edible.   We were sure to order one of their cinnamon rolls for a dessert and promptly asked for it to come out after our meals. I guess that was too much to ask since it never showed up.   I'm not sure if the place has just gone down hill since it opened, but I'm not sure I will be back. Which is very disappointing!

X7v0xxY10ELek2wOn1lY_Q.text: Ask Darcy about Dirty Dining 2 weeks after my first brekkie at the Stove.  No more....

zivCmdMIzOGJSpUmxhFMkw.text: Don't waste your time or money here. The service is not only slow but incredibly rude. Unbelievable that the owner would employ such terrible waitresses. My boyfriend and I almost walked out when our server, Rachel, threw my silverware onto the table in front of me. And the food? Zero flavor. Anyone who praises the food here must have grown up on fast food. What a waste of space this restaurant is.

UpHfiA_C_bPpN_dxqWJIoQ.text: Lovely space! Limited parking but worth seeking some out. The menu is infused with so much flavor and freshness, so it may take a moment to receive your food from this scratch kitchen but it's worth the wait. My faves are the empanadas and Monte Cristo! My niece loved the unicorn hot chocolate and soup and grilled cheese combo. Tea service available also!

45sTzAA2jY1rC-jMIFmJJw.text: Cute new brunch spot on the edge of anthem. The decor is great and the menu sounds amazing on paper. However this spot definitely has some kinks to work out.   Came in on a Tuesday and got immediately seated. Service was slowwww. Took 10 minutes to be greeted and another 5 minutes for water to be poured. The server had disappeared for a bit and when we had asked about some questions about menu items, she wasn't very knowledgeable   Eventually we had ordered the Salmon Benny, Street Taco Benny and a cinnamon roll along with the focus juice and lavender iced coffee. Everything took an insane amount of time to come out and everything came out separately. Drinks were nothing special. Food was flavorful and tasty however they were both lukewarm when we had received it. Looking back at the line there were 3-4 expos/runners just chatting while the food got cold.   Working in a restaurant and seeing how this place ran service wise was infuriating. Not worth the price  to receive cold food and slow service.

8Qs3AwGuM0CKXn0GtPiwRQ.text: I really enjoyed our visit to The Stove. I had the Foie and Waffle and it was quite extraordinary. The Foie was wonderfully deep fried and served over warm and buttery waffles. If it wouldn't clog my arteries, I would eat it every day! My boyfriend had the Chilequiles which looked good and had great flavor but was just a bit too spicy for the average person. All in all, The Stove is a great choice for Brunch!

VQliqwnrgjkMtH6J0ob-Xw.text: This place is insanely amazing! Best biscuits I have ever had. Try them with the orange marmalade! Everything I've had here is a 10-10! Kids ordered white chocolate pancakes and the attention to detail for pancakes was insane! You may wait a little bit for your food BUT it is well worth the wait!!!

tdt4M17R-2ToQN0NflSkng.text: Easily the best breakfast/brunch place ever! They also have teatime which I'm dying to try!  The flavors are eye rolling good!! On weekends there is a bit of a wait make sure to call ahead to get on the wait list. We went today on a Monday and got right in. Everything we've ordered is exceptional, the eggs Benedict and the monte Cristo are a few of my favorites! The wait staff is awesome and make us feel like family. Ohhh and the decor is adorable! You'll feel like you're in a magazine! If you're looking for a delicious brunch place with great service this is the place to go!

ytsAI5OHEkvPAn8hWNn68w.text: Took someone for their birthday because I heard of the unicorn hot cocoa (very sweet, it's got cotton candy on it, but it looks so cool for a birthday brunch) and flambeed bananas foster pancakes.  The bananas foster was flambeed table side! It was a great birthday show! Then we had the trio of bacon and sausages.   The presentation was sophisticated and you can see the strip (it's small) from the window views! Wanted to order everything! Made me think of Los Angeles or Palm Springs restaurants or Strip places.  Very sophisticated brunch atmosphere way out in Henderson. Very reasonably priced.  Can't wait to go back for eggs benedict and the sausage trio again with gluten free toast and homemade marmalade!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Flambeed bananas foster pancakes tableside! Great show for a birthday brunch!

4p3_knsiKa7orEoItKPddw.text: One Friday we decided to try out The Stove since we read how crazy Sat/Sun could be.  When we arrived, we were greeted right away and sat down.  We ordered the following: 1. Pastry basket - half portion of scones, cookies, cakes: did not taste fresh.  Will not order again unless something changed. 2. Mexican egg - the egg was good, the potatoes underneath where the egg sat was blah. 3. Crabby Patty Benedict - first bite was good, the rest was uneventful. 4. Carbonara - salty.  Service - 5 stars Food - 2.5 stars Ambience - 5 star  We will give return to try other stuff and hopefully can upgrade the level of stars for the food area.

8AWFtnz4NZhP1uvP2nZ4_A.text: Very cute and quaint brunch spot. My friend and I came across an article discussing this fairly new restaurant in the valley. We saw they had bottomless mimosas and mimosa bongs and we were sold. The wait for two was 25-30 minutes. We had to of showed up right after the rush. There were only 2 parties ahead of us and they sat within a few minutes of our arrival.  The hostess wasn't very personable/talkative. We asked a few questions and got a pretty short and bland response for each. It wasn't very busy in the moment, we were the only ones waiting. Other than that, she got us seated within the quoted time and helped the server by starting our drink order.  Rachel was the sweetest. They were out of a few drinks and she was very apologetic when three of my friends choices were shot down. When faced with the hardest decision, what to eat, she was able to help us out with time to spare.  We decided on the bottomless mimosas, hibiscus and mango -- definitely the best appetizer on the menu -- and the BGR burger, add egg, side jalapeno bacon. If I could choose one thing in the world to eat every day of my life, it would be this burger. They offer their own hot sauce, add it to the ketchup, voila; you're welcome! I couldn't help but tell everyone about that burger and hot sauce for the following few hours; now I can't stop daydreaming about it. We will certainly be back soon!

fZ7xWSDQioXnsFi92YSGuA.text: Definitely a cute breakfast/brunch spot ---- Be aware that yes, it does get busy and expect to wait a bit to be seated. I do recommend putting your name on the list online while driving over (to save some wait time). Downfall is there's not much room to wait around either. Yes, it also gets loud but it's more so because there's a lot of workers and customers inside so what can a person expect?   Me and my friends went to the bar though to start bottomless mimosas so as long as there's an open bar and you're with good company, time passes quick. Our bartender served us 2 whole champagne bottles immediately and by the end of our 2 hours, we had tried all the mix ins/juices and there's none that I didn't like. Hibiscus and peach were the favorites though!  My friends and I ordered family style and shared a bunch of dishes: Mixed devil eggs, short rib empanadas, birthday pancakes, duck hash, suckling pig Benedict and poutine waffle. No complaints and happy with everything we ordered. The truffle deviled egg was split between 3 people and I wish I had one to my self ---- so rich and definitely memorable! Everything else was tasty and they weren't stingy with their meat dishes unlike other breakfast spots.  If the bottomless mimosas or yummy food doesn't attract you then maybe the friendly, prompt staff will. Unlike other restaurants where only one server is designated to certain tables, all Stove workers were sure to tend to our needs. Our waters were constantly filled and we were always asked if we needed anything. There was a small accident that happened during our visit (one that I will not say but nothing horrible -- it actually made everyone crack up, haha) but the staff went above and beyond to make it up to us when my friends and I laughed about it all and didn't mind. Head chef and owner brought us complimentary champagne flutes to end our meal and let's just say my friends and I all left happy, drunk and bloated from stuffing our mouths.   10/10 would recommend and will definitely come again when I'm back visiting Vegas!

1zKuXjqjqwKgGOrLSrie_w.text: For me, the service you receive is just as important as the food you eat. Our experience did not start off well. I added myself to the waitlist online before leaving the house. It only shows you the first 7 people so I called to see how long it would be and was told about 30 mins.   When we arrived at the Stove the hostess was looking down writing something for several minutes while we were standing there being ignored. A quick acknowledgement and hello would have been nice. I did really like the decor and atmosphere inside. Its really "homey" and warm feeling. Unfortunately I had lots of time to look at it as we sat there for quite a while waiting to be seated even with multiple open tables. This leads me to believe they were short servers or kitchen staff. Several tables remained open the entire time we were there even when the wait time was over an hour. The phone kept ringing and I think the hostess was just overwhelmed and needed some help up front.   Once seated our server Marco was over within a few minutes. He was friendly and welcomed us to the restaurant and went over the menu which has lots of interesting breakfast options. I ordered the matcha tea which I was told they ran out of two days before. We went with the croque madame and the flap jacks. The food came out in a reasonable amount of time. The croque madame was served with a side salad. Why? Who wants a salad for breakfast? Some sort of potatoes would have been a perfect accompaniment. The sandwich itself was good. The flavors were excellent but the cheese was not melted at all.   The flap jacks were three large pancakes served with whipped cream and berries. They were too dark and burnt tasting so we told Marco who had them remade. When they came out again it was the same thing so we didn't eat them.   Between the front of house issues and the food, this was definitely a two star experience "Meh Ive experienced better". I am giving them 3 stars however because they took the pancakes off the bill which I greatly appreciate. As a new business I am definitely going to come back and give them another chance so I can try out some more dishes from the menu and hopefully the service will be improved.

TSgoaMOb6vg0no5PJsBMsg.text: Yum! First off - S.O. C.U.T.E. Great drink list, but I settled for a vanilla latte - did I say settle? Hardly. It was legit the best iced lattes I'd ever had! I drank it in like 3 sips Lol  We started w the Shortrib Empanadas and they were awaesome! With such great menu options I was torn on what to order for food, I went with the frittata, which was good but I had high hopes and was let down by my choice. I really should've gotten the savory french toast as it was more unique and that was what I was looking for. It was the roasted vegetables that sold me on the frittata, but were also the biggest let down as there were not as much veggies as I had expected by the description.  My mate got the Suckling Pig which was super delicious! We were also given a glass of Hibiscus Iced Tea to try and that was really good too (but nothing held a candle to my latte and we both got one for the road).   We were in the area the next weekend and were upset that we wouldn't be able to get there before closing as we were psyched to try more of their awesome offerings - definitely keeping this place bookmarked for future trips to Hendertucky!

643nFTuSJUFnS5uJlO1BNA.text: The experience was great! Walked in and greeted by a girl,summer I think, said there was a wait. But sat us on a nice little waiting area and we were able to get drinks from the bar.  We had fun in the selfie booth and cute hats.   Once sat we noticed Great views and seen amazing food fly by us.  Our server had told us that food takes a minute. But hey, if I wanted a normal breakfast I would have went to egg works. We ordered the egg white frittata and kids brunch box. I will say worth the wait. We finished with a orange and cranberry muffin, my new fav!    Service was great, Can't wait to come back with girlfriends and see what this place is really made of. My new favorite spot!

P7HPV_Sh4LyE8iJnMqOOZQ.text: NEW FAVORITE BRUNCH SPOT From the incredible staff to the gorgeous presentation of their phenomenal food. If you plan on eating here I first would recommended making a reservation because this place is always packed and parking can be a pain in the butt. First off this place took me by complete surprise! Yelp recommendation(always coming in clutch) and one for the books! First off I would like to say thank you to the Chef. Who came and dropped off our food as well as answered all of our questions, which I had plenty of! Personally we started off with the Avocado toast which was absolutely perfect. The bread was toasted perfectly. The balance of spices and herbs was incredible , best avocado toast I've ever had (so good I forgot to take a picture) I ended up with the chilaquiles which were nothing short of spectacular. Every ingredient was able to be appreciated without being over powering. And the side of salsa was to die for! Perfect amount of kick and flavor! My friend ordered the chicken and waffles and I must say I probably finished 40% of her dish. You can always taste the quality of the batter when added something else to the bite(10/10). The chicken was cooked to perfection with the breading being on point leading to every single bite being extraordinary. From the outstanding presentation of the food to the amazing taste To the best lighting I've ever seen in a brunch spot  To the taste of the food being so incredible it's hard to walk out from being so full To the chef who takes pride in his work. Truly amazed! Thank you yelp for the recommendation and thank you Chef for your time   The Playlist here by the way

HsT65WkCKbbG5H07jEyjYA.text: I thoroughly enjoyed this fairly new breakfast/brunch spot high up in the Henderson/ Anthem area.  The second story location is bright and airy; the decor chic yet classic, and wait staff is definitely a little hipster.  I loved the live herb wall near the kitchen that actually gets used.  I also loved that the prep/expatiator station looked like someone's home, complete with bookshelves above the pass-through window.     They definitely put a lot of thought into the menu.  A little something for everyone- from traditional to vegan- with their creative dishes.  They also have a tea lounge and a large selection of decadent pastries if you are so inclined.  Short Rib Empanada ($8) braised short rib, cheese, chilies, cream, and salsa w/ black beans.  Perfection!  The shell had a perfect crunch while the filling was soft and very flavorful  Cinnamon Roll ($4) Simply amazing.  They bring out the cinnamon roll, and then pour the delectable icing over it table side.     Dirty BLT ($11) Jalapeno Bacon, tomato jam, avocado, fried egg.  OMG, that jalapeno bacon was awesome.  I could eat that every day!  Street Taco Benny ($14) Carnitas, black beans, pickled onions, and salsa on 3 small tortillas with 2 eggs and hollandaise sauce on top.  I ordered mine sans hollandaise.  Delicious.  The pickled onion really added something and the carnitas were so tender and tasty.   Regular Iced Tea & Coke ($4 ea) - This price is a little excessive especially considering they were stingy on refilling the small glasses.  I had to ask for refills after they sat empty through most of our meal.  This was consistent with our somewhat slow and inattentive service, but we were having a nice time and didn't mind too much.  Another reason I removed a star is that I ordered the Cereal Milk Yogurt ($5) as a starter, but it never arrived (even after our entrees) and I had to ask for it to be removed from the bill.  All in all, I would definitely still return.  There are a bunch of items on the menu I need to try!

WEGAHZavo2a--WbOWYjyzg.text: Just flat out perfect, a consummate breakfast, hightoned yet hearty. The stove has a bright airy ambiance and a knowledgeable and friendly wait staff.   I've sampled; the Carbonara, house made pasta, tradition egg cheese sauce, guanciale, egg up, grilled country bread; the Squished Egg, sunny side up egg, greens with vinaigrette, bacon, caramelized cheese curd, squished on a kaiser roll, and the Eggs and Guanciale, with grilled asparagus, pickled tomatoes, poached eggs, and guanciale vinaigrette. All the dishes were delicious and demonstrated culinary excellence.    The cherry on top of these meals has been an out of this world macha tea latte, creamy and satisfying .

piT2pgEEkFEHWQSpWV7Xcg.text: Went for brunch and this place was positively smackin. Lively and tasty. Even had live music and homeboy was throwin it down.   Had the Squished Egg sandwich, cake batter scones, vegan chocolate chip cookie (truly better than the OG), lemon raspberry muffin (please for your sanity get it), poutine waffle, Country benny, and Dem Fancy Egg (comes in a smoker!!!!! Like what what). Along with lattes and bottomless mimosas. Everyone absolutely loved their food and I would love to come back and try more of their splendid lil brunch menu (jk, it's not so little. Prepare yourself to make some serious crisis decisions when deciding between 8 things you want) or to try their beer menu.   Their home potatoes are rad too. And they have a vegan menu.   Make a reso!!!   PS. Mike (our server) was the bomb. You da best.

MuuaifM4t2udX3MQdI1g4g.text: Ok so read my review to understand my score.   Part 1. this is factoring in 2 different experiences with in the last month with the exact same or worse timing. IT IS THE SLOWEST ticket turn times in the world... be prepared to order your food and sit for an hour with out food. Today we ordered our 1.4 year olds food first and even that (one egg, fruit, and bacon) took over 40 minutes to come out in fact we had to beg for it. The waiting is terrible. The service from our waitress today was pretty good she did catch a mistake and send it back to cooks before we saw it which was nice but if she was a little more attentive we would have ordered more drinks....   Part 2. The Food  It was delicious!! I had the chicken sandwich which was filled with amazing flavor and spice and I loved the egg on top. My wife had a pecan pancake (which was luke warm or cool  at best but tasted great!) and Eggs Benedict which where fantastic.   So the foods great, the wait time is atrocious and the service is average... if your taking kids good luck! If you have all day to wait around this will at least be a great meal.... would I go back... eh idk maybe maybe not... would I recommend it...probably not! Chances of frustration are high...

VzbHgno0mRkAlc4hTdwYIA.text: Came here for brunch and immediately I was impressed with the ambience of the Second Story restaurant on the edge of anthem.  After getting seated I was very impressed with the menu and drink selections and was puzzled on which ones to give a try.  Finally went with the cappuccino to drink which was by far the best thing I had in the restaurant. Delicious l!  To eat I ordered the sausage and pancake on a stick and the empanadas. The sausage pancake batter and sausage was decent. The mustard and syrup dipping sauce was very odd though. I think they should just have both in seperate cups rather than mix them. The empanadas were nice and crispy but pretty ordinary in flavor and also quite small. So if you have many people at your table order at least three of these appetizers.  After that I ordered the suckling pig Benedict which looked amazing when it was plated  up in front of me. The flavor however for this Benedict was average and void of any substantial flavor. The poached eggs came out almost well done like a boiled egg. So tell them how you want your yolks when ordering.  The service here was pretty slow and it seemed as if these waiters were overwhelmed and still getting broken in to this restaurant.  The manager here did comp our meal since they messed up our order but I probably will give this place one more try in the future to give some of their pastries and definitely the pecan pie pancake a try.

qq-b_B9iTTSXapNrV2x6Xg.text: We called in for a party of 15 for a Saturday birthday brunch...for a newly opened restaurant....they're doing it right, I'm a fan!  Stove Service:  Our server was on it as she took care of the orders for 4 kids and 11 adults like a pro.  3 of us went for the bottomless mimosas and after seeing we were pros, she smartly left 2 bottles and a carafe of juices at the table. Well done.  Stove cuisine: We sampled the corn dogs for appetizers and they were flavorful.  The blueberry scones and the assorted pastries selected by the chef were delicious and fresh.  I had the monte cristo and it was delicious.  The bread was battered perfectly, tasty and not too sweet.  I wish there was just a little bit more ham, but overall it was excellent.  Also, the salad that came with it was extremely fresh and complimented the sandwich well. The kids meals came served in lunch boxes which was a nice touch, packaging is everything.  The portions are on the generous end but not everbearing.  Stove ambiance:  Pastel colors utilized throughout the walls and the chandeliers felt warm and inviting.  The flowers and foliage kept the dining area fresh as well.  The total ambiance makes for a very nice dining experience.  This is the 3rd restaurant I've seen in this location and I think the Stove is going to be just fine.  Overall this is definitely a brunch place I'd visit again especially with the bottomless mimosas at $18 and the tasty food.  See you there, enjoy! =)

IAGDFXQcXoltsV6RH2nO3A.text: The Stove is Cookin!  I met a few friends here for lunch to try some delicious options. They have a diverse menu with some unique fusion ideas.  The spacious dining and open kitchen area has plenty for your eyes to take in.  The inviting area makes it quite comfortable. Fully equipped with their own selfie staged area, pop in for some quick pics! I would probably recommend doing this before the food comes out so we don't have food in our teeth.  On to the food~ Their version of the Scottish egg truly showed their fusion style with the egg wrapped in chorizo on a bed of potatoes. It is lightly drizzled with crema for a delightful flavor all around.  Definitely a great start to the meal.  The Muffuletta sandwich is an Italian sandwich filled with a spicy jardiniere.  It's delicious but fair warning... very very spicy.  The Maharaja sandwich is a fried chicken sandwich with an Indian flair of spice.  Every bite was scrumptious.  Both sandwiches are worth ordering again.  My hope is The Stove sticks around for a while.  I'm anxious to work my way through the exciting menu.

2x7SXwFBbT_4J0FDMEIQkg.text: So I've been making a list of breakfast/lunch places that I need to check out, and this was the first place on that list. Met a friend for brunch about a week ago to check this place out.  I like the vibe, very hip and trendy. We got there around 12:30 on a Thursday and were seated right away. Had a server come over right away and get us some drinks. Since I was headed to work, and my friend on lunch break, we ordered quickly. She got the pancakes and I got the avocado toast. We decided we would each share.  The food took a long time to come out. And that is the only reason I gave it a 4 instead of a 5. The server did check on us frequently while waiting which was nice.  The food itself is presented well and you could tell the ingredients were super fresh. The pancakes were topped with fresh blueberries, raspberries and blackberries. The pancakes themselves were large, fluffy and delicious. The avocado toast was so good! I love  a good poached egg and it was a nice touch to the dish.  I'd definitely eat here again.

afJf4HIpihjvwM6DNRSGxA.text: Wow!!!!i have  been here a few times and it just gets better and better . Love this place!!!!! The place is so nice and quaint. And the best part the food is Eggscellent!!!!! Presentation is a must . Some of the dish ware is just incredibly beautiful with the addition of how they present it and the taste of food. The view is beautiful as well ( it was perfect because it was actually snowing today ) . I definitely do recommend this place. Aaaahhhhh sooooo good. A must try in Henderson!

W8fWa4CkT77QvCH7EbJwdQ.text: My friend and I came here for brunch last weekend after one of my coworkers had recommended this place to me. The Stove replaced Standard and Pour, which sat on the 2nd floor of the building. We had arrived around noon and the place was packed. After we walked up the stairs, the hostess asked if we had been on the online wait list. APPARENTLY THEY HAVE AN ONLINE WAITLIST... BUT ITS NOT ON YELP ! Go to their web site and you'll see a link to the waitlist ! Being labor day weekend, we were told the wait was 60 - 90 minutes, BUT if there were seats at the bar, we are free to sit there instead. With no particular preference on seating, we went to the bar and lucky us, seats had just opened so we had sat down on the far left seats.   We were greeted by the bartender. My co-worker had recommended the "French Press Coffee" as well as the "Suckling Pig Benedict", so those were the things i got. My friend had gotten the "Egg Tacos" with an "orange juice". Being a holiday weekend, the restaurant was super busy. The bartender was making drinks for the entire restaurant while serving us and making sure we were ok. If anything, it was entertaining for us to watch everything happening around us. The entire meal took about 2 hours but at least it was entertaining. Accidental spills to seeing how many people it takes to open a champagne bottle, it was not a boring 2 hours, to say the least. Our food took about 45 minutes or so to arrive, right when my friend had mentioned she was starting to feel really hungry. HA perfect timing  "French Press Coffee" - I did not expect to get the entire "pitcher", container.. whatever you call the french press contraption. You can get at least 5 cups of coffee out of this thing. Oh man ! Thats too much coffee for 1 person HAHA ! Typically i drink my coffee with some half & half/creamer but i decided to try it before i asked for some. I've never had french press coffee either so it was a new experience. Surprisingly, even without anything, it wasn't acidic and was pretty smooth. Don't know if its because the type of coffee they used or because it was brewed with a french coffee press... who knows ??   "Suckling Pig Benedict" - smoked pig, biscuits, poached eggs, brown butter hollandaise, house bbq, and jalapeno chips  Besides the mildly overdone poached eggs where i didn't get my ooey gooey flowing all over the place yolk... everything else tasted really good. The side salad with some dried orange colored something (i couldnt tell what it was) and some super soft flavored diced potatoes were both good as well... When i think suckling pig, i think of the baby suckling pig made chinese style, butterflied open w/ thin crispy skin... MMM LOL ANYWAY ! so this "smoked pig" has more of "stringy" aspect to it like a braised meat but was flavorful and tender. Biscuits was fresh and hot. Good amount of food.   "Egg Tacos" - chorizo and egg, potatoes, salsa arbol, crema, oaxaca cheese  3 small tacos on corn tortillas with a egg and chorizo scramble w/ potatoes topped with sour cream and cheese... Whats not mentioned is the pickled white and purple onions. My friend didn't like the pickled onions but i think it helps to cut through the "heaviness" of the egg and chorizo as well as the creaminess of the sour cream and cheese. Quite "tiny" in terms of amount in comparison to the benedict for the same price.   Overall, atmosphere was lively and fun to watch. The bartender, (Abby? Annie? Ally?) was super nice. She was SOOOO busy but she still tried to make attempts to chat with us and check up on us. She opened at least 10-20 bottles of champagne during our brunch.   I'd recommend this place for people to try. Nice, chill atmosphere. Not sure if its a regular thing or just during brunch. A guy was playing guitar and singing live in the middle of the restaurant as well. Occassionally, a waiter will roll out a cart for tableside banana foster pancakes.

-xaklzwfcWCsxP2xiueCNQ.text: Oh my GOSH!  I had breakfast at the Stove this morning with a friend. Beautifully decorated. Polite, attentive and friendly staff. Fresh, beautiful and delicious food. Only suggestion is to get better signage. I am looking forward to bringing my wife and friends soon.

Eo1MtQnCAaMsMmbUdXu2JQ.text: First let me start off-be prepared to wait...a long time. We waited over an hour for a table of 4 for brunch on a Saturday. We enjoyed some cocktails while we waited, but they don't really have room for people to wait.   Secondly, while we were waiting, along with everyone else who was waiting, I noticed that the whole other half of their restaurant was empty! Saved for people who want to have tea. Now this makes no sense with how many people were waiting and the amount of time that people were waiting for them to have half of their restaurant unavailable!   Food: everything we had was delicious. We ordered a bunch of different items and shared everything. We started with the empanadas, Mexican ice cream, and sausage corn dogs. All three were very delicious. The empanadas have a great spice. My favorite of the three. Next we ordered the churro waffles, suckling pig Benedict, and the street tacos Benedict. The churro waffle was very similar to the Mexican ice cream dish. The two Benedict's were so delicious.   I will definitely be back to try more of their food, because everything was delicious. But I do hope they work out the wait times and open the other area of their restaurant during busy brunch weekends because otherwise it's a zoo in there.

Db3Tn2VoOgP6JFvS9PYCmg.text: Was super excited to check this place out as it seemed to be hyped up. When I walked inside on the second floor, the restaurant was actually quite cute and the decor was cool. That's pretty much the only positive about the experience. Our server had a bad attitude Service was suuuuuuuper slow. No sense of urgency at all.  The food was just ok. Nothing to write home about. The menu looks awesome tho.. maybe an off day? I dunno. Kind of reminds me of kitchen table on Horizon Ridge but not as good.  There are better places to brunch in town. It's too bad, but I won't be back.

-sF_yRpSUp871n3zgTlMaQ.text: Landon is the BEST server I've experienced in a long time! Attentive. Detailed. Knowledgeable. Friendly. Professional.  The food was amazing. Recommendations from Landon all killed it! Will be back.  Note to anyone new: make reservations! This place was empty from all the large party reservations scheduled. Ask for the patio seating while the weather is nice

xECGTQBJQXU0SYBB0TTccg.text: This is a chic spot to meet up with the girls for a lunch. I prefer going on the weekdays to avoid the long weekend brunch wait and the noise.  Though the bar is limited, they have some refreshing cocktails.  As for food, there is something for everyone. My husband likes the Mexican eggs with chorizo, and the kids like the birthday pancakes, doused with rainbow sprinkles.  My personal favorite is the roasted tomato soup with grilled cheese with seared mushrooms. Service can be slow so I don't go if I'm in a time crunch.  My major complaint is the lack of consistency of flavor and preparation. Each time it's a different, sometimes better sometimes...not.

RO0P0sJv-SihcJF49Il70g.text: The stove is very instagrammable, I'd say this is the biggest draw. The food is just okay, I've been twice now and don't think the food is that great. The first time I had corned beef hash and the beef was extremely salty it was almost inedible, the second time I had the chicken and waffles. The chicken was a weird dark meat cut so I couldn't eat half of it and the Mac and cheese waffle was bland -  both of those needed to be seasoned. I did share the pecan pie waffles and those were delicious and they have some fun homemade flavor syrups. The tables are really small and packed in tightly, the service is slow even for a quiet weekday afternoon and everything is a little wore out for it being a newish restaurant. Over all it's good in theory, cute atmosphere, but nothing I'd go back for.

oSsCgPqY_hWpm9aQZNpH2A.text: so glad to see that they opened up a new restaurant on this property. Always enjoyed the ambiance. Now with this new Breakfast Lunch place, it did not disappoint.  What an amazing place to have that breakfast,  brunch, or lunch.  If you are a foodie like me then you will appreciate their elaborate menu.  I can't wait to try more next time!

XPX4Tuv9Nuj782ZgJtsTog.text: This place will blow your mind! The food, staff and ambiance is incredible.. My family and I couldn't say enough great things about this place... it's not your average boring brunch spot at all. They have so many amazing items on the menu... check it out and I promise they won't disappoint!!! Also, they have a live singer on Sundays who's very talented and they have a pretty fun photo booth to keep you occupied while your waiting! CGrSy6msfyiXtev04fYaSA.text: Lovely views of the valley,  an imaginative and delicious brunch menu, and fantastic service! We stopped in this morning for brunch,  and were not disappointed. My croque madam was topped with a perfect sunny-side up egg, and my husband's hangover corndog was a great balance of flavors. They have a kids' menu,  too.  We will definitely be back!

1gs5M1lTvK39HRS6qBVMmQ.text: Wow - what an incredible restaurant! We loved everything about it - the staff, chefs, decor, amazing food and the bottomless mimosas! I had the Suckling Pig Benedict and my husband had the Crabby Benedict. Both were FANTASTIC!  We can't wait to go back and try all the other menu items- including the tea service. Reservations are a must - it's packed.

kaAk8VL3d_dSFjGUeOpPvA.text: Awesome breakfast spot on the 2nd floor of a strip mall. Super cute inside and amazing views of the strip. Traveled from the far nw to have brunch for a friend's birthday. Michael was our server and he was awesome! His personality was kind of like this place.. a little different, but yet; awesome. I ordered the pecan pie pancakes. I was asked if I wanted 2 or 3. Silly me. I should have said 2 because these were the fattest pancakes I'd ever seen. The picture doesn't really do them justice. So good though and I ended up bringing half home.  I wish this place were closer. I'm not sure how often I will get to this side of town for breakfast, but I am going to try and make it back there at some point. Highly recommend.

OWipTwwNW36NJS-jVHlYOg.text: The food is delicious, beautiful and unexpected atmosphere and views. I've been there twice now and looking to go back again soon.

89Lfg1cpW7OsSVLXfJJn2w.text: When I decided to have breakfast across town, I was hoping for serious wow factor, what I got was an unremarkable and overhyped hipster brunch. Aside from the foie gras French toast which was good, the service was on and off (service through brunch was all right - our server was very funny, but noone even offered me water while I waited for the rest of my party at the table) and the main dish, the Suckling Pig, was mediocre - the pork was cooked well but the barbecue sauce especially was absolutely lacking in creativity, it was just plainsweet without any spice or citrus tang to cut through the sugar. Since everything was at least "okay" and the pricing is reasonable, even though I find it absolutely not worth the trek to the edge of Anthem, I think four stars makes sense. I'm hoping ownership takes a look at this and revamps the menu a bit - I see there's passion put into this but the execution is just off.

Pe3I7Es6SaBhsaCgEbZZKw.text: Be prepared to wait but the food is so worth it! I recommend placing yourself on the waitlist on their website before you head down. It does help.  This place is really cute, and the service is excellent. The decor is cute, kind of old school, somewhat modern, and very cozy.   I ordered the regular Benedict and my friend got the porky pig version (don't remember the exact name) and it was SO SO GOOD! One of my favorite benedicts I've had!   I want to come back and try their mimosas next time.  Also - be sure to check out the cute photobooth they have hidden in the waiting area!

0IL07lbOXj_vtmHW1NTgXA.text: Let's talk about the chef's tasting menu... absolutely amazing!! 5 courses of delicious foods custom created by the chef. We had an absolutely incredible time with chicken and waffles, authentic breakfast quesadilla, arugula beet salad and more!

wIpBIW24wz1VZG-1JFfCTA.text: Went here for brunch. My friend loves it and has been several times. We're both vegan and they do offer a vegan menu so that's good.   I ordered the Benedict Arnold and I wasn't impressed. It was basically a beyond meat patty cut in half, put on a toasted bun thing, with tofu scramble on top. It just seemed like a stretch and badly put together. Nothing tasted terrible...it just wasn't as good of quality as I'd expect at a restaurant.   My friend had the vegan tacos and seemed to enjoy them. We also both had the vegan cookie. It was yummy.    I ordered a side of pickles and wasn't impressed. It was a bunch of quick pickled red pepper pieces, some red onion, some cauliflower, and some cucumbers. They all had the same flavor and it was just underwhelming.   They have a big selection of bottomless mimosas so thats fun and reason enough to come back.   My friend says the vegan skillet is good and there's a vegan burrito to try. I'll prob come back one of these days...maybe try something different on the menu. Def order more mimosas

A_BC2rXHtbEPjuQkm4J66Q.text: I have been here a few times already with my fiance the staff always remembers us and is so nice. The food is always great my fave is the churro waffle tho today's pork empanadas were a game changer.  Today I went in with plans for 3 of my girlfriends to meet me for lunch. I sat at a table in the tea room the restaurant was packed. Last minute all 3 girls canceled on me and I didn't want to take up a whole table. So I moved to the coffee bar and ordered breakfast by myself. I was so annoyed with my friends but I decided to stick around and get food and a mimosa to try to fix my mood. Abbey behind the bar was funny and chatted it up with an older couple next to me.   The food was perfect and I'm a new fan of hibiscus mimosa. Landon a server that recognized me surprised me and bought my lunch as a thank u for being a regular. That turned my day around I literally had to hug him and tell him thank you.   Chef Antonio is awesome he was at the bar chatting with me and the older couple next to me about how they make everything from scratch even their bitters for cocktails which I can appreciate as a bartender myself. He always comes by ghetables to check on people and ask how the food is. I over heard him saying they don't advertise they like people to hear about the restaurant by word of mouth. So this is me spreading the word that not only is the food amazing here but so if the staff  thank you guys for fixing what was a horrible lunch date into a perfect Sunday afternoon.

YB7wBZ3HGVeLD76xNjd21A.text: Amazing food and great atmosphere the only issue I would say is that it is a little slow so plan accordingly (give yourself time to hang) well worth the wait!

HllcTG5jvl2BF81ACLJPNg.text: Eating at The Stove for brunch for the first time and so glad I did! The ambiance is great. Went with my server Zoey's recommendation, The Chiliquilies. This is why I love asking servers for personal recommendations. I don't know what I was expecting for breakfast, but it wasn't this. Totally blew my mind. A taste explosion with an amazing texture. With tortilla chips, oaxacan red sauce, oaxacan cheese, scrambled eggs, beans, creama and an egg on top. I will definitely be back here for more early outings

NqXb4WcnOZIodC1W17gDgw.text: 45 minute wait for burn food on a Sunday.  Horrible customer service by the host and rude as hell as well. I should've known we were going to have a bad time when the place was hard to find and then the parking is a mess. To finish off my day there. Some asshole parked so close to my driver side I had to enter my car thru my passenger side. I'm sure I'm not the only person that had this issue there.

ExjL9DzycGPFf_QfdEWfrA.text: Decided to come check this place out on a Sunday for brunch. I had called ahead to see i can do a wait list of some sort and there was, the wait at the time was 75 minutes! But the hostess did mention is usually about half the wait time that is indicated on the site. Arrived there when I was number 14 on the list and waited for another 30-40 mins or so. There were empty tables available but they were not seating, could be due to short on staff.  Finally after a long wait, we we seated outside, at first it was fine but as you sat longer it was getting really warm, and there are no fans or air of any sort! ( so would not recommend on sitting outside till it gets into the 70's).   It took about another 20 mins or so, before someone came and poured water and took out drink order. Then finally the waitress came and took out food order. Food took some time as it was really busy that day with a baby shower going on as well. But I wish it would have been quicker.   Food was not bad, but the waiting really got us frustrated! Would I come back and give them another chance? Maybe? But I only the service would be better. I don't expect to be a fast food place, but please acknowledge that we are there and come check on us often and food wait isn't so long.

VY6pp4ZZem0b41K7nvMjwA.text: NO NO AND NO.   1. We were told the wait was 20 min and the hostess continually sat people after us and waited 45 min.  2. The waitress passed us several times and didn't get our drink order until 15 min later.   3. The music was SO loud the waitress had to scream to talk to us.   4. Bathroom with PUKE in the sink/clogged with chunks and trash can.

4XoBhsM9KQezY4V-DWlYCg.text: Very tasty food, however it was extremely slow service. Waited about 30-40 minutes for breakfast which is unheard of.

B_4brtKli3v6vFXalOCYZQ.text: Our favorite breakfast spot! We've only gone about 4 times so far but each time the service and food has been spot on. The atmosphere is lovely and there are a few tables with views. The menu is compact and definitely for "foodies", with interesting combinations and lots of opportunity to try new twists on favorites. If you're looking for something a little different, this is a great spot. The presentation leans on the hipster side, with portions being smaller than those chain diners so you leave feeling full and satisfied but not stuffed. I can highly recommend all the Benedicts (cooked perfectly every time), the Croque Madame, and the pancakes. The pancake syrup is amazing! Two different options (vanilla and bourbon). But just a heads up, my picky 7 year old doesn't like it. And try the morning happy hour! It's a good deal!

ck_1U3AxCUWbMKWDg-ULUA.text: Can't rate this place. They told us about a 10 min. wait but after 20 min. of waiting and watching the hostess wandering around looking lost, adjusting tables, she told us our table was being cleaned and we were next. 10 minutes later, She then seated people who came in after us, then offered us a menu to look at while we wait.  That's when we gave up. Were looking to try something new, but were not impressed enough to stay.

BLpgtbhNNLEwbkBCh-ahUw.text: I would rate this 3.5 to 4 stars. Located on the second floor of the building. It's a fun atmosphere, very casual so expect it to be kind of loud. They offer patio seating and the inside gets a lot of natural light. I ordered the empanadas and caviar duo. Both were okay, nothing outstanding. My partner ordered the classic benedict and she loved it (it tasted better than mine). We also ordered the bottomless mimosas, which is always fun and got to try all flavors (offered daily at $18). Our server was cool, the place seemed a bit short staffed but it was a Wednesday, probably the reason why patio was closed. I did notice they were pretty flexible in orders and pay attention to detail which is a great quality.  For example, as much as I appreciate creativity for the caviar duo, the plate originally is made with a sunny side up egg. I was looking more for a plate of caviar with the hard boiled egg yolk and egg white. I ordered it hard boiled expecting to cut up and separate the white from the yolk myself but when they brought me the plate is was beautifully done for me.  I love High Tea Service so I'd come back to check that out (only $25).

Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

lBrzvylSZIjIkf8mieXq4Q.text: One of the beat place ever!  The atmosphere is very pleasant..........  the owner and all staff we came in contact with we so on point and enjoyable.  Okay now the food!   DELICIOUS beautifully prepared.... so perfect, tasty and delicious.  I will go many and many times more in the future.

sxPWFP4IUxNVe7JhBHK2tA.text: The place is beautiful! My one-year-old daughter and I were sat next to the window, which by the way was a wonderful view and the sky was perfect this morning!  Right away I checked out the kids menu and ordered her a PB&J and myself a latte.   The PB&J came in a lunchbox, a pink one. A tin lunch box! The PB&J was CRUSTLESS (insert super dramatic crying emoji here) was perfectly jammed and perfectly peanut buttered, 1/2 a cookie, a good size fruit cup with exotic fruit. And a little dinosaur! She LOVED the fruit most of all. This was Olivia tested and approved! My latte was perfect in temperature. The espresso not too bitter..the foam was delightful. I love a classic latte..especially for the first visit. I wanted to try everything off the menu. The selections and flavors seem endless...and the menu is seasonal..changing flavors yum! I ordered the Sausage Corn Dog (3)sausages dipped and fried in pancake batter with a whole grain mustard maple sauce (syrup lol) they were great! Not greasy..a soft pancake with a light sausage snap. Oh SNAP!  I also ordered (oh gosh I don't remember the exact name) creme brulee? oatmeal. This is almost dessert.. AMAZING!   To top off the great food.. The server-Alec, was fantastic. He acknowledged my daughter which is greatly appriciated in a server (or human being for that matter) she's a guest too!  The concept is great..I hope the Stove sticks around for a long time!  I can't wait to come back! Thank you!

9uYqQS5euuGUsG0BQgldtg.text: Super fun little spot tucked away right before Anthem.  I enjoyed my starter: Short Rib Empanada I really loved the little heat given off by the pablano chilies. I would definitely get it again. I'm a Benedict kind of girl, but when I saw that they do Bananas Foster Pancakes table-side, I had to go for it. SooooooooGooooooood    I could literally stay here all day, drinking coffee, eating their yummy pastries (they have a special donut daily) & peering out their large front window. WHILE they have live music  the guy w/ his guitar has a GREAT set list Just a guy, his guitar & a microphone   They even do PROPER TEA/FORMAL TEA TIME (Reservation for "tea time" required) I'm definitely going to do this!! Every once in awhile you just need a reason to be fancy  My sister has to eat gluten-free, so I'm stoked to see they have tons of those options available.(NOT gluten-free pancakes though)  I actually thought about keeping this place secret(to NOT ruin such a cool place) BUT it's going to be a favorite of mine, I can tell.  SO, to keep it open, I definitely recommend coming & experiencing this little spot for yoursel
