Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. oh my goodness!! YUM

sSvTfmyO2nwbXsy8hGq2GQ.text: So, I never typically do this, but I'm writing down this experience as I go because I know I will have a lot to say about this establishment.   First impression: oh my gosh how cool is this place! Super trendy, bright, inviting and the decor is giving me all the heart eye emojis! I love that the elevator opens right into the restaurant and the feel of this place. The ceiling tile with the contrasting black wood look wall, the funky decor, and the bar setup. The tables look chic and modern. Overall 10 stars on this!   We were given a 30-45 minute wait time and I don't believe we even waited that long. We were given the option to visit the bar area for pastries and drinks so we went over and took an open seat. We ordered a funfetti scone and had the sugar cookie and took advantage of starting off with the unlimited mimosas. The pastries are AMAZING! The funfetti scone was really good but that sugar cookie stole the show for me. Our bartender, Victoria was very sweet, welcoming and made us feel at home. Compliments to her for giving us the impression that we looked for when deciding to visit The stove.   Our table was finally ready although we waited about another 15 minutes to get seated which was a little odd but I figured we had time to wait anyways, might as well enjoy our mimosas although we would have liked to refill. This is where things went a little off, but I'm not knocking off stars simply because the first impression and the food were both absolutely amazing. We finally were sat and waited an additional 10 minutes to be greeted by the server who unfortunately so, wasn't very enthusiastic. She's pleasant, maybe just an off day? I won't discredit that. She's got a good sense of humor regardless. We're peppy, excited and had a few questions but the wait time has kind of downed our vibe a bit. We ordered our second round of mimosas and it probably took another 10 minutes before it came out. Essentially, at the end of the day, I'm not going to discredit service because it is a little lengthy, just make sure you have time to fully enjoy your experience.   Food: Excuse my language, holy hell. We started with the empanadas and being Hispanics from Miami who just moved, we love our empanadas. These by far exceeded our expectations. The black bean puree and the pickled peppers/jalapeno, were such a nice touch. I'll come back just for this.  My boyfriend ordered the country fried steak and it was great! Has a nice kick, and the steak is thick but still crunchy, honestly not a single complaint.  Now, here's the main part of this review, The. Suckling. Pig. Oh my. I have no words. Do not even question the menu. This is the best part. I can't even describe it! The biscuits were crunchy, the bbq sauce is such a great compliment, the mini salad freshens up the savory goodness, the pickled jalapenos give a nice vinegar and spice component. One tiny minor detail (which works in my favor because I don't prefer runny eggs) the eggs were a tad over done. The potatoes at the bottom became my vice. So good!   Being foodies, we have a lot to say about food but everything here was absolutely perfect. If you want to excite your palate, try new twists on flavors and fill yourself up on quality ingredients, visit and order. No brunch compares. And that's coming from a Miami couple where brunch is a a known Sunday "holiday" every weekend. Compliments to all!   Also, Alec, who we had the pleasure of meeting when he brought our food out, was great. You can see his passion and drive when he talks about the food, the menu and the business. Thank you Alec for welcoming us and giving us recommendations for our next visit!   We will definitely be back and bringing all of our visitors to try brunch here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. A half eaten funfetti scone (because we were too hungry to Wait) and the sugar cookie
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. The empanadas, amazing!
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

gjeqUkr9LKaSJU0D4C3zCQ.text: This place is cute and has all the things every girl wants to throw up on her instagram: cute backgrounds, cute food and drinks like unicorn hot chocolate, mimosas, cute signs and decor.   But the first thing you have to deal with: the hostesses. And from my experience on a Sunday afternoon, I was annoyed. The hostesses are rude to be honest. Blame it on their age, but I don't care for the repetitive attitude when I haven't really bothered them, wasn't standing in their way and simply replying to THEIR questions. This definitely turned me off to this place because I'm not sure why they're snobby.   I will say the male servers were really nice and friendly and the ladies at the bar who made our drinks while we waited were also super sweet. So there's some balance to their staff.   Wait is average for a brunch place but once you've been seated, waiting for the food was also long. I think we arrived around 12, got seated around 1250, got our food around 1:35.   The taste of the food is good. And the amount is also good. Pretty standard prices for brunch, as well.   I may consider going back based on the food but I'm having a hard time convincing myself that dealing with snobby hostesses is worth it if it'll be busy.

8WM8N402vVzXi5rQbHL0GQ.text: Came here from Seattle. I would call us foodies. We LOVE good food. This place is AMAZING! Don't come to Vegas without eating here. Have the PBJ biscuit. The food is so good it's ridiculous!.

7ZKzr2dOt7ZOXo0SQVFUUA.text: I came here for my birthday for brunch. There has been lots of hype on IG about this place, so I was excited to try. The space is small but cutely decorated in like a west elm style. First off, it took about 6 phone calls and an IG message to get a reservation for twisted tea. The twisted tea could use more variety of tea cocktails and should include the unique cocktails on the regular menu which it didnt.  The cups and teapot and serving tray were cute though. We had an amazing waitress, very funny and friendly.  The pastries and tea were just Ok. They didnt taste fresh and lacked luster. My fiance had eggs & bacon. The eggs were decent but served on lettuce, hot eggy lettuce kinda odd. Bacon was really good. Matza ball soup was poured out of thermos tableside, but lacked flavor. Broth was bland. I ordered the empanadas that were really tasty, but came out lukewarm. Cereal Milk Yogurt came out without any cereal or cereal flavor. It was just plain yogurt and fruit. The waitress said it used to come with a delicious yogurt steeped in fruit loop cereal, but not anymore. She later brought a side of fruity pebbles cereal, which still didnt help the bland dish. My experience was just Ok. The ambiance was nice but food was definitely lacking. The photobooth was a nice touch. Im not sure if I would go back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Coconut tea latte
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Short rib empanadas
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Matza ball souo

Nkp3Tt9xLBsv2b8n0uGr7w.text: I came here once before and wasn't what I was expecting, however, I always give a place a second chance and man they nailed it!! Food was exceptional and service equally as impressive

jqPgTw6gvzFdKVmgD4r3xQ.text: Came in, loud as hell. Sat in the corner and the waiter was nice but our server pretty much forgot about us the entire time after we ordered. Only came to refill our water right before we were about to pay and already choking on the food with parched mouths. Food was decent nothing orgasmic or cool. Lots of trendy kids here with money to spend on the decor of the place. You are just paying for the decoration of the restaurant honestly not food quality. Water had so much particles in it but drank it anyways since water refills were scarce here. Better off going to craftkitchen or kitchen table tbh.

2WrEb9hze6R_wmdlaGoAVw.text: Inside decor is adorable, well done with the whimsy aesthetics. The meal presentation is equally remarkable, and food itself outstanding.  Went for breakfast with a friend, she ordered the Monte Cristo, I ordered shakshuka, we both thought it was fantastic.  Service was super friendly and accommodating, in fact, our lattes were gratis. Very cool! Will definitely return!

-YjxCvz2v3PNS9t_lOOVCg.text: Delicious! Just went to visit and wanted mimosas and a delicious brunch, was not disappointed

l4Ol-opCBKRdPYt651hAzg.text: The food was amazing!  I really enjoyed the bottomless mimosas.  The juice was fresh and yummy!  I love the spot!

wF9alyhHPZ7w-U3cpth8jg.text: I'm through the roof on this great new eatery here in Henderson. This is the third restaurant to occupy this beautiful location since we've been in town and I truly hope the word gets out on the fantastic food and service presented at The Stove.   It is one of the most customer focused breakfast/lunch restaurants I've been to in a while, which included a thorough understanding of the menu by our waiter along with him bringing our daughter stickers and a little toy to play with. During the course of our meal four different employees asked how we were and if there was anything we needed. That level of customer engagement is welcomed and is a stand out trait above any similar spots here in the valley.   The menu is expansive and it was hard to choose as my eyes were hungry looking at all the different twists on my breakfast favorites, however I settled in on a Country Fried Steak Benedict and a cotton candy French press coffee. The cotton candy fresh press was awesome visually as the pour melted it down into a sweet coffee treat. The melt in your mouth country fried steak was perfectly cooked and accompanied by a tangy spicy gravy. My wife had the suckling pig Benedict which featured some of the best smoked ham I've had in town. Our daughter loved the waffles with vanilla butter, sliced strawberries and fresh maple syrup.   The drink menu is lush and has a little something for everyone. I had the creamsicle mimosa and my wife had the blackberry mimosa. Both fresh and bubbly with good champagne. There is also a Vegan menu that offers a ton of awesome selections beyond the typical one or two options at other brunch locations. We didn't get a chance to check out all the details on the Twisted Tea Room, but it seems to be a rocking high tea with options for food accompaniment, in a reimagined English fashion.   Overall, this is probably... ok IS... some of the best breakfast food in town, with big servings at reasonable prices. We really look forward to bringing friends and family back soon and wish them all the most success. Share the word and eat up!

ZgYfD7j5Wnq8uOvW9pfUTg.text: My first time visit this place was impressive. I order salmon bruschetta it was good but I think the price is little high. The restaurant decoration is very nice. Take long time to get food if you no rush or not too hungry is find. The server inform you that after ordering you will have to wait at lease 20 mins to get your food.

dA5-ZMxoKsWWCuSdZr1SnA.text: Had to visit after seeing so many amazing posts in the Las Vegas Vegans FB group and I was not disappointed!! We had the vegan benedict and the vegan breakfast skillet and they were both DELICIOUS! We finished with the vegan cookies which are huge and yummy. We will definitely be back to try the the other vegan menu items and hopefully they will be adding more as they've definitely got the food down! Its the old Henderson Firefly location, beautiful space, great views, incredibly friendly and attentive staff! Super happy with our dining experience!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Vegan benedict &amp; breakfast skillet!

B0ih586AUS_eEqbJ93PvPQ.text: Went here on a quiet Monday and service was great! Rachel was very nice and knowledgeable and did a great table side banana fosters pancakes for me. We ended up doing cham bongs with her and two other workers and it was an amazing experience! Go see Rachel!

f1hbOUQpMZXhjPtN_URBiw.text: This place is has good food and the staff are friendly. It is new and has only been in business for about two months.  Because it's new they are working on a lot of things.  The space is not well utilized and the noise level on Sunday brunch is too much you can't even hear yourself think.   I believe this place has great potential. People should go and check them out

jV-21GorOqxIWNWlA-sQLQ.text: I really enjoy this place and the service is phenomenal. I always feel welcomed and taken care of here.

UYHh2CHsw7LRtAqGbnlu_Q.text: Food is amazing great environment and fun servers only drawback is it's super busy so plan to wait even if you're on the wait list but it's worth the wait!

Y5RF0VnUBpS9vO3q_KD2Aw.text: Don't waste your time. My mother had been dying to try this place so I took her for her 70th birthday brunch. From the moment we walked in the door we were not impressed. The girl at the hostess stand greeted me and when I told her how many were in our party, she responded with "Oh, tell her..." and gestures to another young lady walking our way. (Um, ok.) So I approach the other girl and give her our info. We were quoted a 45 minute wait which was no problem for us because of all the amazing reviews we had read. We found a nice spot on their patio to sit and wait for the text that I was told I would get when the table was ready. After a short while we noticed people that had come in after us were getting sat. We went in and when we sat down on the waiting bench inside the hostess approached us and asked for our information again. When we reminded her it was just the 2 of us, she sat us right away at a table that had been vacant since we walked in the first time over 20 minutes prior. Once we were sat our server came right to us. He was warm and welcoming. We order the deviled eggs to share, a crabby patty Benedict, and a croque madam. The eggs came out in a timely manner and were delicious! But while we were sitting there the table next to us had a problem with their food taking a really long time and then being cold when once they finally got it. Of course this made us nervous but we figured once one table has a challenge they would step up their game.....nope. Our main dishes took entirely too long, to the point even our server was wondering where it was. When we finally got our order my mother's food wasn't hot and we only had 10 minutes to eat and run to get to an appointment. We asked for the check right away to avoid another long wait and when it came, we were charged for everything. Our server did verbally apologize but no management presence came to speak to us, no discount offered, nothing. AFTER I had signed the check we were offered a latte.........no thanks. It probably would have taken an hour to get and been cold. It's too bad this whole experience went down this way because the flavor of the food was very good but unfortunately our celebratory brunch had been ruined by the overall experience. We definitely won't be back.

fJ4TY2Nlrg-WgqJCs2tSDw.text: Tried to go here for lunch. Didn't have a reservation but was told 15 minute wait and directed to a waiting area, where there were other people waiting. After 20 minutes we checked with the hostess, she said it would be another 30 minutes. Meanwhile there were plenty of empty tables. Apparently they didn't have enough servers that day. We left and will not be back. This location has had several restaurants that all closed after a short while, I expect this one will not last long either. We walked next door to Kneaders, a bakery that serves sandwiches and salads, and found other people there who also got tired of waiting at The Stove.

m10RKg3gTVGaZR10cJdApw.text: I Really Really Really wanted to like this place. They put a lot of energy into the decor and the employees wear cute little outfits. The presentation of the food is amazing as well. The service was prompt and friendly. My coffee was great. But the bottom line is the product, the food. It was just ok. Three of us ordered different breakfasts and all three of us were underwhelmed. I wasn't even tripping till I got the bill. Its EXPENSIVE! 70.00 for mushy mediocre eggs Benedict? My 8 year old didn't finish his pancakes! The food I took home went straight in the garbage.

3Xfq30mZAp8nr0nR0r8ZYg.text: The food is pretty good, but the wait time was unbelievable.  We waited 45 minutes for our table, then another 45 for our food after placing our order.  I remember the wait for food being long on our first visit also (scored some bar seats)... seems like their kitchen isn't big or experienced enough to handle the busy times.. others around us were frustrated also.  Our server was very nice and felt bad, but nothing he could do.  Not sure we'll be back.

Whz16E4li0-_8yRrtUJ-3w.text: Um, what can I not say!!!!! Live music, very knowledgeable staff, Views to die for and amazing creations puts the STOVE over the TOP! Thank you Victoria and Landon for a great welcome! Best part this is down the road from my home!!! I would still drive across the Valley!!!! The Stove will get sick of seeing Us!!!!!!

uTYWN0PBno7TBPlF_a8Mwg.text: Beat brunch I've had in some time. Mimosas and cocktails made from sake and bourbon barrel, were amazing!!   Food was delicious, from apps to dessert and their great coffee.

t9rRyAW6fgFcHAbCsNkxAw.text: Best brunch we have ever had as a family. The inside decor is beautiful and homey. The staff were excellent. It was busy and a little slow though.

okfVp9F2Zix4aiokWUZjXQ.text: This place was absolutely amazing. The unicorn hot chocolate definitely needed a moment of silence. It was a great start to a wonderful day. Be prepared for a wait but it is definitely worth it. The service was top-notch. Rebecca was helpful, knowledgeable, and very friendly. We had the pleasure of watching bananas Foster being created. It was a sight to behold. And the selfie booth is so fun. I strongly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. This unicorn hot chocolate definitely needs a moment of silence. Be prepared for a sweet cinnamon chocolate beverage. So worth the wait.

d5a_rww9OQPgRtGcW6V-uA.text: Can't say enough good things about about this place.  It has a super cute eclectic vibe that makes it feel super cozy and home-like.  The service was exceptional and everything we ate was absolutely delicious!  It's a MUST for breakfast or brunch!  All around WIN!

Ade0fDvcLUp0ZpbhZ6xVxg.text: Best food, nicest staff, great ambiance and probably the most unique experience in a restaurant to date. Photo booth, eclectic photo wall of their customers-the Regulars. Makes me want to move to town.  Prices were amazing and quantities aplenty. Such high quality!  Thank you all for making my daughter's bridal shower so special. Fantastic day all around! -Carrie from Portland

DeuqcAFxYjXdIK8FyMmEUg.text: INCREDIBLE place! My good friends took me here for my bridal shower and I was BLOWN AWAY by the food, service, decor, live music, photo booth, location......The food is amazing - I had the regular eggs Benedict and would order it again in a second.  I also had the lavender latte and bottomless mimosas! It was such a fun day and many thanks to the Stove for the incredibly hospitality and for helping make this day so special and fun! Can't wait to come back - a wonderful addition to the area! Thank you thank you!!

y34bvPKi22d63X48a4PYdA.text: Stopped at this gem on a road trip.  AMAZING!  If you enjoy food classics done extremely well along with welcoming decor and a view - this is your place.  The starters are off the charts, Monte Cristo is luscous and service is on point.  Plus if you love cookbooks - they have a nice selection on display.

-AMc7ts1d9xPGcrL6wXrXw.text: Great breakfast that catered to my vegan daughter and our foodie needs:)! Empanada and corn dog sausage did not disappoint. Service was excellent. Will definitely return!!!

ml5ljtOXh-urqMV6Sj4Cpw.text: This place was great ! I went with my mother and she was excited to see that they had some Hispanic dishes ! I ordered the suckling pig Benedict and my mom ordered the chilaquiles. The chilaquiles passed the test and were delicious, almost as if my mom had made them as home. Our server was sweet and very attentive. I loved the vibe here, definitely coming back !

u-eZiXW173fUpPuEFcv5Sw.text: Updated review- came back today.. service is still really bad. They gave my order to a different table and had to remake my whole dish. Ordered the croque madame and it was good. girlfriend ordered the chicken and waffles. The whole dish was soggy, they should try using panko on the chicken and also put the syrup on the side. We also ordered the short rib empanada. It was okay, it was missing something like pickled onions or a truffle honey creme fraiche. Needed some pop, it was really boring.

1zzzhvKbMHII6yr7Mvqqbw.text: Such a beautiful venue, with such an amazing menu! I really loved the empanadas and the pancakes. The other thing I really liked was the live music, which added to the experience. This will definitely be my spot :-)

oavSTrCUxYBRawqkEok7RQ.text: I came here for a girls brunch. The server was very friendly and helpful. He made sure our mimosa glasses stayed full and we were having a great time. Kudos for putting up with us!  (It's been a few months since my visit so I don't remember his name). The food was delicious!  I usually think avocado toast is overrated but I really liked theirs.

2rSaOSWRpKG8bcZ4nS1dDA.text: I loved the food and was very much surprised to see that I like the food as much as I did, considering my taste in food. The service was all around the best. The servers were attentive and kind. They were not just there to serve us but also there to just be friendly in general. I loved coming here and definitely recommend it.

X61tUEwkiIcg5dkWO4IZYA.text: Went there Saturday around noon, seated quickly and it was about 75% full.  First thing I noted is how LOUD  it was inside.  Place is cute with nice views of the valley.  We ordered and after about 20 mins our waiter informed us there was "a large party of 7 was in front of us" which is why it would be taking longer.  I appreciated the heads up, I guess I didn't know 7 was considered big.  Our party of 3 ordered two Caesar salads and chilaquiles.  After 30+ mins the dishes arrived and the chilaquiles has to be sent back, tortillas were soggy and dish was cold.  Caesar was ok although the dressing was so light it was essentially the same as have no dressing at all.   My guest with the chilaquiles said it was pretty bad and seemed premade and heated.  Won't be back to this hipster joint.

eMWFVtpHom1EvPde6An5rw.text: Great New Place!  Elegant atmosphere . Great food! Must see and eat place in Vegas !  The staff is friendly and the menu is amazing .

4V9Fx-9dmrieBfhAxGPE5Q.text: I haven't been to the Stove, and I really wanted to try it and to like it. I tried to have a friend's baby shower in the tea room, but it would have been more expensive than what Mandarin Oriental (slash Waldorf Astoria) quoted me and the Stove was not at all willing to work with me on the price. Then, I tried to take that same friend to the Stove for our last girl's lunch before her baby was born, and it was a total ordeal. I had to call about 6 times until I finally got someone on the phone to make a reservation. Then I read some of the rude responses of this business to customers on Yelp. I also saw the sad, half empty plates that are served with the afternoon tea that I was going to take my friend to. (Note to this business, you should probably check out the afternoon tea experience at your competitor, Waldorf Astoria. Whether you are serving "twisted tea" or not, you still need to fill up your plates.) I decided that with everything that had happened so far along with the experience of other customers who have been to the Stove, I'd rather take my business elsewhere. So then I did a couple of rounds of attempting to contact the restaurant to cancel my reservation and finally got through. Then, a day before my cancelled reservation would have happened I got a text message confirming my reservation. So I cancelled it again....

pIbUcioglIuTkxcFUTe-_g.text: Wow! Our new favorite brunch spot has arrived! This place is phenomenal - Great ambience & service and the food is to die for! We started with the Mexican Egg - an appetizer we will likely get every time. It's an egg wrapped in chorizo and fried...absolutely heavenly. For entrees we chose the Croque Madame and the Suckling Pig Benedict. Both looked and tasted delicious. The restaurant was fairly busy when we were there (Sunday at 10am), but the service was still excellent. Finishing our dining experience off with a trip into the selfie photo booth was the best - We are already counting the days until our return for brunch. Oh - and the view from the restaurant is fantastic....one of the best! I give this place an A+.

nTC5TiEQwGVCIedHatc09w.text: I am very hesitant to write this review. After seeing all the amazing reviews for this place I had high expectations. The first thing I will say is the fact you can put your name on the wait list before you even get there is awesome! Even doing so, we waited for a table for about an hour, which is understandable since it was a Sunday afternoon and there was 7 of us. But no big deal, we sat at the bar downstairs while we waited. When we got seated the server came over right away and gave us menus and took our drink order. I was kind of annoyed because she made me feel stupid when I asked her a simple question. I was just a bit confused on if you could get flavors for both the iced coffee and iced lattes because the menu only had them listed under regular coffee, and she told me an iced coffee is an iced coffee and an iced late is an iced late. Ok, my question may have been a little ridiculous to some but she didn't have to answer me the way she did. Anyways, it took a while for her to come back to get our food order and when she did we asked if it was possible to do split checks. I am in the service industry and I get how annoying split checks are but if someone tells you in the begging of the meal, its really not that bad. She answered with maybe, its hard to do on a Sunday. I've used every POS system in restaurants and there is no maybe! You either can or you cant and I know some places are strict but no where did it say they had a policy against it, and if the answer was no, it would have been totally fine. I ordered the short rib empanada to start with and the Crabby Patty Benedict for my meal. The empanada was just ok, not as great as all the hype but still tasty. I liked the fact you could see the kitchen, but that also meant we could see our food just sitting there for a while waiting to be ran to the table. The cinnamon roll our friend ordered was amazing though, so creamy and delicious. My Crab Benedict, which was not cheap by the way, had what seemed like a healthy serving of King Crab which turned out to be 3 small bites worth. My boyfriend said his Country Fried Steak and Eggs were a bit rubbery and he has definitely had better. Other dishes on the table were the Croque Madam (just average) and some Chiliquiles (not worth a second look). It was enjoyable for the company but I probably wouldn't come back for brunch. Maybe just some tea and pastries. The one fun part as well was the selfie booth! That was a fun ending to a mediocre meal.

FRbY3OKF4EdfPcLjjsHTUQ.text: Great food, it took quite awhile to get food we were there 1 1/2 before we received food this was with a 30 to 40 wait, but mimosas were delicious!! Everyone was very friendy!!!

8gPYxIKWrq8YQvuRd3uWyg.text: We have been in Henderson, NV for over a year, and we agree that this is the best food we've had in Nevada so far.  I started with one of their house-made biscuits and berry jam, easily the best biscuit I have had in my life over 60 years! I followed it with the Crabbie Pattie Eggs Benedict and savored every bite. My wife had the Farmhouse Breakfast with scrambled eggs, bacon, toast, and house potatoes. Our meals were garnished with fresh herbs growing in small pots on a wall. The owners came over and chatted with us, and our server Rebecca was incredibly nice and caring. I only wish I could give The Stove 10 stars.  Finally, a reasonably priced gourmet restaurant in Henderson.

U83ANMEPe8c9qjzQ8D3kPQ.text: Okay... This place has such great reviews that I am surprised our experience was so bad.  The food was awful. Unique, which is cool, I got the Brie pancakes and my friend got the churro waffles, but just not good. Three dry pancakes with savory cheese on them? I figured it would be sweet brie cheese. When I read the menu again, they arrived as described, so that's on me, of course, I just did not like them at all.  We got drinks, too. My friend got the chocolate monkey. The server described it as a very choclatey drink with espresso. It was a tea latte, not espresso and it didn't taste like chocolate. The server told my friend that she just needs to let it steep longer to make it more taste more like chocolate... it didn't work. They did however bring her a completely new drink for free.  I got the cotton candy French press. Decent but I'd recommend having the cotton candy in a separate container because using the whole piece for one cup was a bit too sweet, just my preference, obviously! Finally, the service... really it just seemed like the server was new. She didn't describe my friends drink correctly at all. We asked if they had breakfast potatoes. She looked at us like we were crazy. She said no. But I noticed that the eggs Benedict came with potatoes so I asked about those. She said they were just chopped potatoes....? We were confused. She was hard to flag down for refills and condiments. But at the end of the meal (that we barely ate) she was SO talkative and present. Telling us all about how busy they are on weekends and how you can get on the waitlist online, that there is live music... we were standing up at our table trying leave and she kept talking. She even asked if we would come back. It was a bit awkward.  Unfortunately, we just didn't enjoy ourselves. We won't be back.

0N0gDTiNVXFVGWaREXH7sA.text: Hostess seated us at a table where the chairs were too close together and I asked if we could sit somewhere else and she looked very agitated at that request but nonetheless seated me, my mother and son at a table right next to the hostess stand, where she kept staring at us and making comments to her co-hostess. Meanwhile my server was not on the ball like when you order breakfast please put out a salt and pepper shaker on the table, he also brought food out at intervals so we all didn't eat at the same time.  We had to repeatedly ask for things that he forgot. He seemed as though he was not in the mood to be at work, but come on you just got there.  When we were leaving the hostess yelled out something like "I hope you have a nice day!" sarcastically.  I remember going to the owners first restaurant called Kitchen Table and he said something stupid to me like "Why did you come here you could have went down the street?"  Pretty nice for a first week of opening.   From now on I won't patronize any of your restaurants!  My money works just as well down the street at Kraft Kitchen!!

ImbzvbRpG2P3uXcOM5j8LA.text: The prices are slightly high but you get your money's worth! The Crabby Patty was amazing and full of flavor. I can't wait until my next visit to try something else from the menu. The overall atmosphere was great and the staff was excellent.

5RicP0TfAJSp4am9CwWMhw.text: Love the place and atmosphere.. my kids loved the selfie booth. The menu is different and offers a wide verity. We will definitely be coming back

KSlr8KOYOoH2tM74ClGSPQ.text: Tried this place for the first time and loved it! The view is gorgeous, the atmosphere is unique and the service was fantastic! The chef/ owner even made me the most delicious gluten free pancakes (not on the menu) with a mix they normally use for muffins. They were so yummy and that was such a nice surprise. I would definitely recommend The Stove to everyone. Thank you Stove crew

rzxdL3YuaH5TrO78AWdYqQ.text: Beautiful decor inside and the menu was such a pleasant surprise. The pancakes didn't need syrup they where so good. Henderson needs more places to eat like this

53jBFelnH9RyLBACN2H0gw.text: Tried out this spot after recommendations from a few friends.  It is located upstairs, nice decor with lots of windows keeps it light and bright.  It was really hard to choose between the sweet and savory breakfast dishes but ended up ordering the Croques Madame and it was delicious in every way!    Only complaint is that service was a bit slow -- took a long time to get our check and when we did it was someone else's check which meant we had to track down the server again.  When I paid, the receipt came back with the wrong amount (a smaller amount, also attributed to the first check I received).  Rather than find the waiter a 3rd time I just corrected the amount in the tip.  There's only so much you can do!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Croques Madame

8yqlirzM5Tbgg17R4-tiOA.text: Checked this place out not knowing of the following it already has. I was lucky enough to get there shortly after it opened. It was later that I found out that this place gets busy fast. The staff was very nice and very accommodating. A person in our group had back surgery and was using a walker and they sat us in an area where we would be comfortable and out of the way. The restaurant is fairly small but it was clean and nice.   Now for the food and drinks. The coffee is great. If you like strong coffee you will like it too. I had the chicken and waffles. I have to tell you, I'm not a fan of chicken and waffles but this chicken is AWESOME!!! Just about the best chicken I've ever had in my life. It was so good I wanted to call my mom and tell her about this chicken. The waffle that came with it was good. It also came with a spicy syrup that I didn't care for. Lucky there was regular syrup on the table that I used instead. We also ordered the flap jacks. It was a nice big stack that I split with my son. We both enjoyed it. Got a side of bacon that was cooked perfectly. My daughter got the kids meal hamburger and she really enjoyed it and the fries that came along with her order. It was cute the way it came is an old style lunch box.   There wasn't a single thing that our group ordered that we didn't like. If I had to say one negative thing about the place it would be that the music was a little loud. Maybe I was sitting near the speaker. I didenjoy the music though.   1/29/19 As much as I love this place I must warn you about the biscuit and gravy. It's not what you think it is. The biscuit part ( which didn't taste like a biscuit) is cut in half and then either fried or toasted. A good third of each half was like eating a crouton. The gravy was spicy which I don't mind but the biscuit just totally ruined this side dish. I will be back to try the other delicious looking things.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Biscuit and gravy.
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Kids burger and fries. It&#39;s bigger than it looks here.
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Flap jacks. Very tasty.

bcFQTesKYBTU5Pg2HPv6NA.text: Our food took 1 hour to come  They forgot it of course When i asked the server to check on our food he gave me an attitude  I order the crabby patty ($20) To which he just toss my dish on to my table after 1 hr The so called "crabby patty" had like two pieces of crab on it  Very salty dish Definitely not coming back   The only thing our server was fast on was giving the bill

LZdGwBYyS6xJl_BRvzsX9g.text: When you walk in, you instantly think it's gonna be a 5 star place.   I want to start by saying, the food is pretty good. My girlfriend had the Chilequiles (which was out of this world) and I had the chicken and waffle. Chicken and waffle is okay but you shouldn't expect it to taste like a classic southern chicken and waffle. They definitely take out a lot of typical southern flavoring that goes into fried chicken batter and the waffles just had so many damn onions on it. I didn't really get the onion thing at all.   Our server was good. Had no problem with that either.   The reason for the 2-stars came down to environment. The vibe was very dive bar meets brunch setting. There was an older couple in there that was just doing all kinds of weird things. The older guy took his shoes off and put his feet up on another chair. The woman walked over to a completely different table to pick up the silverware and use the napkin and PUT IT BACK. There was either the owner or manager that was slamming champongs and chugging giant flamingo beer things. He was yanking a waitresses hair. He was squirting cleaner from across the main room which was getting on other table's plates and silverware. Almost the entire staff were whipping each other with wash rags. The staff got into a huge whipped cream spraying war. We saw a customer drop a cup on the floor and watched a server watch them just put it back on another table. All happening in the main room.   Definitely do not recommend if you're going for a chill breakfast. Maybe I completely missed that memo. IDK. Still doesn't excuse the other things.

HdtqYr0AhntAbnBUHajFXw.text: I love that very important meal between breakfast and lunch! Brunch is my favorite and The Stove is such a cute place for brunch! For the location it's at, you definitely pay a pretty penny for some of their food. The view is a beautiful addition to a delicious meal. Make sure you go early for a little to no wait and be seated quickly! Also, just so you're aware: this place is located on the second floor! I had trouble finding it, lol.  We ordered the deviled eggs and I don't think I'll order it again. I thought the yolk was supposed to get taken out, mixed with all sorts of flavors then put back in the egg...give or take a couple more steps. But the egg was just sliced (yolk still intact) with some sort of mayo on top, crunchy onions, and jalapenos. I wasn't the biggest fan.   We also got the cinnamon toast... which I could probably make myself. Nothing too fancy, really. But it was still good. I wouldn't pay that much for it, though.   My friend got the salmon Benedict with smoked salmon and that was pretty yummy! I'd probably order that next time! But I got the country friend steak. Sadly, I've had better. So maybe I'll try something different next time. So long story short, maybe try this place to try it. But it wouldn't be a place I'll keep coming back to.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Deviled eggs
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Cinnamon toast

OY6_6z8MTnam_hLBRXmjKQ.text: Great brunch spot! Great view of the strip and super cool decor Amazing selection of both unique breakfast and lunch items! We ordered the watermelon salad and the crab Benedict both were outstanding *drool*  Can't wait to comeback and try the duck hash!  Also the have chambongs! Great coffee as well.  Our server was Rachel and she delightful, really showed us a great time!  Ps. The selfie room is so fun!

zlT76hF8B7vulMJmxwfh6A.text: Yes! Yes! Yes! This place is all that and a side of homemade fries! First, love the setup/decor and large windows-just darling! The only complaint-I wanted to order everything!  The food is uniquely yum! All the flavors worked really well together. Highly recommend!

QfsoUWeY3XtGsoghh1LskQ.text: Been here twice and both times it was an extreme wait to be seated and to get our food. Order was mixed up and food was ok. Not worth the hassle. We don't plan to return or recommend.

wcY59vNyPGI9k5VBiWvPzQ.text: Best brunch spot is right!  Words to describe this place based on the decor, the vibe, the layout:  unique, homey, classy, elegant, green, interesting layout, vintage  Let me start with the party next to me that was celebrating a birthday.  Their server brought out a plate with what looked like cookies/pastries with cotton candy.  Suspended over the dessert, the server sprinkled sprinkles on top.  Literally, raining sprinkles.  I should have recorded that for them.  Great view if you're seated near the windows.  Service, fantastic.  Food, awesome.  We started with the Short Ribs Empanadas and that was great.  I ordered the Suckling Pig Benny and my brother ordered the Crabby Patty Benny.  First bite of the Suckling Pig and I was like, this is good.  Midway thru, I had to tap out because it started getting salty.  I did take a bite of the Crabby Patty and I was like WOW, this is sooo good.  I think the homemade artichoke spread was what made that dish.  It was so good.  My brothers only complaint was that he wished they used more crab meat.  Today, I find out that my brother took my sister in law for brunch and they ordered the Country Fried Steak & Bangers and Eggs.  My brother said the Country Fried Steak was good and the only complaint there was was that the Bangers and Eggs, the eggs were salty and so was the salad that they got.  So it seems like some of their food is being over salted.  But other than that, so far this place has my vote!  Happy Eatings until next time!!

tD7HRcPG3vtqtzR-8v_5OA.text: Marked this place to try and I am glad I tried it.. I could not decide what to order, the empanada was very yummy.. the chicken and waffles you won't be disappointed. The suckling pig benny was yummy. All the favors where so good. Fresh squeezed watermelon lemonade was worth the wait. The service was great. We will be back!

pcXlFVpFFYxs6dTx78VnDA.text: I asked my friend if she wants to have breakfast with me and we can meet at The Stove and she said yes. She told me that there's usually a wait so I checked out their site and they have an option to sign in to be on their waitlist---I thought it was a great idea considering it's a busy place.   I live on the west side of town and it took me 25mins on a Sunday morning to arrived at my destination. I checked out their Yelp reviews and their menu ahead of time so I can pre plan what I'll order. I know for sure that it will take me another month or so to visit so I really wanted to try some of their best seller.  When they told me that they run out of their empanada at 8:30 in the morning I felt a poke in my heart because I seriously love empanadas and I was a little disappointed.  So I let it go and ordered their lavender latte and their French press. I love coffee and I really enjoy the part that I'll press my own coffee---they brought my french press already pressed which is totally fine, but I like my coffee darker and stronger. I wish they'll let the guest press their own coffee.  My friend and I shared their Suckling Pig Benedict and their Savory French Toast and my oh my, they're really delicious--- although I wished I added some maple syrup to their Savory French Toast. Oh well, there's always a next time...  As we our finishing up, we both decided to try their Cinnamon roll with pecan syrup just because... At first, our server told us that they don't have one available and it will take them 45 mins. Again, there's another poke in my heart. The server even asked us if we want to try some of their pastries instead but my taste buds is craving for their cinnamon roll.   What really impressed me and the reason I'm giving them 5stars it's because of the thought that the server came back and told me that the chef is going to make me one of their cinnamon roll and I dont need to wait 45 mins for it. I seriously want to do a happy dance as soon as the sever told me. It made my day and I was truly grateful for their effort and their service.   I eat out most of the time and worked in a food industry and customer service for 10 years now, so I know how it feels when we go above and beyond to make our guest happy.   I left the place with a happy heart and happy tummy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Suckling Pig Benedict
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Lavender Tea
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Savory French Toast

wFRH0b0EtYQV1Gxwz3B3jw.text: The hubby and I planned to try Kitchen Table, but because there was a long wait for a table for two- we got into our cars and made the short trek over to our original first choice - The Stove! Because we haven't tried this place yet, I was super stoked - plus it was collecting dust in my bookmark list, lol.   The wait was, zero minutes; seated right away! Score! Walking in, my first impression was welcoming, cozy, bright and fresh. I love how the kitchen is visible from all the tables because watching the food come out the kitchen is entertainment within itself. The staff is very engaging and really make you feel welcome! My overall breakfast experience was amazing. We received exceptional customer service from our server Mike- and meeting the GM, Landon and head chef, Antonio...man these dudes are super personable.   Let's talk food. So the menu is slightly all over the place, but in a good way *wink. You get the normal suspects, dishes with eggs/bacon/etc. - but it's the basic dishes with a twist is what this place is known for.   My hubby ordered the savory French toast?...let that sink in right quick. So essentially picture a normal French toast dish but think opposite. On top of his pieces of bread laid melted cheese, bacon and fried eggs with sprinkles of fresh Parmesan cheese. The most memorable thing about this dish is the white sauce the French toast is drenched in! I'm still trying to guess what it's made out of, but whatever it is, it's f/ckn delicious!   I opted to try the Chicken and Mac n' Cheese Waffles. Yup, you read that right! The boneless-fried Chicken is AMAZING. The breaded outside and juice inside?! Very flavorful! The waffles too, were very different and tasty to dip into their house made syrup! Seriously theeeee best chicken and waffles I've ever had- possibly the best in Henderson! Wootwoot!   I usually like to try a place once, and then continue on to other business so that I can try a new place every time- but The Stove is a place I don't mind returning to visit. This place is the real deal y'all! Come on in!

azMFR1Cjy5BRmY03aG6fOA.text: My husband and I tried it out for rhe very 1st time today and I was beyond satisfied with everything we ordered... rib empanadas, roasted peaches, and the corned beef and eggs... i mean everything had a balanced flavor and texture and size, (small) meaning you wont get full with appetizers before your meal.  They also havw vegan options and gf as well. We will be back... and Aleck out waiter was very cordial and attentive.  So over all 5 star experience.

dPo19F_JzZyi8o69yNP0pA.text: The family and I had breakfast at the Stove and it was great. My wife loved her egg and ham meal and my daughter and I shared the birthday cake pancakes. The pancakes were perfectly cooked and had a great texture. The bacon was also perfectly cooked, done but still rubbery;) The only negative was the long wait to get seated. We will be back again soon!

vWlOuo4Id8PyalhA5Fr60w.text: Food was just okay - nothing ground breaking. Our service was really terrible though. The hostess was nice, but seemed overwhelmed. We were the only people waiting to be seated - there were maybe 5 other parties already settled into their seats and many open tables. We waited 10+ minutes before we were seated.   Water glasses had particles floating in them. The waiter was annoyed that I asked for a clean glass of water. He dumped out my glass and refilled it - dude, I don't want the same glass dirty water was in. As he poured new water I looked in the pitcher and saw the white stuff floating inside the water I pointed it out (politely) and he rolled his eyes.   After all of that. I thanked him for taking care of it and we ordered drinks. Then he came around for our orders and we asked for recommendations. My friend said she was really excited to try a specific dish and he told her to order something else because it was really not good and he didn't know why it was 'soo popular, ew'. She ordered it anyway and enjoyed it. I ordered a couple things for us to try but wasn't impressed. The rude service and dirty water really tarnished this place for me.

x9O6_oXrPqiEna5SWl_Fjw.text: The Stove is insta-worthy cute, the menu items sounded fun, but the execution kinda fell flat. Here's the lowdown ~  Definitely make a reservation. This place is packed, and it was super easy to call a couple days before to skip the wait 25 min wait for Sunday brunch.   I love spicy and sweet drinks, but the Holla-Berry cocktail didn't quite hit the spot. It was more like a weak punch with jalapeno juice, definitely all sweet and no spice. I'm not trying to get fucked up for Sunday brunch, but I wanna feel a liiil' buzz at $12 a drink, 'nam sayin? On the other end of the scale, the Mimosa Float looked like 95% champagne and 5% orange juice. Tread carefully.  Salmon Benedict was not something I'd opt for again. The salmon was fishy, the English muffin was too big, and the hollandaise didn't stand out. But those potatoes were seasoned beautifully. If they were crispy, they'd be perfection. Also the poached eggs were over easy, I ain't mad but I know that's not everyone's thing.  To finish up, we had the birthday pancakes to share. The toppings and sprinkles definitely make this pancake, because they were definitely too dry. But seeing as it's mostly a vehicle for the berries, the small mountain of house-made whipped cream, and whole lotta sprinkles, it was still delicious. With syrup and butter, you probably wouldn't notice, but it's definitely an area they could improve upon.  Overall, The Stove has some details to iron out, but it was an okay experience and I'm sure once they find their footing they could be a great brunch spot.

It-YziO4YO0mMi5KzXBb2g.text: Love this spot! Menu items are incredibly well thought out. I've been here a few times. One of my favorites is the pecan pie pancakes! Pecan pie filling in between the pancakes and real bits of pie crust on the top! They also have an awesome assortment of tea time pastries which I hope to try soon. Another new menu item: champagne bongs for that special day out with your brunch crew! They also have a fun photo booth set up to top your visit off. Each time I go I'm blown away by the friendly and knowledgeable staff.

L2wYSupk19NCORTpVDAg7Q.text: 4 1/2 star review. But ultimately, the food earned themselves that extra half star.  This whole online reservation wait-list option was glitchy. Since I'm old school and have trust issues with technology, I decide to call directly. Hostess said she will put me on the waiting list (this was on a Saturday for 11:30am).  Arrived on time and my bf and I had to wait about 10-15 minutes. Waiting area is small and cramped. If you have a party of 4 or more, please don't all congregate in this area; there will be no room.  Service was average. Had to repeat our requests a few times. This restaurant isn't that new anymore, they should have gotten their customer service down by now. But...my bf said they're just overwhelmed with the amount of tables and how busy they are.   We ordered the following items: *Sausage Corndog. Comes with three per order. I would've gotten two orders of this as my entree. YUM!!!!! *Bacon Pancakes. Bf order this....he said it's good but be prepared to be in a food coma because you're eating carbs on carbs on carbs. *I ordered the Chorizo Frittata and OMGGGGG......my ideal breakfast/brunch item! There's chorizo, manchego, roasted tomatoes, greens on top. This was big enough for two more leftover servings the next few days!  Also ordered an iced lavender coffee with creamer. Perfect pep and flavoring!   Not sure why all of a sudden everyone is all about "brunching." Maybe it's those basic IG peeps but whatever it is, this is a solid brunch restaurant. I wouldn't go out of my way JUST to come here as there are PLENTYYYYYY of other really solid brunch restaurants around the city. But I still enjoyed it very much. Just wish they work out the whole reservation situation.

0rvUlq0sCfv3OhJBlB3yxg.text: This place was like a breath of fresh air with the great variety of breakfast and brunch options and their awesome customer service and ambience! They don't take reservations unless it's a party of 8 or more, and the high tea section is only available by reservation as well. The restaurant is not that big so the waitlist can be long. I would say it was worth the 40 min wait for brunch specially for the experience. I ordered the chilaquiles which were good but I thoroughly enjoyed their cinnamon roll, that is one to try!!! They offer bottomless mimosas for $18, the peace mimosa was great! I'll definitely be back and would love to try the high tea!

G3H6xlmXWEoWY3LXLw7TTg.text: Twice we have attempted to eat here, the first time was an almost 2hr wait before my party decided to leave.  The second time we were told 10 min wait and waited closer to 45 min, when we were finally seated the hosts were unorganized and after being seated it was obvious by the way we were treated that it was going to be a very long wait for service, having ask the table next to us how long they had waited just for their drinks which was not completed. If you are not a 20 something with a lot of time to kill or obvious friends with the staff don't bother trying to eat here

v--PQcg_m_ToENHMDekuUg.text: I'm gonna get straight to it: Orange juice - good Bananas Foster Pancakes - amazing Potatoes - pretty good Eggs - good Butternut Hash - delicious Toast - ok Jam for toast - great  Service - they're very busy but I thought it was good. We did wait a bit longer than I expected for the food to come out, but the staff was very good about refilling water and bringing us extras when we asked  Wait time - very long. They can't help that they're busy though. Join the wait list on their website before you leave home if there is 10+ people on the list. Also we noticed that there were several tables left empty for 30+ minutes even though there were 20 parties on the list.  Atmosphere - it's cute and looks like something you'd see someone hashtag on Instagram. We loved the cookie jars. It was extremely loud in there. My mom was 3 feet away and I could barely hear her. It's not their fault, just we aware. They do have a little booth with hats and props that will send you a 3 photo Gif for free. Helps pass the time.   Location - it's upstairs but they do offer an elevator. Parking is really tight, but Kneaders is closed on Sunday so you can park there and walk a little. There is very little room to wait. They offer a few sofas to sit on while you wait.   I'd come again, but on a less busy day.

eN_INPcvJa-3YpDNoEN4QA.text: Food was good. Just the service and waitress sucks. Came in and nobody watching the front. Everyones in the back. Only a few costumers too because it was early in the morning. Took my order and everything and fine. But when i got my food, for some reason i had to wait for my change. Gave her the money BEFORE getting my food and waited around 10-15. That was okay, pretty quick in my opinion. But in the entire time i waited she stood in front of me with the cash tray right next to her. But proceeded to go do other task.  When i waited about 5 minutes AFTER getting my food, i asked for my change, which i got a smart reply of. "Yeah I'll get it soon, its only a few dollars."  I still want my money so i can leave. Its still my money after all. No matter how little.  Then the waitress proceeds to continue to do other tasks until the moment she gave me my change. In which she just tossed a random amount of change on to the counter in front of me, with the right dollar amounts. Proceeded to say nothing even when i said thank you.   All in all. Waitress sucks, but the food is good. I recommend getting takeout besides dealing with the annoyed waitress. Didnt know getting change became such a task that you gotta make me wait and give me attitude when i just wanna leave after getting my food.

14c_m2fVx8XSZjnau0bmsQ.text: What happened to this place?! When we put ourselves on the waitlist online, we got no text confirmation, when we called in they told us you have to check in person? So why have an online waitlist to begin with? We got there and the hostess told us it would be another 20 min waiting (keep in mind at this point already an hour of waiting since online check in). She told me she would text me, we left and came back with no text reply. They almost seated the table we'd been waiting for an hour and a half at that point. The service from the servers and hostesses were god awful, lots of nasty looks and just all around unkind demeanors, my girlfriend and I felt uncomfortable with the service from the beginning. Our starter arrived incredibly late, it was the new food item Empanada, we had to return it. It honestly without exaggeration tasted like 7/11 taquitos. At that point the main dishes weren't arriving and it was taking so long we decided to leave. I used to really enjoy coming here, I used to love both the food and service when they opened, they are near my home and were my go to brunch place. I will never go back after this experience and I say that with confidence

HzUMIgo8f0-at6wC829Ddg.text: This place was DELICIOUS!! The wait was a bit long, but totally worth it in the end. My sister and I shared the Chilaquiles for brunch and found it to be above and beyond delicious! Our whole table also shared the maple pecan and birthday cake pancakes, ALSO so good! But definitely on the sweet side. We loved the look of this place, the service, and most of all the FOOD! Would come here all the time if I was local!

42pYslFtXNC5I4dHmnQkCw.text: This was an absolutely delicious choice for brunch. We went here for our two year anniversary and it did not disappoint. The atmosphere was very hipster, chic, and relaxed inside. Lovely views over the city as its upstairs. Our server, Collin, was fantastic, checked in often, and made great recommendations.  I got a lavender iced latte with almond milk and it has the perfect amount of lavender in it without tasting like I had eaten a sprig of it. I got the bacon pancakes with a side of house potatoes and used the vanilla chamomile syrup and it was all delicious. My girlfriend got the french toast which is flavored with orange zest and a side of bacon, both of which were also great. Totally wanna go back and try those brie pancakes!

RkfZby-nUUTbHDYFYIOdFg.text: I really wanted to like this place, we just moved here and both my husband and I are breakfast junkies. First let me say, this isn't the environment for children. Came here with our 8 month old although they didn't say anything, they didn't interact with the child and the hostess asked if we wanted a kids menu. He literally looks like an infant - that should've been a clue - that and the fact that it took her 5 mins just to get a high chair that seemed to be all the way in the back of the kitchen/restaurant. I'm guessing not a lot of kids go there.  To the FOOD;  The Pecan Maple Cinnamon Roll is delicious and not overly sweet at all. They pour the warm pecan icing right in front - still steamy. Yum!  The Crabby Patty Eggs Benny- ok I may be over critical cause I'm from Alaska and we do seafood best up there but this "King Crab" was the saltiest crab I have ever - in my life, tasted. And I've had a galore of crab dishes. The waiter, bless his heart tried to tell me that King Crab tends to be salty - this I know honey but the salt content of the crab was like sticking your whole face - with your mouth open in the ocean right at the beach. AND there were crab shells in it. Come on! Salmon Benny - same deal, the salmon was salty. We get its smoked salmon - trust us Alaskans we know. But it does not need to be this salty.  We're both breakfast cooks. That's how we met. Every chef/cook should know - if your meat is salty DON'T OVER SALT THE DISH. Sadly ate the dish around the crab (which is what makes the dish so expensive right). Well - waiter didn't offer a solution nor did he seem to care. 3 stars for the bomb cinnamon roll. Oh well, on to the next breakfast spot.

80ZVoBhI5TJ_wXEGjvxnLw.text: We came for our first time to the stove, (which is upstairs, not the bar downstairs) the bartender John was amazing with service and knowledge of the menu and drinks! They practically pampered us with management and our amazing bartender gave us anything we wanted to try. The food and drinks were perfect. If you want an amazing brunch experience,come here.

CTKGFprXxoxHg7laYqU-QA.text: Hands-down the best breakfast joint in town! I have been here four times and have enjoyed every meal throughly and the service is always great!

UmPUdKe3BMU2-EyjX9KD8A.text: This is just a fantastic place to come and relax in a friendly, comfortable - and delicious - space.  We came to brunch, and had such a great time!  When you're at The Stove, you're at home.  Relax, take your time, there's no rush here.  And you'll need time to enjoy all the fantastic choices on the menu!  Our visit was time for a large family visit, so we picked some appetizers to get started while looking over the meal choices.  Grilled peaches, short rib empanada, a pastry basket (already cut for sharing).  Of course, we indulged with bottomless mimosas.  And forget about simple orange juice, you want bottomless for the sake of trying the multitude of flavor choices - all made from fresh fruit.  My wife and I loved the hibiscus and watermelon best, but it was not easy to choose, it took lots of sips to decide.  Likewise, we had fun sharing each other's main dishes, but we have to go back another time to hit the parts of the menu we didn't cover.   We highly recommend saving room for dessert.  We indulged with the tableside bananas foster, nothing short of amazing!  And best served with 8-10 spoons to share.  The best part of visiting The Stove is the food, it's why we come - to eat.  But it becomes an experience, thanks to the staff and management, and the fun, relaxed, family vibe that exists here.  Thank you to Antonio and the entire crew for a wonderful visit, we look forward to sharing brunch with you again!

zEkBNgdJxMV3uH94gRuuuQ.text: My new favorite brunch restaurant!!  3 of us went and each ordered something different. Everything was fresh and delicious. Service is great. I got the yogurt, which is made in house. The yogurt is fluffy and just sweet enough. The strawberry compote they use in it was delicious, made in the restaurant, but just a little too sweet so next time order half as much. Berries fresh and sweet, granola very tasty.  The ham was smoky, moist and tender. Delicious! Someone at the table next to us got chicken fried steak, which I was very jealous of! It looked amazing. I asked her and she said it was the best she's had, so can't wait to go back and try it for myself.  They were completely out of ice tea, but that's OK. The environment was adorable, service was great and food was fresh and so delicious so they still get a 5-star!  They have a really cute photo booth, but they were adding some finishing touches to it so we couldn't use it. Looking forward to going back and using it to take some fun selfies.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Ham and eggs
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Deliciousness
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Yogurt with strawberry compote, granola and fresh berries

wV826EuyannD21bWFj658w.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! Their uniquely tantalizing menu includes a big selection of dishes full of flavor (the kind that makes your tastebuds stand up and pay attention). I've had a few of the dishes, and all were delicious. A favorite is their matcha green tea latte (divine). Their current seasonal pumpkin pancakes are extraordinary (must share, they're a big plate).  All of the servers are super friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is delightful as well.  Be prepared to wait for a table.  Enjoy!

ojnwM93DR0QY1DvPs9A-Vg.text: This by far was one of my favorite dining experiences I have ever had! I have never found a restaurant where I would want to try everything on the menu - extraordinary!  The food, service, drinks and ambiance were incredible. Very relaxing and delicious!- will definitely be back again soon!  Also - I really love how the waitress mentioned the food takes a bit of time to come out as everything is made from scratch.  I really love the relaxing environment and how everything is made from scratch!  If you're in a hurry, this is not the place for you :-)

6ziVKAL9tAOH27NNLJx20g.text: The store is absolutely perfect. The drinks, food, staff and decor is just second to none. The wait is usually long , but you can get your name on the list ahead of time and there is a cute photo booth.

oIE6BN_OQhz0ewCKT_Ni2Q.text: The Chefs creations were amazing. The plating and presentation was definitely high end. I love the uniqueness of this establishment and its menu. Definitely great food and great experience.

jKbEGaw4LRMvYRC0XZCiAw.text: Very loud, service was slow, wait time was very long, was seated at a large farm style table with another party. Probably will not be coming back here again.

6IUWdxrRks3pF0mJynAqSg.text: Quick & Dirty: Make a reservation.  Food is great. Service was great for us, but...  Long & Waiting:  We waited a LONG time to be sat.  Weren't notified of bottomless mimosas.  Waited some more.  And waited.  Talked to the manager and eventually got sat after expressing not being happy.  We eventually sat and had Mike (AWESOME) for our server.  Received complimentary pastries and mimosas. They did everything in their power to make us happy and succeeded.  Food was stellar.  Service was on point.  Wait estimation was terrible.    The ambiance is wonderful.  Place looks fantastic.    MAKE A RESERVATION!!!  And avoid frustration.  Would I go here again?  Yes, with a RESERVATION!!!!

WN5RHrkOLfP7A65qON3ZCQ.text: Excellent food.  This is an upscale affordable place for breakfast. You can tell it's been recently renovated, with cool styling and something of a hipster vibe. The kitchen is open to the floor and they have a prep area in the dining space to showcase some of their techniques (smoke in glass domes was cool to watch).   Service was super friendly, and waitstaff was attentive. It was a bit of a wait for food, but well worth it. Big portions are worth the slight price bump, and I found myself happily struggling to finish the eggs Benedict.  A new favorite. Will definitely come back.

jVXdk3Vw0yhRLshe_qarWA.text: I love this restaurant for the authentic flavors and variety on the menu. There are some gimmicks I wish they'd abandon, like the strange plates and odd hydroponic displays but otherwise the food is great for a brunch with family and friends.

2gF1mrqfQpFml4TEbFD1Tw.text: What a cute little hidden gem in Henderson. Love the tea party decor. Their mimosas and brunch menu was great and so was the service. My son's meal even came in the cutest little ninja turtle metal lunch box. I loved this place!!

Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
