VG0ZtL2CWr5QCwPuL2IhQw.text: Okay the food was good! Our server Mike was AMAZING! The birthday pancakes were good! But the EXPO.... can I just say I'll continue to go to this place JUST to see the expo. Tatted up guy, with hair slicked back preparing my food. Insert mouth watering emojis

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Hot expo guy
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Birthday pancake!

IrmK7iGYbGjmoOYv2lnyUw.text: Worst Tea Experience Ever! We all had the worst tea experience ever! Our waitress was horrible she didn't  explain the tea at all my niece asked if she could just get a croissant and a tea and the waitress said she would have to charge us $9.00 for a whole pot of tea instead of just a cup. Four of us got the tea but the waitress said we were only allowed 2 pots of tea on the table. No Devon-shire or Clotted  cream I've never been to a tea without Devon shire cream ever. The waitress had a terrible attitude and clearly didn't want to be there and she was awful at explaining the teas. The four of us who did order tea got our food later than the other two people who were smart enough not to order the tea. Other tables had their food way before us. I thought there would be an assortment of sandwiches but we just had cucumber and the scones and cake were very dry. My daughter ordered the tea with the charcuterie board and because she is a vegetarian she brought the meat and cheese in two separate bowls. The whole tea experience was the worst I've ever had and two of the people who were there had never been to a tea and because I was hosting I felt horrible by this. This was supposed to be a college graduation get together with my daughters cousins, we drove 45 minutes from Summerlin. Drive was not worth it! I emailed the restaurant hoping they would get back to me before I posted this review clearly they could care less.

hGqbF5LDlWJ9gnL4ULnV6A.text: I really like this place.  Their vegan option are super yummy.  Staff very friendly and welcoming.  Have gone here at least 5 times.

2l8t35_d24Y119zDnEcccw.text: Rachel was our server very attentive always gave us a smile and the eta for our food. I appreciate when servers communicate specially for a newly opened spot. The chef came around to check on us as well the service is definitely going to take care of you  food quality was good it was worth the wait we enjoyed both of what we ordered ( hang over corn dog and butternut raviolis)

dY6Q3i7MmH7rHdnB9tbA6g.text: If you like Kitchen Table, you will like The Stove. It has a similar feel, menu, and pricing. Great vibe and aesthetic. I was pleasantly surprised to have live music during my brunch visit. They were out of cinnamon rolls, so if you're a pastry lover, be sure to go early! I ordered the 'dem fancy eggs' and loved the cloched presentation and smokey flavor! My husband's bacon pancakes were heavenly. We will definitely be back!

RG6GTMyT-jg74WL_Gwmz8A.text: Shitty service - wait 10 minutes before you get water but Wait, we arrived at 10:45 there were only five people in the restaurant and we waited an hour before we received our food. Will not be returning. The restaurant is ice cold so make sure you bring a fur coat -  When we asked the waiter, they looked puzzled because I don't think they have even placed our order

L8mO4trcEGeSYjEzj69zyA.text: Very cool looking venue. And that's about it. Service sucked, waiting 15 minutes to get an order in. Never came around for water even after the mean. Drinks were nothing original, and the food cowboy nachos and French toast was not good.

hgUzjskjQXbfXvQEP1I3Fg.text: This place was amazing... the food was great the customer service was great.  I changed my mind on a meal I ordered and our server haul it changed it with no attitude and a smile on his face.  He was even attentive to my three year old and my joker husband. I will definitely be coming back.  They have a dessert and coffee menu. Plus they have a photo booth with props that will email or text you the pictures you took at no additional cost.

1nKjMs8ydniZ_fTJ0LPiYQ.text: By far the best breakfast in town! Great food. The most incredible staff! We go weekly, nowhere in town compares.

yINEatldw3LQeD6GDXmoYA.text: Had brunch here with a group of friends for my birthday. The staff and food were great. Fun atmosphere. Champagne with edible glitter was so fun!

iFgh0KsM7Ycdt2TjPYiAPw.text: New favorite! Great service! Great food! Great views! Right in the neighborhood. What more could you ask for? Tip: kiddos LOVE the Unicorn Hot Coco!  I had the Salmon Benedict and it was amazing!

AKyPAp-XQOQ4VpIZut85dw.text: Came for breakfast tuesday morning and was surprised that the place was packed, we had checked in on line so there was no wait. Everything was delicious and service was great. Table side banana foster was a fun thing to get for the table. Chiliquilies were ordered with no meat and had to be sent back. Crabby and pot roast Benny were both great. Very cute decor and Zoey took good care of us. will be back

Z5w27EpzKoMPgIF7aYZjfg.text: This restaurant has decent food, although very inconsistent. The service is unacceptable. The wait times are hours often times with empty tables around waiting to be bussed. The servers seem not to care and come around infrequently acting like they are doing you a favor and it's a hardship to come over to take your order. It's upsetting to order a pastry basket and have them give you halves of everything. Like who is eating the other half and why can't I have it if I ordered it? I've never seen any restaurant do that. Like did the server take a bite out of everything ? It's not like the pastries are that large or anything. That really bothered me. It takes a very long time for the food to arrive. My daughter had a hot chocolate with whipped cream and cotton candy. After the pastries and with our utensils covered in sticky chocolate, our server told me to gather all these dirty utensils so we would have them for our main course. It was a sticky mess. I had to ask for a clean utensil and they rolled their eyes and appeared annoyed. My waffles finally came cold and soggy drenched in too much sugar. The server said she would microwave them. They were inedible. Meanwhile there were empty tables all around me filled with dirty dishes for most of the 2 hours I was there. Yet up front there continued to be line and a 1 hour wait. I have given this restaurant 3 tries and each time I leave very upset and vow never to go back. I just don't understand the lack of proper management and it's been open long enough they should be able to figure out a way to normalize wait times and efficiency because it otherwise would have potential. The food is also very inconsistent. We have had the chilaquiles ( which are good) and each time they are different. Same with the pancakes which were great the first time with whipped cream and fresh fruit and not good the last time with a dry and different consistency and they simply forgot the whipped cream fresh fruit garnish. It gets incredibly frustrating to wait so long and have food arrive that needs to be sent back. It's very disappointing because I thought initially the restaurant had a lot of potential and we need neighborhood restaurants like this.

DaEesVLgT78QQrRydFt2JA.text: The food was fantastic and I'm looking forward to going back soon. As is the case with a lot of new restaurants the service was a little slow and I expected that going in so I'm giving them a pass. I've recommended it to several people who have gone and had a great experience.

TxBJpLMSwaB63RGPrIuzJA.text: The restaurant is Adorable! The food is great the service is even better! We had Rachel she was so sweet and knew all about the menu I really enjoyed her presence! We will be back!!

_7DBviC-P7AWDR_9rGBW3w.text: The Stove is lit. Been here 3 times already and everything I've had has been bomb. Avocado toast, caviar, beet salad, Mexican egg, tandoori chicken. The list goes on, so many things on the menu it's going to take many more visits to try them all.

bd8D0GdB7MAOI8_dHH3z-w.text: Great new restaurant for brunch in Henderson!  Fantastic food!  Best hot chocolate with cotton candy (Unicorn Hot Chocolate).   Menu is unique and has something for everyone.  Our group tried the avocado toast, Country Benedict, Belgian waffle, Birthday cake pancake, and Maharaja. All was delicious and great presentation.  Super nice owners and friendly staff! Congratulations on opening such a gem.

Unc-wDxQpe7HBMddbqp4ZA.text: Since S&P closed I've been waiting for a new spot to open. So far I've been here 3 times and every time I am impressed with the quality of the food and service. They are definitely getting popular so I recommend making reservations or putting your name on the wait list. I have yet to try their tea service.

6ZitfmZktbfXZ3dlGn6J9w.text: Wait staff are very nice and do a good job. 3rd time within 8 months with significant issues. For an upscale restaurant and awesome decor, this place might not last long.

RJz4Fa-QPzO9D47N8Yifjg.text: This place was great, super yummy chiliquiles and the seating outside was really nice.  Our server was also very kind and helpful.  Definitely suggest checking it out as one of the great breakfast spots in Vegas. Also be aware it is upstairs and was a little tricky to find when we first got there.

NfPwFs88TbNTd03ZSfJKMA.text: The food is excellent, many choices, nice view of the mountains and very friendly staff.  We stopped here on our way they town - based on the yelp rating-  we'll worth it.

EEFhjUJ91XrXUIoyern_kw.text: We just had our first visit to The Stove and we're hooked! The ambiance is awesome, service was great, food was delicious. My daughter is currently in sugar overload from the unicorn hot chocolate and birthday pancakes! The service was friendly and fast, especially for such high-quality, made from scratch food. It was bustling and, yes, a bit on the louder side. But, I'd say that's a positive! People were talking and enjoying themselves. I'd highly recommend this spot!

b9xSCQdyBtUHbuWwYXuVmQ.text: This was our first time coming to The Stove.  Service was very friendly, environment was welcoming, comfortable and fun.  We got the avocado toast and the chicken and waffles.   The food was great!   Both dishes were unique and delicious.

92uwTbEBozHo_J1nxWA5QA.text: Absolutely Amazing!  The food, atmosphere, and employees definitely make this place. I had the gluten free French toast - delicious!  Friends enjoyed the chicken and waffles, corn dogs, croissants, mimosas, bangers and hash, and veggie wraps. Not one of us left there hungry and everyone of us cleaned our plates!  The Stove is a place you must visit!

2_eM_ptW1psW7oG_L-1JNw.text: Wonderful food and great atmosphere. Had the egg white frittata. A savory dish well worth the experience. Great service.

lrLziZ53KpZZcBHmE-67SQ.text: Went for brunch today with my sister in law and the place is super cute! Loved the atmosphere! Our service was good and brunch was delish. I went with savory for my first time but next time I will definitely be indulging in something sweet! Good size menu and staff was attentive! I couldn't finish my plate and a guy came by to make sure I liked it, that he doesn't like seeing food on plate... well that because it was a huge portion! Ha. Tried my best to eat what I could! We will be back!

u-3zpqCIj0wVk267x8kvmA.text: I went to the stove on August 10th around 1 PM, my server was amazing!! His name is Mike. He was so sweet, answered all questions, and talked to our group. The food took around 45-50 minutes to come out which was annoying but not a huge deal. The hostesses were very rude and kept looking at our group and staring at us and talking about us. We were very upset and felt uncomfortable because our group was not even being loud or causing a disturbance and they were just continuing to stare. I highly recommend the burger from the lunch menu it was great.

RdxIKB8UMpEMNrIR9tr5OA.text: we came here on fourth of july because kitchen table was closed and we're so happy we found this place! everything was delicious and amazing quality. will definitely come back.

Iz9Hm4JWkXuXuLZE_Rh91w.text: I've eaten here twice. The first time was on a Sunday and it was very crowded, which tells me it's a very popular place. We waited for a while to finally be seated, which was understandable. The wait allowed us to focus on the decor and layout of the restaurant, which we agreed was very well done. Once seated our waiter was excellent. We were very impressed with the vertical herb garden and the way the herbs are used not only for cooking, but for plating the food. Very nice. My second visit was mid-week and we arrived early (11:30) for lunch hoping to avoid a long wait for a table. We were seated within 5 minutes and the place was already packed. I ordered a hamburger and my friend ordered a veggie burger. My hamburger was flavorful but the fries were limp and soggy. My expectations were that for $16, a hamburger and fries should be excellent. Here are my reasons for a 3 star rating. The service was very slow both in waiting for our food after we ordered, and in waiting for someone to clear the plates after we were finished eating. The restaurant was also very noisy which made it difficult to have a conversation. Despite this criticism my hopes are that things will improve with time and this restaurant will be very successful.

5Ct7ofJk3MP6-0T2ZkiaqQ.text: I would like to start off by saying the food  is delicious here. Doug was our server he was good informed us on how the food is cooked at a slower pace, so the wait did not bother us. Okay now for the reason of the 4 stars, the check in was quite annoying, they have all these people waiting to be seated in a very small area. There were plenty of clean tables, but kept us and about 10 other people crammed in by the entrance for at least 20 minutes. It was very hot in there they had a oscillating fan pointing at our table which was dirty you could actually see the dust hanging off of it. I ordered coffee which the first cup was great very hot the next cup was actually cold. I realize this is a new place that would be the reason for the running around, but not getting much done. I will give this place another try due to the fact that the food is really good and the decor is very cute.

0xUVz6wQT8EvLUjTXAfVTA.text: Classic breakfast dishes with a fresh twist.  Food was excellent and the service was great. Atmosphere was awesome.  The decor was clean and fun.  There is a selfie booth and a tea room. Can't wait to go back for high tea.

ZPtaq5YRnJXClIzAE9jxqw.text: Cutest new brunch spot in town!! Unique food concepts and amazing tastes!! Who doesn't love a good brunch??

pbyR2upIoBEYGC3um17eVg.text: So the restaurant overall is very cute the way it is decorated. The food was ok, wasn't horrible, tasted fine. Our server was very nice. The reason I'm giving it a 1 star is due to the hostess today. When we walked in 1 hostess stood there on her phone, never looked up or said hello. We were told a 15 min wait even though there were 3 open tables. Once we got seated, my mom and I were seated right next to the the hostess stand so we heard everything. Two girls came in and were told a 45 min wait and so they asked for a recommendation of places near by they could eat. The hostess told them there was a hooters down the road, even though there are other breakfast options available. Didn't offer them to have a coffee or drink to stay and wait. The two girls started walking out and a server had to go get them and  told them they could be seated right away. The hostess is the first interaction a customer receives when coming in and they were not friendly or welcoming.

gliwn7UG6_0VU2T8uPUOXQ.text: Checked out the Stove for Sunday brunch and I can't say enough good things about this place. Great food, super friendly staff, and a really cool vibe throughout the restaurant. Can't wait to come back and try some more of the dishes.

oCnSvrZqeXTlO3RuPlUhPA.text: This is a great place; great food and service, and the room itself is amazingly crafted detail and is very comfortable.  The Stove has a tea room and a Chef's table too.   The menu is diverse but every item is made as if someone cares and the Chef is present at the pass ensuring the food is perfect.  The Stove will do well.  Looking forward to the fall to have coffee on the patio but the counter is nice too.  Try the house made pastries.

A15VYFWpVj-sS3nTRQwbCQ.text: I would give this zero stars if I could. My husband and I went there today at approximately 1:20pm. It's a Saturday so we expected a wait even though it was after 1:00pm. Happily we were seated within 15 minutes of our arrival. That was the only good thing that occurred on this visit. We were seated for 7 minutes before we were even acknowledged. Finally our server came over to us. My husband ordered water and I ordered ice tea. Seven minutes later he came back with water but no ice tea. I cancelled the ice tea and took water. We ordered Pecan Pie Pancakes and a Berry Special waffle. Thirty-two minutes later someone brings over food to our table. States Churro pancakes, no we had Pecan Pie pancakes. Oh, it's the table right next to us (they arrived at least 20 minutes after us). The server stopped at their table. No, it's not theirs either. Refilled their waters ( but not our empty glasses) and left without one word to us. By now we were there 46 minutes with the server barely acknowledging us. We got up and left (told the hostess as we didn't see the server). This is a new restaurant but there is no excuse for our poor service. We watched the restaurant and others were served faster. It's also very loud and noisy with no children there. Very disappointed for what was suppose to be a higher end brunch restaurant. Will not go back and do not recommend it.

XbW1VqXRBsCGj9oKFFs77w.text: This is my first visit here and it is spectacular. The food is presented in such a unique and aesthetic way. The taste is even better. I ordered the vegan skillet- amazing. 10/10 would recommend.

z7LQ44ls_BIGQJrI3yRvjg.text: LOVE the food, the service, the location and the darling decor.  The Stove is the perfect place!!

R41YQ6ZJ8HnlZhqI2AqnYA.text: Most awesome restaurant! Saturday's and Sunday's it's brunch time but expect a wait! But while you're waiting you can go to the bar to start your mimosas or even coffee with a pastry! They had live music and my server Colin was incredible! Everyone is very very friendly and I believe it was the GM & Store manager to make their way around to the tables to see how everyone was and if they're enjoying themselves and making good jokes! Lol , also the selfie booth was a Way fun thing to go to during brunch so much fun for groups ! So glad that I found a new brunch place and I'll be back fersure

8pX9tF-2LwmP6SpkiH9iOg.text: Looking for a new awesome brunch spot!? Look no further. Don't come if you're in a hurry as the food takes a little bit longer than expected to come out... but for good reason!! You can tell its because each plate is crafted with care and so so so delicious. The staff was very attentive and all their food recommendations were exactly what we wanted. Great spot for Sunday!!

mxkOyxAnVG8W_4BEJx_FcQ.text: This is a very creative menu that is as eclectic as it is past. My only complaint is that they need more tables. For breakfast or brunch it can't be beat

N3Pg-6XSUCyHE70m4CMoKQ.text: The food was amazing!  We started with a Mimosa and iced coffee, got a Cinnabon to start.  I then got my Mexican egg which was incredible!  I also ordered the Waffle Poutine.  This however, took over 30 minutes to get!  My iced coffee was empty as was my Girlfriends mimosa.  I finally got the Poutine and it was worth the wait!! Our server was great at first but I ended up having to wave down another server to pay our bill about 20 minutes after we finished and got no refills on coffee and Mimosa.  I know they are new so have some kinks to work out but I'll definitely be back for the food.  Service needs some work.

_8I8wIMva2BYjG0oWsJeWw.text: Most flavorful! Service was very friendly and efficient. Welcoming atmosphere, smart decor. Definitely would recommend this place to friends for an afternoon of great food, drinks & ambiance.

QGtnDty533Ff9tHNtUiKyA.text: This an an awesome place for brunch. Amazing service, try the Sake infused Blackberry  champagne! Amazing service from the staff. Will be back!

VE0aeHLuyrdpd7TC6uKYGQ.text: The stove is AMAZING  the staff is so friendly & knowledgable.. Landon and Rachel are the best. Their food blows any place in Henderson out of the water! Definitely recommend the street Benny & croquet madam!

RbXKG1uC9dHVi0pWdXJe3Q.text: I visited the stove a couple weekends ago and loved everything, from the atmosphere and decor, to the service and food. The restaurant does get pretty busy on weekends so the noise level is loud and the wait for a table is long but definitely worth it. The hostess and waiter were both attentive and informative (A+ for customer service). The food was beautifully arranged. My kids ordered the burgers and I ordered the egg tacos and we all found it delicious. I will be coming back! Keep up the good work.

ABnXY0QFhy9sCm4rO-Iydg.text: Use the online wait-list, we did and still waited 15 minutes. It was definitely worth the wait. Decor refreshing, service was exceptional and food, eggs benedict, bananas foster pancakes, chicken fried steak (gravy was good enough to order as a soup!) was well worth the inconvenience. Will DEFINITELY return again, and again.....

zCggZYAFxUzTil8nFUgJog.text: Great restaurant for breakfast. Chief is dialed into many cultures. Food has amazing taste. Service is awesome and friendly.

c1MaBhUJ7JWTEM3_rKmKWg.text: Great food at the stove. They have a couple customer service kinks to fix however. I've been 3 times & the wait time has been over 45 minutes every time. Their waiting room can be as packed as one person per square foot. I think they will fix this as there is a bunch of space that isn't being utilized properly. also, some of the employees seem to need a little more training & are on the awkward side but the majority are great. with all this being said I still would give it 5 stars because the food is unparalleled for the area.

nZW14ac5cyOPJegS7AwYRw.text: I really hate giving this review because I love the food and don't want them to leave, HOWEVER...  Last weekend we went to the stove and chose not to wait the estimated 45 minutes to 1 hour since the person at the desk was very non-committal on how long it would actually be.  There were not a lot of people waiting and she told us it was because they have an online waitlist and people from the waitlist have priority over walk-ins.  She suggested that in the future, we go on-line and add our name to their waitlist.  Then we would be notified when we should come in for little or no wait.  "GREAT", we thought.  We'll do that next time.  So today, I added my name to their waitlist at 11AM.  I was the 23rd name on the list and the 4th party of 2.  I checked the list every 15 or 20 minutes and at one point I had moved up to 13th in line but then later found I had fallen back to 15th.  I have no idea how this happens, but it did twice.  After I moved up to 10th, I dropped back to 13th.  I was consistently behind 3 other parties of 2.  After 2 1/5 hours, none of the parties of 2 had been removed from the list.  At the 3 hour point, I was at the top of the list, probably because the people ahead of me gave up,  but I was NEVER notified that a table was ready.  After 3 1/2 hours, I was still at the top of the list.   I'd really like to hear from the restaurant about how this happens.  Obviously, the wait list is a joke.  Can't they at least let you know that they have no intention of seating you?  It shows a complete lack of respect for customers.  Not everyone can wait the amount of time it takes to get seated.  At some point, people may be tired of waiting and move on toe the next "hot" restaurant.  You may come to regret treating customers like you don't need them.  That's how I feel now.  Because of the good food, I have told a lot of people to visit The Stove and I have brought friends there.  Obviously, it's easier to get in during the week.  I understand you can be too busy to accommodate every one.  Just be honest and don't let people hanging on a waitlist and then never even contact them.  There should also be a way to take yourself off the waitlist.  There is not.

OlVeh-tHITw1_Yoygpe0vQ.text: This place is amazing!! The avocado toast is the best I've ever had and considering I'm from Southern California, that is saying a lot. This is my new favorite brunch place

BUvD3BMMcOPr5BChhNafnw.text: Amazing new place in Vegas. The food was excellent and the staff was very attentive. Get their early to avoid the wait. Loved everything for brunch. Cinnamon roll was amazing!

tF7nu9uOVnrVfxF-mVP0Ow.text: I wish I could say more about the restaurant's food offerings, but the only thing I experienced was the waiting area...and after an hour and a half of that, we left and went somewhere else.  30 minutes later, I received a text saying the table was ready.  Two. Hours. Later.  Now granted, it was a Saturday morning, but if the wait is going to be that long for 4 people, perhaps a heads up from the hostess would be in order.  Instead, all we got was "it won't  be long now" the three times we asked about the status.  I hear the food is great, but they seriously need to work on the service unless the goal is turning people away.

Xu1bMKHW-oP_i5npYoJHpA.text: so happy to have another good independent restaurant in our side of . only trouble is I have to decide between them . had the chliquiles, which were great, and yet I have no idea how to pronounce them. great decor and well trained staff

J0Ha2F0GRqrw6sRwt-UWXQ.text: Been here twice. Everyone's meal was an event!   The owners are active in the operation and are hustling to make sure their patrons are satisfied and happy.  Great vibe!  Great food!  Great ownership!  Great experience!

phmm8r-P4l9I8Ghsaxg9vA.text: Awesome brunch spot. Interesting twist on traditional brunch staples. You can tell they use fresh, quality ingredients in their food as well. Gorgeous restaurant with a great view. We will definitely be back soon.

2vG36nj2c9gpMIWGfsz58Q.text: The restaurant is beautiful with awesome menu options.. servers were nice. But everything came out cold, and took forever. We asked to sit outside so maybe our server just forgot about us often. My boyfriend and I both ordered lattes and they took an extremely long time coming out. When they arrived they were not even luke warm. We battled over sending them back, and ended up asking for new ones. The new lattes were still not warm.   We then waited for 45 minutes for our food to come out, and at this point the morning rush was over the restaurant had begun to empty out so there was no reason for the wait.. we finally got our entrees. They were completely cold. My croque madame came with soggy bread, so I believe our food was just sitting. We didn't say anything as we just wanted to eat. The food did taste good. We then received our appetizer we ordered after our meals.. slightly annoying.  It's just hard to give positive reviews on a restaurant with the food and beverages in the state we received them. Definitely willing to adjust my review and give a second chance, just maybe won't sit on the patio so we aren't forgotten.

vpwFP23IEyiIJj188YNTHQ.text: We heard this was a great place to eat for breakfast. Good food, great view, cool vibe. So we arrived at 9:15 or so. The built-in seating is way to low so my wife grabbed a pillow to sit on. We were seated and the server really was very helpful. We ordered breakfast and my wife went to the bathroom. She came out and said "The bathrooms are dirty. They didn't clean up from the night before. The trash was overflowing from the bin. The TP roll was empty but a roll was sitting on the tank." I looked around our table and saw the floor had built up grime under the neighboring table. The table was also missing its laminate edging in several places. The wall had screws where pictures once hung. There's that creepy feeling; "How dirty is the kitchen?" "Should I stay or should I go now"! The food arrived. The plates were cool/funky and CLEAN? Maybe, maybe not. We liked the food but the whole time we wondered if we made a good decision. We didn't get sick but we are not going back.

dwvcTroe6rDrfVJIN5JZrg.text: We went to this place on Sat for lunch it was overly amazing . Everything but first the sever we got bottomless mimosa and he never let it be empty kept filling it up . His name was Marco, he gave us the best service in Las Vegas I have ever seen and I'm very picky person but he was amazing . Food on the other hand was amazing also this is going to be our to go place because of the service and quality of food . Thank you Marco

sF2bel1uBfJFDxA1feF2iw.text: Came to this new chef driven restaurant off Eastern in Henderson that used to be our local location for the infamous Firefly Spanish Tapas restaurant.  If you like Kitchen Table (one of the owner/chefs is from there) then you're going to love this spot.  Met up with a few friends and we all chose different menu items.  Two of my friends decided to get afternoon tea service while me and another friend ordered regular menu items.  I ordered "Dem fancy eggs" and it came out with a wonderful smokey presentation.  Once they lift the lid off, you can smell and see the smokey flavor wafting up in the air.  My friends said the tea service was good, as well as the story behind all the cups and plates used.  Basically, they were all bought out from a collector of antique tea ware so don't be off put if your plateware doesn't match up, as it is done on purpose.  Ask your server, if you're getting tea service, of the story and you will appreciate more the cups and plates being used.  My other friend said that his muffalatta sandwich was good as well as their sausage corn dogs.  The only thing I will say to the management of this establishment is that they really should offer reservations for brunch/breakfast because it is insanely busy and waiting 1.5 hours for a table is not fun.  They do offer reservations for the tea service side where you can also order the full menu however someone must get the tea service in your party in order to sit on that side of the restaurant.  This is what we did in order to circumvent the long wait.  Oh, please get new tables on the tea service side as the old re-used "bottle service" type of tables do not go well with your food driven concept.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Dem fancy eggs - comes out smoking!!  Great presentation and taste
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Muffalatta - nice kick to it!
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Sausage corn dogs- superb!

tv5r1L6i3rIjD7_d0DFymQ.text: Needs seasoning. The food is very bland. Service is slow....great atmosphere.  A friend and I waited 2 1/2 hours to be served. The owner ended up taking the meals off the check but after eating it, he should have done that whether it took too long to be served or not. The food was bland, bland, bland!

S5Rlh_TRKvDbUTAkSPOasQ.text: Cute brunch spot with a variety of options! Everything is made to order so be prepared to be there for a while. They have a photo booth where you can go and take pictures.

DZxSZo74limwlHax0ewJSQ.text: The service in this place is horrible. I wanted to eat there with my boyfriend and our baby. We arrived at 11:15am and there was only one person in front of us in line and were told the the wait would be 20-25mins. Even though we saw 3 empty tables that could have fit us. We waited patiently. 10 mins later. We saw a guest leave one table but nobody came to clean it for 20 mins. Then the host told us she was going to sit us there, she just needed to clean it first. Not joking she sat us at a table that was empty for 30mins. We sat down at 12pm. We waited 45 mins for a table that was empty for 30 mins. When we sat we waited another 5 mins to order. And we tried to order our food immediately but was told that the food would still take 30-35 mins to come out because they make there food "fresh". Because we had an appointment at 1 we decided it wasn't worth waiting longer for and left. When we told them we were leaving and why, they didn't care and just said ok. Like it didn't matter. They really didn't care about our time or the fact that we were with a baby. It would have been nice to try the food since we drove 30 mins from mountains edge to try it but after waiting so long it didn't seem worth it.

8VN52OREO0rao40yxJc4-Q.text: I love the atmosphere of this place. The menu items all sound amazing. I ordered the avocado toast salad. First time poached eggs were more like boiled eggs, they apologized and had them redone, except this time underdone. I just ate the salad and the avocado toast. I was good just cook needs to be a bit more consistent.

YlTPsrKplToYr8nYGBZfBw.text: Celebrated an early Mother's Day here. It was such a nice change of pace. I liked the fresh herb wall and the attention to detail that goes into plating each item. The kids had a blast in the photo booth and loved that their meals came in a metal lunch box. My favorite thing I tasted was the corned beef and I really want to try the bananas foster pancakes next time!

uuhGW5XdQI3WGMBhcpWsKA.text: This place is VERY VERY LOUD!!! On top of that, they had some guy playing a guitar and playing music. Very disturbing for someone who wanted a chill morning, enjoying food with family.  Also, half the place had open seats and we still had to wait to be seated. Poor use of their space.  All around a frustrating experience.

9wgwNLXb01xBC9K8GYFsYw.text: A little bit of a bizarre experience today. I always enjoy the breakfast here but then again I always order off the menu. My husband on the other hand does not. He always orders the same thing. Ham, sausage, cheese scramble. Simple right? You would think. Ha. Well, we had a new server today. Young millennial girl. My husbands order came out all wrong. She tried to take his plate back and he told her no. He will eat it anyway. She then tried grabbing the plate and he said no, He never sends food back because people will spit in your food. She then stormed off and said she was so offended, lol. The manager then came over and paid for our whole meal. That was awesome. Gotta love this place. Thank you for the breakfast. As usual mine was delicious.

VY25n5LWHA9EkyitogRRcw.text: EVERY DISH WAS WAY TOO SALTY!!! Won't be back. Great decor on the inside of the restaurant though. Hostess could be better.

y59IgMNe8WhvtFgE6507mQ.text: Loved the inviting ambiance and the service staff were very friendly. The menu has a lot of options including vegan. The food had great flavors! I Love that they offer afternoon tea...we will definitely be back for brunch! A must try..

NBrJ-pRLMwAa4srwqPU-mQ.text: I came for brunch on Sunday at 2 p.m., the place was full but we got a spot right away. The ambiance is very nice, good views and super quaint. You can tell it's a labor of love. The server was prompt, friendly, and had good suggestions. Ordered the French toast, short rib tacos, farmhouse plate and 2 lattes. Excellent quality! I asked for a to-go cup for my remaining latte and the server came back with a new full-sized latte for me. How sweet of her! This place is great for brunches and I could see myself hosting a private event here, like a baby shower or something.

WJxM56JAGOFRg0aWZk5iiA.text: Great food, awesome ambience... Service was lackluster at best. Food took a long time to come out. Server was not familiar with the menu. My niece saw the Unicorn Hot Chocolate on Instagram and had to have it but was told they don't carry it. Asked another server and she quickly pointed it out on the menu... while waiting for our food our server took all our unused dishes (food hadn't arrived yet). When the food arrived - we had no dishes or utensils. It just didn't make sense. I love the place in itself. I am hoping the service will get better.

ANWwvikfbPoI9HPCVC-rKg.text: The hostess here are so unprofessional, they stare the entire time,they are harassing us messaging on social media because we gave a negative yelp review , we felt very uncomfortable in the restaurant because of the hostess. The waiter was amazing and so nice though . They need different more mature hostess that doesn't go message you on social media

oXL1hWs0OBlvxjbp0eRUTA.text: If I could give less than one star I would. When in for brunch Saturday at 1 o'clock in the afternoon. Had no problem with waiting 15 minutes for a table. However, then we had to wait another 20 minutes for water our  waitress took our drink order and we didn't see drinks for another 25 minutes. Owner of the restaurant explained there's only 1 bartender on even though this restaurant was packed with people. Watched many people walk out. We stuck with it, very pretty room, pretty food, but couldn't eat the avocado on the avocado sandwich because it was hard as a rock. Rest of the food was mediocre at best.  This restaurant really has to work out its kinks. The kitchen and the bar are killing the servers here. We did have our meal comped. But what a complete waste of time. I think this place will be closed within 2 months!

yvLoGNpSXQjFxFKaxTBuAQ.text: We tried the place yesterday.   I was excited to try this much hyped brunch place in Henderson.  They have a online list you need to get yourself on if you want to eat there and get seated in under an hour.  Even then it took 2.5 hours on the list to be seated which waiting at home wasn't the worst thing because it's so trendy right now.  But the food and drinks were very slow in coming.  We had appetizers, champagne cocktails and and entree and it was a 2 hour meal which was just too long.  Additionally it was very loud and worse it was too warm in the restaurant.  The AC can't keep up with the hot vegas summers...   I brought the kids because of the unicorn hot chocolate and that was very good and the kids enjoyed that.  The food is plated very elegantly and they get 5 stars for plating.  Unfortunately to food taste was not up to par. My father in law and I both had the crabby patty Benedict and we both felt it was below average.  The Benedict sauce was tasteless and the crab portion of it was tiny and overly salty.  My wife had the suckling pick Benedict and again the sauce was bland.  The suckling pig was on the dry side as well.  The appetizers were only ok... As for the cocktails, I was very disappointed in the creamsicle.   The island Champaign was decent however.   Overall I think the place is just overhyped for very average tasting food at an above average price.

flLD0OUps9YdsxVWQsXlqA.text: I heard great reviews about this place, I figured I'd give it a try.   The decor was cool but that's about it. The menus were disgusting since they were printed on basic computer paper. The service was awful and the food wasn't that great. And how do you run out of espresso?? This is a breakfast/ brunch place- come on people!

-vVJXOFcQ2bSIhBgVVmqcA.text: Loved it here . Service was great , mimosa selection was amazing ! The funfetti scone was very good , we always get the avocado toast as it is so savory and scrumptious. The location is so cute upstairs and the interior design is perfect for a instagram photo shoot . We always refer our friends and family here as the menu is very unique but yet you can get something classic too.

uE5DNkZ1YSq9gEo895MN0A.text: I was able to finally try this place out a week ago and I'm still craving for another stove experience. Service was on point, place was too cute (gal pal brunch), and the FOOD was so so yummy. We shared the bananas foster, empanadas, and for some odd reason i wanted the BLT of all things but none of those items disappointed. I can't wait to go back to try something else

zQ1ahY5E5ZcDvwY4dlspag.text: I have to say I can't wait to return. Great menu, super fun and enjoyable atmosphere. I ordered the corn battered sausage with over easy egg with cream cheese just to see the presentation and it didn't disappoint. We arrived on a Monday later in the day so seating wasn't an issue but I can imagine the wait during peak hours. There were 4 in our party and The Stove was a hit with all of us. We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

sZgEXvYarsPc347I5gq-SA.text: This place is amazing! Not only is the venue itself beautiful it has a breathtaking view of Las Vegas....SCORE!! I've been 3 times now and the food is spot on every time. The fried chicken is SOLID and so are the sake infused cocktails. They offer bottomless mimosas for a great price too..... Can't wait to go back and I need to try the High Tea because the pastries look delicious. Staff is friendly and outgoing too! Great job on a new venture!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

EipOWaK1mt5jpEEdzwdlBg.text: This place is a gem. Very unique plates. Great views and eclectic space. I got the duck hash and wasn't a fan. The duck was a little too salty for my taste but I believe it was how the duck is supposed to be prepared. However my boyfriend ordered the chicken and waffle and it was one of the best I've ever had. Also wished they were also open for dinner

jAWCdlCBy-Dt7NDNVVTctQ.text: Hard one to rate....  Went shortly after they opened. Visit went much as you would expect. Good food, disorganized waitstaff and kitchen. Enjoyed the food, but didn't write a review.   Went back a few months later...give them time to shake it out. Surprisingly same issues. Reasonably good food served badly from both a server and a kitchen perspective.   Went back again today. 1/3 full. Noticed that several of the items disappeared from the menu. Maybe a good thing to solve the kitchen issues?  Don't really know. Do know my wife's favorite is gone. Oh well, it happens. Problem is it hasn't solved either of the problems. Took forever to get eggs and ham. Overheard the tables next to us complaining they were there 25 minutes before us and still had no food.   Can't say I've had a bad meal from a food perspective...just disorganized kitchen and waitstaff. Expected more!  Also removed salt and pepper from the tables. Don't ask for any...the waitstaff will just take your order back to the kitchen?  The prices aren't Denny's. They need to provide a better experience. Kerry Simon place that preceded them had some of the same problems.   Hope they succeed.

M586Y8q3fkE38jtyCBhpXQ.text: Ambiance, super cute. Food, DELICIOUS. Mimosas, Bottomless! I had been craving eggs Benedict and decided to come here. Let's talk about the ham on the Benedict, it was thick, crispy and amazing. It had a bacon quality to it and was simply amazing. The egg was poached to perfection. 6/5 stars for sure.  The bottomless mimosas were I think $19 and you can get flavors. Mango, peach and hibiscus were good but nothing beats the regular mimosa. Next Sunday Funday, start here for sure!

DF71_FzPtVpFGSwfbxYlGw.text: Cute spot!  Inviting space, friendly service and creative dishes.  All baked goods are made onsite.  Croissant was so good (and I'm picky about my croissants)!  The egg white frittata was yummy too.  My mom didn't care for the waffles with her fried chicken dish (but she loved the chicken), but otherwise everything was spectacular.  Make sure to signup for the waitlist before heading over!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Yum
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Fried chicken &amp; waffles

8sKnwGi-uj1VXRsojqh6ig.text: This is my second time here. So this is reviewing both visits.  the first experience: was HORRIBLE! The food was extremely salty that I couldn't even eat my meal. I ordered the Chilaquiles and my husband ordered the Country Fried Steak, and both had so much salt that they were NOT even edible. I asked my husband to taste mine, then I tasted his; we both agreed the food overall was horridly salty; could not even taste any of the flavors of our food because our tongues were numb from the extreme saltiness!  we decided to give it another chance thinking maybe we caught the restaurant on a bad day, which by the way should never happen! You want to serve customers with the best quality food... but that was not the case with our 1st and 2nd experience.  Second time: I ordered the Crabby Patty Benedict because it had good reviews on yelp, BUT it was more like a cream cheese Benedict with a smidge of crab. It was served with ONLY ONE piece of crab that was 1 inch (long) x .5 inch in thickness. I thought that there would be more crab underneath the egg, but it was all just cream cheese and sauce! And the sauce was still extremely salty! So disappointed!!  I only gave 1 star for the decor, but the food deserves ZERO stars!

W5O3M4mOCuzapuKLZ7tkFw.text: Adorable breakfast spot!!  Ordered chilaquiles and they were amazingly tasty. Also lots and lots of sweets to want and try. Hubby ordered the corned beef and even though i'm not a fan of corned beef it was quite good. Check them out, wont regret it

9PCH9Um5I1_k86Coi1eonQ.text: New favorite spot in Henderson.  Super cute, service is great! My favorite dish so far is the carbonara which I didn't take a picture of it.  But I had the burger yesterday and it was really good. The fries were just ok (average)

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

2FTD9W14eG9_p7qjbs8T5A.text: Ok - the place is the bomb.  You can read the reviews and these guys can live up to the hype. The eggs Benedict with pork - outstanding. If you like pork carnitas / the meat is totally on par with the best taco you have ever had with this meat. Service was great. Cinnamon rolls - when you have a server that pours the hot white glaze over the roll - pretty awesome stuff.  Afternoon tea room area is awesome. Warning - be aware that items that are highly recommended on yelp are not always on the menu. The Mexican ice cream -  not available. That aspect would be my lone complaint. View is great. The place is so much better than kitchen table - blows us away. You actually get service there, are not waiting for crazy lengths of time.  Would totally recommend going to the Stove.

D3N6RWYqk8jIqV2dWicLgQ.text: This is probably my favorite place for brunch in Las Vegas. Every time that I've gone, the food has been amazing. I absolutely love the short rib empanadas and the birthday cake pancakes. If you go on a Sunday expect to wait at least an hour to be seated. The thing that really makes this my go-to brunch spot is the fact that they offer brunch and bottomless mimosas every day of the week. I don't know of any other places in Vegas that does that. Most places only offer a weekend brunch on Saturday and Sundays. I recommend trying this place out for sure! Just make sure to put your name on the waitlist if you plan on going during the weekend.

Synu0_2_qW2GShu5jXbXSA.text: I really enjoyed this place the eggs Benedict is the best I've ever had. Great atmosphere and hosts

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

uapaCQvAysw1jWDRe6sE1A.text: Amazing breakfast and brunch! Love the unique menu and variety of items. Awesome decor and service. It does get a bit overly packed on weekends for brunch so keep that in mind that you may have a long wait, especially in Sunday's. I'll be back many more times.   Ps.... I wish this place was on Uber eats and offered delivery!

HCjbFaA-kbSnau1gdXMQ_A.text: This place is really good! Had brunch with some friends & everything we ordered was delicious. Loved the avocado toast, crabby patty, & the deviled eggs, also the waitress was super nice & gave us free unicorn pancakes.

_4AB10ZlSZEfLJZjv4TmzA.text: I got the Chicken Fried Foie and it was okay. I was super excited about the "Mac n Cheese" waffle but it tasted like a regular waffle. Very dry. Even asked for syrup but still didn't taste as appetizing. I ordered Mash Potatoes & Gravy on the side which was incredible and made up for the meal. I should have gone with the Banger instead.  Also had a strawberry mimosa which was great. Servers were helpful and friendly however went on a Thursday afternoon and wasn't many people and no wait and still the food took forever to get to us. We were only 2 people. I guess they were behind but it wasn't even full or crowded. It was disappointing watching everyone get their meals before us. The areas for picture taking are cute however not sure i'd come back. Wasn't worth the rave of what i've seen on social media.

v0NGVV8A0JESdb4v2lgF6w.text: Took my daughter to try this place out! This is now my favorite place in Las Vegas!!! This place is awesome !!! It looks like a comfortable bed and breakfast to me! Something you have never seen in Vegas before!! With city views, to a selfie room this spot has it all! Not to mention awesome staff!!!! I had an awesome waitress but it was last week when I went so I can't remember her name!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Hot chocolate!!!!
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana fosters!!! They literally make this in front of your eyes!!!!!

wPXpy3iD81L3y1ImNPPkYg.text: Great view, great staff, great food...and bottomless mimosa ..?!?!  And how can I forget the live music...?!? Vegan/non dairy/gluten free options!

vN3ogeWvBjVky4p8Zvu11g.text: Always a good time!!! Been coming here for a little over a year and have never had a bad experience. The Mexican hot chocolate is so delicious!! Also the monte Christo.... to die for. And you have to do a chambong!!!

awgbyKo86pSZwmv7YKLzRQ.text: What an amazing experience! Has a very typical English feel, and the food was amazing. My boyfriend & I came here one morning early for breakfast.   Knowledgeable and helpful waitstaff. Great view of the city.  I ordered chicken & waffles & Chris ordered chorizo frittata. Both were absolutely incredible. Great spice to the chicken, will be coming back here regularly!   The only negative was that my boyfriend said someone had taken a shit in a urinal in the bathroom. In my experience the women's restroom was very clean. I didn't take stars off for this, just seemed odd.
