882PR49f8YamwPRyEYhSoQ.text: Very trendy and the food is not bad. If you want to wait 45 minutes for your food to come out, this is the place to go. As we waited 45 min after ordering, not once did the Waiter come by to check on us. When the food finally came out. I asked what happened and he proceeded to blame the cooks. He didn't even try to make it right. No apologies, no compensation, nothing. One of the worse services I've experienced. We should have walked out when we had the chance. I will definitely not return to this restaurant.

5jCrFyn7l1YEvVgZtAVYXg.text: Came here for brunch yesterday with my husband and friends and it was great! LOVE the interior and atmosphere of the restaurant, it's super cute! They even have a photo booth room!   Service was fast and friendly! They have a great bottomless mimosa for brunch or I got the cucumber saketina which was a great refreshing drink!   I had the vegan and enchiladas and it was delicious! For brunch they have a smaller menu so I can't wait to go back and try more of their vegan food!   Honestly everything that came out of the window looked amazing!   I would highly recommend trying this spot!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Vegan enchiladas

6j_yTbLxQsSA6uVElv5BUg.text: Did I get the crab benny? Of course I did!  Accommodating a group of 9 isn't easy. We had to wait. This is expected. But here is where service was exceptional. The hostess apologized and got us mimosas and Bloody Marys to keep us comfy and patient. When it ran a little longer to get that table in the back, they didn't rush out those who were eating, they refilled our drinks gratis.   The food is excellent. French toast was on point. The Benedict's we ordered were as good as you could ask for. And the pancakes were stacked high.   Truly an excellent brunch spot for a group.

wLVB42u8KBI2appJpX4Ung.text: Changed my review due to how sick I ended up being. Allergies are a big deal and I won't visit/recommend a place that I ended up sick.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Lunch box brunch
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Brunch menu

U1U_5clb8SHGnynIgYfKIw.text: We cleared our plates!: with an order of a duck grilled cheese and a fried green tomato eggs Benedict. The service was slow despite being one of 3/4 tables. We ordered an adult coffee drink (it had sake) do not order that it curdled and was not good.

CTAjcYg5Rb-tiKe-pj1AZA.text: This cute spot is located in the upstairs portion of the building. Their menu seemed intriguing enough to give it a try and I'm glad we did. The menu is definitely unique - a little too much fruit involved. Almost every dish had a fruit component, not my preference. I would definitely go back and give the rest of the menu a try.

yW4kGqlM_6_9VBbwY0P_JQ.text: THE LOUDEST PLACE I'VE EATEN! I was really hyped to go to this place but the experience as a whole was pretty mediocre. Our server, Dalia, and the arugula salad were the best parts of the experience.  The pastry basket was half very good 1/2 not great. The Madelines, chocolate croissant, and chocolate chip muffin we're all very good. The scone and biscuit were dry and what was called jam was actually a liquid. (See pictures)   This was honestly one of the loudest places I have ever eaten in my entire life and that includes Buffalo Wild Wings. It was so loud that it was uncomfortable. Our waitress did warn us ahead of time that our food would take a considerable length of time to be delivered however we were pleasantly surprised at arrived in only 10 minutes.   The presentation is very impressive and it all looks very upscale and fresh. However because my plate was so artistic the shape of it was not good for eating off of and I had to chase my sauce the entire time because it tried to run off of the lowered parts of my glass plate. (See pictures)   I was not at all impressed with my meal. I ordered the suckling pig eggs Benedict. I have to admit this was something out of my comfort zone so that definitely may be part of my lack of appreciation. (My husband said the hollandaise on mine was delicious) However I would never eat it again. My husband ordered the croque madame.  It was covered in something we could not identify and it was only in after the meal that we were finally able to get an answer that it was a carmelized butter onion cream. He said it was good but again nothing impressive enough to make him return.   The unicorn hot chocolate was very pretty and fun with its mound of glitter sprinkled cotton candy on top. The hot chocolate itself was just average hot chocolate however it was topped with full size marshmallows which was pretty cool. Unfortunately paper straws do get soggy pretty quickly especially in a hot liquid and trying to drink from the cup while surrounded with all of that decorative chocolate and sprinkles is a little difficult.  The place was pretty clean and the decor is very cute. I would definitely give it an a for decor and presentation. Our server, Dalia, was also very friendly and accommodating.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. This was supposed to be jam but as you can see it is a very thin liquid
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Presentation was beautiful but these plates are not very functional
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. The famous unicorn hot chocolate with glitter sprinkles

YOJWaCbS2ZiQOk23oQdo-Q.text: Don't listen to any of the one stars, seriously food takes long because they take there time to make it delicious! So yes good time is long but it's worth the wait. Bottomless mimosas for 19 bucks with fresh juices(watermelon is the best) just drink while you wait for your food! It's great to talk and have brunch with all your friends!

t0bMwWdpdOqVFDy4xT7QXg.text: Came here for Brunch on a Saturday.  Waited 45 mins for table, then sat 45 mins for food to arrive. Should've walked out. The food was terrible. Butternut squash soup was inedible almost gelatinous. So odd.  The savory french toast was a mushy mess. The chicken waffles was so small, our guest left hungry.  On top of this our waitress was subtlety patronizing.  I know how it feels when someone is disdainful. We never complained about our food nor did she ask or wonder why food was left uneaten. No coffee refills offered either.  AND , we asked for hot sauce and waitress gives an empty bottle of hot sauce.  See photo.   If this place is giving us a hint that we were not welcomed, then we got the message. Never to return or recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Inedible butternut squash soup
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Asked for hot sauce and waitress gave us empty bottle?!?!?!  Wth??!

IRFOYzO0UXCkrGUbXtqYuQ.text: The Good: The food was excellent, service was friendly and attentive, great menu variety and I appreciate the vegan options.   The Not So Good: The noise level is very, very high. You can barely hear the person next to you at the table so beware if you would like to be able to have a conversation.

m7RmogBzd-h7TAroZePFxw.text: Stove is the new go to breakfast spot in Henderson for me. I haven't seen this much business in here since the days of Firefly. I fully expect them to open up for dinner once they've established their core customers.   I'll admit, they messed up my order, but the quality of food, customer service, decor, and the fact that the owner is busting his ass on the floor with his staff makes this place worth 5 stars.   I ordered the traditional farmhouse breakfast, sunny side up eggs, jalapeno bacon, sourdough toast, and of course bottomless mimosas. In my honest opinion I would've liked to have seen the breakfast potato's more well done.   Best feature of Stove is the rotating scent of their bathrooms. You're probably wondering at this point what I mean, huh?  When I used the restroom I smelled bacon. When my friend used the restroom he smelled pancake batter. That's awesome!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Farmhouse

5ezRlBkewIMRA8oemvjmqw.text: Our original plan was come here for a girls high tea birthday celebration but called about a week prior to find out they no longer offer high tea due to low demand .  We figured that's ok let's do brunch and wear our little hats anyway!  Our group of 5 came in and was seated in the back room along the window.  This restaurant was hard for me to find as it's located on the 2nd floor but it does have some nice views.  I tried to order a coffee with Baileys but was told they don't serve anything over a certain ABV content.  I decided to go with the suggested blackberry mimosa and for my entree I went for the empanada and matcha French toast.  The blackberry mimosa was crisp and light, but I really wished they had a coffee drink with some "oomph" in it (unless I missed this on the menu)  Our table shared the deviled eggs which were really good and I don't usually care for deviled eggs.  The matcha French toast was very light and it too sweet and the empanada was pretty good also, i needed something savory to go with the French toast.    We had a great time, food was good but not being a big breakfast person maybe I'll come back for lunch Instead if I'm in the area.    Don't miss the photo booth room on the way out...soo fun!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Empanadas

whrjGd2dItYxVx9lqLjanQ.text: Cute and quaint. Went for a special breakfast to celebrate an anniversary. My man got the eggs Benedict and enjoyed it. I got a fried green tomato Benedict. The hollandaise was interesting and a little spicy, very nice. The green tomatoes were sweet, which I am not used to. I usually have them more tangy. Still good. The vanilla latte was also very good. Only complaint was that service was super duper slow. If you want something under 30 minutes, you might not want to come here. We were here close to 1.5 hours.

6DvdmLFGEO12yPUj2BKFdQ.text: The food was great but the service was poor. This was my third time going and each time I hope management has coached the front end staff. It really feels like amateur hour. Too many things to list that I found extremely frustrating. It just reminds me of a very talented chef starting a restaurant with no clue how to manage staff.   I will say that the food was excellent which is why I gave an extra star. The staff is all friendly and smile but they have no idea how to be professional staff in a restaurant. I blame the front end manager (if there is any). Nobody has been trained. Again amateur hour. If you want to put up with that the food is excellent.

uIkDWnyGMCJW7QO6m07frQ.text: It's a little of a wait so I suggest putting your name on the waitlist through their website before you go. Everytime I come here they are busy but it's worth the wait. Food is great and the service that is provided is attentive and quick once you get a table. Chicken fried steak was a great choice pick from our server.

cSCXNu2JA4J_s6QUhNZHGw.text: The food was amazing.  I had the Crab Patty breakfast- crab Benedict style on gluten free bread.   Our waiter, Alec,was friendly, very attentive and helpful.  The atmosphere is airy, cute decor and had a nice view the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

wFBfEI8boe7U6Oaju1bkrw.text: So I have been hearing some good things about this place! We decided to try it out on a Monday thinking it would not be too busy. Well, we were wrong! We ended up having to wait about 30 minutes for a table at lunch but it was worth it. I was unaware that you could call in to be placed on the waitlist ahead of time but now I know for the future.  This is not a large place but more intimate and cozy. From some angles, the restaurant offers a great view of the valley and mountains. In addition they feature a High Tea as well which I need to check out!  We were seated at the next available table and then our server came over and introduced herself. She also let us know that she was in training. You sure could not tell as she was fantastic and stayed on top of our service the whole time. Sorry i cannot remember her name!   I had been craving a grilled cheese and tomato soup lunch for weeks. I was so happy to see this was a listed entree. Two of us enjoyed the Roasted Tomato soup and Grilled Cheese sandwich while my other friend opted for the Avocado Toast. For starters, we loved the Short Rib Empanada which was recommended by our server as a hit! It was definitely melt in your mouth goodness and the poblano chilies provided just the right amount of heat. Then our entrees arrived. This grilled cheese was no ordinary grilled cheese. The added shimji and trumpet mushrooms took this sandwich to the next level in terms of taste. On top of the sandwich was a little arugula with a little vinaigrette which just made this meal a five star experience for me.   After lunch, we just had to have some fun in the photo booth too!  All of us were extremely pleased with our meals and the service. In addition, we enjoyed some fabulous live music from Mike on guitar. I asked him how we got so lucky to hear him. He explained that Mondays are called Industry Mondays for those that work in hospitality. Just another star for this place in my book as I am always a fan of live music on any day at any hour.  Although this establishment is no where near where I live, I will still make the drive again to enjoy more their yummy dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Short Rib Empanada
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Avocado Toast
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Roasted Tomato Soup and grilled cheese with shimji mushrooms, trumpet mushrooms on house bread

aAPlwmOfENSvDt3w-jRrrg.text: Finally made it here and glad I did!  Atmosphere, service and food were amazing! I met a bunch of girlfriends in the morning for breakfast. We ordered the bottomless mimosas. Great fruit puree to add to your champagne. I had the mango, my other friends had the raspberry and peach.. All good! I ordered the eggs benedict, probably the best looking EB I've ever had, and the taste, matched the presentation. Fluffy poached eggs on top of shaved ham and a thick English muffin topped with real hollandaise sauce. Definitely homemade sauce, not from a starter or a can.  Next time someone suggests breakfast, I'm suggesting The Stove. Looking forward to coming back real soon!

E1QkPSe_cY6yzcc8UH8UJw.text: I came all the way from Centennial to brunch here because my friends absolutely raved about it. We agreed to meet at 11 am so I put our names in online at 10:30. Upon arriving at 11 I was told there would be at least another 30 minute wait. We decided to sit for awhile and when we saw a few spots open up at the bar and we proceeded to go ahead and sit there and order our unlimited mimosas prior to getting our seats. There were 4 of us and I paid for all 4 which came to just under $100.00 after tip. As we started talking, a young bartender with red hair and a man bun told us that the bar seating was for patrons who were dining only. There were no signs and the hostesses suggested twice that we could go to the bar. I asked the bartender that even though I just dropped $100 that I was being asked to vacate my seat. He quite obnoxiously said yes. Had he been slightly more apologetic, it would have been easier to take but he was extremely rude. We ended up wandering around with our glasses as well as the glasses that contained the puree for the mimosas AS well as a large container that held more champagne.  Are you kidding me?? We finally got a seat approximately an hour after arriving. The food was exquisite.  I ordered the Banger and it was absolutely tasty and amazing. Truly the best I've had. My order actually came out much later than my friend's orders and they took it off the bill without asking. So a small cuddos to them for that. My friends ordered the short rib omelet,  the egg white frittata and crab omelet. Everyone was greatly satisfied with their order. Oh wait, the one item that my cousin ordered was deviled eggs as an appetizer. This particular dish came with four egg halves with different toppings. One was traditional and I ate that. It was way over salted. One came with caviar on top, which I am attributing to the $15 price tag. My cousin kept gagging after he put it in his mouth. Would definitely not recommend that particular appetizer. The mimosas were excellent with various flavors. Our waiter did his best but was definitely burdened with a ton of tables. Overall the experience was pleasant because of the company and excellent food, however the obnoxious bartender really made the start incredibly awkward and frustrating. I'm not quite sure I'd make the trip again with so many other brunch options in Vegas with better tempered staff.

pGc8YdknRqi3SaAsa_NKZA.text: So, made it here for the second time.  Busy place, great service.  Got the chicken fried steak and let me tell you all.  It was a shoe leather tough piece of meat.  Didn't come close to finishing it.  Couldn't. Lol.   Asked for Tabasco and the bottle looked horrendous.  Top needed to be cleaned or wiped at some point to even consider bringing it out to a table (restaurant or anywhere)!   Not too impressed. To say the least.    Anyways. All good.  Just not coming back.  Thanks Stove.

zhRluHVH9-O1kQ07yumEEA.text: Really cute place.  Hard to find.  ONLY open for breakfast and lunch which is crazy because they have a great view of the city at night.  Anyways... we did the Kale salad which was amazing after a small glitch with the Monte Cristo..which looked amazing but was put into the deep fryer and little early so it wasn't as tasty as it should be.  However......their french fries are amazing.  Highly recommend the salad.....very cool menu with items you cannot get anywhere else...They have a tea room but we did not get it explained to us.....maybe next time in there...but really if you like good food that has some real love and attention to put in it.. This is the place.

gLguTAWBqI-4UKM-Un60RQ.text: Hubby & I wanted to try this place last Saturday but it was a 50 minute wait, so we went elsewhere. Tried this place today for a late lunch instead and there was no wait. I had the savory French toast which was delicious! My Mom's chorizo frittata was really good & not at all oily like some chorizo things often are - it was perfect & flavorful but not spicy. My dad had pancakes which were also really good with a hint of some other flavor I couldn't quite identify but liked very much as well as the texture. Yum! It's a beautiful restaurant with great decor and a stunning view. It's really too bad they are only open for breakfast and lunch, because I imagine the view at night must be incredible! They do a "proper tea" here too, and my mom & I are looking forward to coming back to try that soon. The only drawback here is that it is VERY noisy inside.

Uw5BgNfbPV5EC1IHd3mebw.text: soooo amazing!!! favorite brunch place ever! our servers are always great & food always comes out looking so good but tastes even better!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

lgVS5xdnKe3mABqAGxvDyA.text: The food is amazing and the wait  staff is friendly and completely on point. The decor so so cute, fresh and hip! Even my kids agree that we need to come back and try everything on the menu!

fSk-zyE0_o7lkXQ_JdtsOA.text: Only go in if you have about 3 hours to spare for brunch. We had a 1:30 reservation and got sat a little after 2pm. After we we sat we were informed by the sever that food is cooked to order so all orders take about 30 mins and they're perfectionist so they wouldn't send out food that wasn't perfect, (which we appreciate him letting us know in advance.) He took our drink orders which came out 30 mins later, which seemed to be a little long for bottomless mimosas which are served in a large craft with sides of juice. Then food slowly trickled out.... with missing parts. 3 BLTS were ordered with 2/3 missing the tomato of the BLT and A poached egg on an eggs Benedict cooked like a hard boiled egg and a corn beef that was drier than beef jerky (weird when they said they don't send food out "perfect") But my chiliquilies was good! lol basically go super early and have plentyyyyy of time to spare for the incredibly slow service!

aeLLg9dtdQKwmbu-xaxsHA.text: The 4 stars is because I had a dirty coffee mug when I sat down. There was still lipstick on it, which I know can happen but the person who set the table should have seen it. It was PURPLE on a white mug! I specifically picked Thursday around 10:30 because I had heard how busy it got there. My friend and I had a hard time finding it because we didn't notice the sign at first and didn't know it was on the second floor. Anyway, it's a great space. The staff is kind and courteous and willing to answer any question you might have about the menu. The food is great. Just in case you want you food smoked, they can do that, I didn't get it but the table next to me did and it was cool to see and smelt even better! I do plan to go back.

eu6JsU9jDuLp5hKXfQUilA.text: Exceptional!  From the moment you walk in the door you are made to feel welcome and "at home".  The menu practically sings to you with the range of choices, some typically found for brunch and others which approach inventive deliciousness at brunch!  We were there at open and it is recommend to get their early as it is quite busy with live music from 10am on.  A must try for locals and travelers!  Thanks to Scott Commings (Hell's Kitchen 2014 winner!) and crew for opening this gem of a restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

BLItsmQpYD6Qj-eCdMdk_A.text: So I went with my friends for a Sunday brunch. The two hostesses kept giving us different wait times. The food on the other hand was great!! We had the deviled eggs and empanadas to start. We also had the duck monte Cristo which was the best, the chilaquiles, crab Benedict, and country Benedict. The service was terrible and that is why I'm giving it a 4 star. Marco was not personable and seemed impatient. But , it was a very fun atmosphere.

ea6FDiJRZ-PwBcbISVUgNA.text: I am beyond ecstatic chef Antonio had opened up a new place! The menu, the decor, the people are all just what I had hoped for! Nothing was held back to make this place look fantastic and so inviting. The decor and modern design is pleasing to the eye while the food is pleasing to my belly! They have a cute little photo booth which is absolutely brilliant for social media and free advertising! The baked goods are incredible and I'm a pure carbaholic so i was in heaven! To make everything even more wonderful is their vegan menu! Being able to get vegan eggs and cheese is a complete score! Scott and Antonio have gone all out to have a beautiful and tasty restaurant. Very well done gentleman! We will definitely be frequent guests! A social eatery at its finest!

9J1xDUbImBkbWDA7bv0j7w.text: Great food...the service was a little shaky but never anything to ding the restaurant for. My girlfriend had come every week since it's been open .

H8Ijfr3ZKBN3O5h-Py0dcg.text: Local owner sourcing all products locally with unique menu selections! A must try! Breakfast or lunch, check the wonderful city views!

OnVcFvPzDxqeqaDSa-vevQ.text: I liked the atmosphere and they had a friendly staff. Prices were higher than I expected.

9xepoLS_Tm0DegvwxmPxSA.text: I was visiting a friend in Henderson and we choose to visit The Stove for brunch and I am so glad we did.  The french toast is AMAZING!

elAYGj14ULbNLIazXSW71Q.text: Amazing place. The food was great. The suckling pig Benedict and the chorizo frittata were really good. The iced coffee was ok.

eaLxkShfnGMrn7ztwF1qKA.text: The Stove is a great dining experience! The crabby patty Benedict is a must try. The bottomless mimosas are a great deal.  There was a 40 minute wait and it was so worth it. The hostess, Ivette, came over several times to check on us. She got us seated sooner and was very accommodating.

oBmD3UjlK3a4s5XCQOsbyQ.text: Amazing food, amazing concept, such a great experience  one of the best breakfast and brunch spots in town

I7qBgI1QLNzgLD1zKCNzUA.text: We love this place. Great food. Great service. Menu items are so creative and delicious!

HZ19Di2YLyzCsgAnQHzgHg.text: Great food and staff. It's a little bit loud inside but to be expected because of the quality.

9jrDmsW61_600a2MY1N2LQ.text: Charming ambience and some of the best breakfast in town! The staff was very attending even though it was busy and made wonderful recommendation...so I Noshed on the crab Benedict and I can genuinely say it was amazing! Fluffy house made English muffin, fresh Alaskan king crab, artichoke (for a welcome surprise!), perfectly poached eggs, and a light and airy dill hollandaise with a few stragetically placed crunchy salt flakes woke my palate. The bakery items are insane too... Looking forward to going back and trying some more delights!

1KPDTxw_9zuBbNpo2iOAYQ.text: Great food and cute atmosphere. You get what you pay for in quality products. We would definitely come back again to try other menu items.

PKtr7ZsYui0jDacuwy0Nag.text: A little hard to find, but I gotta say I love this place inside and out.  A second story breakfast spot in a busy, tiny, strangely laid out shopping center had put me off from coming here for awhile, but after a few persistent suggestions from friends, I knew it was a must try. My only hope that it would live up to the hype and be worth the nightmare parking.  I certainly believe it did. While the restaurant looks small from the outside, the inside is well lit and set up in a way that makes it easy to move around. The decor is super cute, and they've even got their own miniature wall garden set up in the corner.  The menu is pretty short compared to most breakfast spots, but are very unique. They offer dishes that are uncommon here in the US, but popular in other countries. while they have your typical flapjacks and bacon, they also offer chiquilies, shashuka, "bangers" and eggs, etc.  I ordered the the Monte Cristo sandwich to try something new, it was pretty much a ham and swiss sandwich deep-fried in pancake batter. Weird combo. Totally kickass.   So whether you just want a simple breakfast spot or want to be adventurous and try some new food, definitely a great breakfast spot.

4FEqNJKL5rksdFYlYh69TQ.text: Awesome brunch, food is always amazing here. The pickled jalapenos are a must on everything. Compliments to Chef Antonio for ensuring our food was perfect before it was left at our table. Can't wait to go back! Eggs benny & Avocado toast in the photo- BOMB.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

Q9EYFRRuF-qJXwfBm-DGDg.text: This place is delicious, good price, and awesome atmosphere. Its I must try if you haven't. I definitely will be back again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Unicorn Hot Chocolate
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Photo booth
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Photo booth

szEjGPJvLKcF035nVEadVw.text: This place is good but... I've been here twice and both times the staff was friendly and the food was good. That's it tho, just good; not great, not the best. I'd be fine with that if it was any other place but for the wait time to get the food even when it's not busy it doesn't do it for me. I'm only giving it 3 stars because the food presentation is beautiful, the ambiance is nice and you can see the chef plating which is cool.

nhtS7C7IBG60x_N7ok4t2g.text: 3 stars because the place is super cute.  The owner is usually there and seems very nice.   Gave this place a few chances, went there 3 times and tried different things and the food is not good. Don't feel like further explaining why its not good because id rather not be rude.

DFpelpYZNXNh2krjidTaIQ.text: The cutest place to enjoy an amazing brunch! The service was amazing! Our waitress Krystal was so sweet and so helpful when we just couldn't decide between all of the delicious options. We enjoyed a variety of dishes and everything was sooooo delicious and fresh. When they say farm to table they don't play around, so many beautiful fresh ingredients and the taste was like going to a five star high end restaurant on the strip. We were celebrating a birthday and they just made it so special and fun with a chambong!  It was perfect and we will be coming back again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Duck hash
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Bottomless mimosas
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Deviled eggs

tqVb0xU3_gF41GWVdgiAaA.text: Cute atmosphere and there are some good things on the menu The Mac and cheese chicken and waffle tho wasn't the best.  But my friends chilaqulies was amazing. Took me back to Mexico with every bite

72Fle27dQ5U1BrF0HkNliA.text: I have visited The Stove on multiple occasions and have to say I have loved it every time. Food and atmosphere is really pleasant.

35t83U6SRrfdYvYGmn8srA.text: Great place for brunch.  The menu is unique and everything we have eaten there has been great.  Highlights including the eggs benedict and the corned beef hash and of course the bottomless mimosas.  The portions are great and everything tastes really fresh and not greasy like some breakfast places.  This place is popular so expect a wait - they don't take reservations but if you visit their website you can put your name on the waitlist.

CbTSXhjYgvCwyoVFGfCG0w.text: Amazing food and the service was great! We will definitely be back again.  Owner is Chef. Great menu.

Zk5sdLSWUkoBJKNcQw2jiA.text: Ups: The interior is so cute and looks like a large stylish dining room. Our waiter was super cool and joked around with us a bunch. I stick to a gluten-free lifestyle, and The Stove's menu made is pretty easy to stick to.   Downs: From the time we sat down to the time we actually got our breakfast was about 45 minutes to an hour. So many tables were empty, so I'm not sure why the wait time was so extreme. My Crabby Patty Benedict was cold and the hollandaise sauce was piled on top even though I asked for it to be on the side.  There was a weird smell every time a server opened the kitchen door to go to the back. Due to the slow service, our server comped my friend's mimosa but didn't offer to comp anything for me. Not cool.   All in all, this place is cute if you want a leisurely brunch with friends. IMO it's a bit hyped up, so I'm not sure when I'll be back.

VrwopfaIR1uDfDe6_gmFAQ.text: Food is Amazing. Go early and prepare to wait. My only real issue is the ac situation. It is pretty hot and stuffy. This has been an issue since way back when it was Firefly. If they could fix that, I would give it 5 stars.

LFqapEWEW_jkyMgJDuYoxw.text: There are copious amounts of brunch places in the valley these days. This place is by far one of the best I have tried as of late. From the ambiance being welcoming, to the warm welcome from the staff, to the open concept kitchen, the overall feel is laid back and homey.   I started with the Lavender iced coffee, a bit strong on the floral notes, but otherwise quite good. My boyfriend and I shared the pastry plate, and for the price it was fantastic. My boyfriend got the waffle poutine and he said it was like he had in Canada, eh. I had the Chilaquiles, robust flavors that all just melted in your mouth. The portions were not dainty either, kudos to the chefs for not succumbing to the "tiny portion" brunch mentality. We will definitely be back to try more of their awesome looking menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Lavender Iced Coffee
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Chilaquiles
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Pastry Plate

ERBzizNUJEMDglBIzhhB0g.text: I was really excited about trying this place. We drive thirty minutes to come just for the Stove. Our wait wasn't awful. I expected about thirty minutes. The problem I had was our poor waiter had a table top of ten and then our table of six. The table of ten had been there a while but their party trickled in until they were all there. Unfortunately, this meant they were ready to order right as we were seated. It took about 15 minutes to get a regular cup of coffee which I never got a refill on. As far as the decor, I love it. Great view also! I really liked how the food prep would perfect every plate up front on a gorgeous table. The menu was crazy cool. This is why I follow them in Instagram. So many cool flavor combinations. I love the concept of the hangover corn dog but it wasn't as flavorful as I was hoping. The mini salad on the plate was amazing though! The chicken and waffles plate was good. I really enjoyed the presentation and the spicy maple syrup. The waffles left me a bit disappointed. I was really expecting mac-&-cheesy waffles. I saw a noodle in a few parts but it really had no cheese flavor at all. I really love the menu option to get 1 specialty pancake for $5. I got the pecan pie pancake. I was happy it wasn't overly sweet. I would say the crabby patty was probably the most impressive item ordered. The poached egg was cooked to perfection. The crab was fresh and delicious. It was a very rich breakfast meal but wonderfully paired with all of its flavors. All in all I do hope to go back and try the avocado toast, one of the many tea lattes, the bananas foster tableside pancakes, and the monte cristo.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Hangover corndog
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

bdZE4U6CM3t8aSZvJuABhQ.text: What can I say?  We've found our new go-to brunch spot!  Our server, Marco, was polite, knowledgeable and quick.  The hostess, chef, and who I assumed was either the manager or owner came by our table and asked how everything was and even spent a little time getting to know us, welcomed us to the neighborhood and explained how some of the dishes were prepared.  The food was spectacular.  Excellent blend of sweet and savory, perfect portions and very tasty.  Excellent presentation as well.  The atmosphere is great, clean and open.  The menu is on the slightly upscale, or adult side, but there are kid friendly options as well.  In every aspect, a terrific experience!

pnkDmdaGMKubK22Oxtc5zA.text: Ate their yesterday for brunch and "bottomless" mimosas (2-hour limit, which might sound strict but honestly, you totally get your money's worth for $19). I ordered the chicken and waffles with spicy maple syrup, and it was probably the best I've ever had. The spice level on the syrup was just perfect for me, and I'm a bit of a wimp. The service was fantastic! Our server had a warm but unintrusive personality and she was spot on with her menu recommendations-- the empanadas made this anti-black-bean eater a convert.   My one tiny suggestion is that the table needed placemats, because the plates tended to slip when I was cutting my food and I very nearly spilled a drink because of it. Once I put a napkin under the plate it was great.   Can't wait for the mimosa garden to open.

qDLs6Rops2SkoRclQCgHWg.text: The Stove is such a great brunch spot in Henderson with a clear view of the Las Vegas strip. The restaurant is all upstairs and they do have an elevator as well. With a massive menu, you won't see the typical diner options such as bacon & eggs or an omelette. What you will find are creatively crafted dishes tailored for breakfast or lunch meals. They also offer alcohol for a boozy brunch and their coffee mugs are huge. Free refills for drip coffee. What I was most interested in was their vegan menu, although small compared to the rest of the menu, it has great offerings. My favorite was the vegan benedict. Complete with a tofu scramble and dripping with vegan butter, it was a delicious high fat meal. Many of their items come with "greens" which is a small salad. The waiter listed some ingredients in it since we loved it so much and he did name honey. If you avoid honey I would ask for clarification on the salad that comes with the vegan dishes. Other items that are delicious are the vegan skillet and the vegan chicken burrito. The chicken was so realistic that I asked what brand they use. Beyond meat comes through with the delicious chicken for this meal. The manager said they will be making their own vegan meats in the future, which is awesome.

bhZofAkYXdD4S-sNT015oQ.text: I would give less of a review if i could. We put in a reservation for 5 ppl at 9am. Waitlist said 1hr 15m. We arrived, waited for another 15 min, which is fine. Hostess came to collect us for our table, the 5 of us, and walked us to a 4 top table. We expressed we were 5 ppl, she replied "you arrived With 4 and a child so we adjusted your reso to 4, it's going to be more of a wait for 5". I expressed we made a reso for 5, we didn't adjust it to 4. She walked away leaving us at the table set for 4. We expressed we can just pull up a chair. She said we can't but we can pull up a high chair for the child. Confused, we waited at the table. She proceeded to get another group of 3 and seat them at the table we were standing.   We stood in the middle of the Resturant for another 15 min or so with zero communication as to what our seating arrangement would be. We are now 1.5hrs in on the waitlist and 30 min waiting in room. We finally flagged down the same hostess and she again expressed since we changed our reso from 5 to 4 and back to 5 they moved us back down the list and it would be a wait.  We expressed WE did NOT adjust our party size they did. At this point we decided to leave. On the way out the other hostess expressed that "we are busy, sorry for the wait".   Side notes    -there were 4 tables open in the main dining room and an entire room open with 7+ tables open on the other side of the Photobooth.  -we were a party that included a 2yr old as well as a 8mo pregnant woman.   They let us conjugate in the middle of their Resturant for 30 min as they sat ppl around us due to them changing our reso.   Will never be back. Place is fake busy. They create the wait to create s buzz.    Fail.

YojwEMTi5i2jVM0S1lHxYQ.text: They changed the whole menu to the boring breakfast spot. I was very disappointed. The duck wasn't tasty.

61rnZOac57tKnvyr7hwNOQ.text: We wanted to try some place we hadn't been before for breakfast. The Stove was excellent. Quaint atmosphere, delicious breakfast, vegan options and very fresh home town sourced food. I will definitely come back!

G0eOGd3qUaLLLQXmGbJqyQ.text: My friend and I went to the stove for breakfast this morning and we were so happy! The space is super cute, there is a view of the strip, and it's just super airy and comfortable. The food menu was the perfect size and I ended up choosing the burger. It tasted absolutely delicious!   We did have a little mishap during our breakfast, but our server, the manager, and the owner all came out to make sure everything was okay AND to make up for everything, they took care of our meal and offered us to come back and dine for free. They really went above and beyond to correct the issue and I couldn't have been more pleased with how all of the employees + management handled it all. I will be back a ton in the future, I'm sure, and I'll be sure to recommend The Stove as one of my new favorite breakfast places!

c8xHPDMaOWT4Ywc2yRgTeA.text: Wow! My new favorite spot! Had brunch here today... the restaurant is beautiful! The attention to detail is perfect.   We starting digging into the food as soon as it arrived- I didn't even get any pics! I had the BLT which was an odd choice for me but I devoured it immediately- it was soo good!! My husband had the BGR which he said was the best burger he ever had. My gf had the crab Benedict "Crabby Patty" and the English muffin was so delicious. We also had the short rib empanadas as an app, and a couple others at our table had huevos rancheros. We shared a bananas foster for dessert which is made tableside!  There is an adorable patio with a great view and some fun games. They grow their own micro greens inside under LED lights. They have a cute little photo booth and just so many little nooks and  crannies with gorgeous flowers, or art or what looks like flea mart finds.   Only bummer is we were given a high chair but our table was Super high so no way my daughter could have sat in it because the tabletop was about 18inches higher than the chair so she sat on our laps (no biggie). Also were never given a kids menu and I see now that the kids meals are served in cute little old school lunch boxes - which I would have wanted to see!   Overall beyond amazing and so happy when we find pretty new places with amazing food. Such a gem!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Cute little patio
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Bananas foster

h9GGhi3rSNUDKSBjpHc1Tg.text: I am not going to give this place a poor review based on fact this is not my type of environment.  The food is really not my style and the atmosphere was not my typical crowd.  However......  We did have a reservation that was made approximately a week in advance.  I arrived first with my kids and wife.  The waiting area is very small and my family takes up almost the entire waiting area.  As some people came and went we had to shuffle around for them to get out of the door.  My mother and sister arrived next and this added to the congestion near the door area.  My two aunts arrived and then my brother and sisters-in-law, approximately 20 minutes past our reservation time.  After waiting another 15 minutes we were finally seated.  After being seated our drink orders were taken, again not my type of place I'm not a mimosa or champagne drinker or really any breakfast alcoholic beverage drinker.  Anyways waters came out for us, with the few in my groups other drinks.  The cups for water are smaller in size, and almost ever drink I took I finished my cup.    I ordered the Huevos Rancheros.  My wife got the Farmhouse, and my kids split a Birthday Pancake order.    Mine was served on little corn tortillas, the food was pretty good only thing I did not care for was the caramelized red onions.    My wife's Farmhouse, looked smaller than I thought it was going to be. She didn't like the biscuit that came with it, and the only jam was strawberry.    My kids had the best experience they thought the sprinkles and colors in the pancakes was awesome!  I will say this place is kid friendly and it's so loud in there my kids noise is drowned out and not a disturbance.  My kids were also able to get plastic cups to avoid breaking the glass ones everyone else got.  Funny thing is I think their cups were bigger than ours.    Waiter we had was professional and courteous.  He busted his butt and did a great job keeping water coming into my tiny cup!  My main downside was that from the time we ordered until the time everyone had their food was 1 hour and 10 minutes.  I understand we not the only people in the restaurant and we are a larger group, but an hour and 10 min, that's a long time to wait for food when you sat in the waiting room for an extended time too.  Now another thing I thought was a cool touch and brings the rating up in my book is bringing out a little dish with a few muffins and cookies on it.  There was a blueberry muffin, chocolate chip muffin, and a chocolate chip cookie.  All three were cut in half and placed in middle of the tables.    I honestly probably will not return just due to the fact that it's not really my style of place, not that I hated it, but that I'm just not into that environment.  Over food was good, service was good, waiting always sucks but it was overall positive experience chilling with my out of state family.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Huevos Rancheros. Looking fancy.

938v0Bn1Wvu6SPoLpzAkhQ.text: Big thanks to The Stove for letting me and some of my girls gather here for brunch as we sipped on our (endless) mimosas and yummy food! Walking into this place for a first time almost makes you forget you're in Vegas. It's really a hidden gem off the strip  and not over crowded by all the tourists coming in and out of town. We got seated right away, with a table that had a beautiful view of the strip. This place is located on the second floor of the building... the view is totally worth it.   What brought us in was the endless mimosas...on a Friday. Yep you heard it! Not many brunch places offer endless mimosas during the week so we were super excited to eat here on our day off. Their juices for the mimosas were mango, peach, strawberry, hibiscus and blackberry. Mango & peach were my favorite, along with the hibiscus.  I've always been a sucker for breakfast food, no matter what time of the day it is. Their menu is very modern & hipster, the usual breakfast fix-ins with a twist. I ordered the king crab Benedict... drool. They were not shy with the king crab!! The crab was buttery and served on top an English muffin and potatoes. And of course topped with homemade hollandaise sauce :)   Our server was very attentive and was always refilling our waters and pitcher of champagne! Definitely will be back to try something different on the menu.

nSiIaLD811P9pIHHfAdBvQ.text: Went here on a Sunday and the place was super busy, I guess you can sign up on the wait list before you arrive . The menu looked amazing , so many  choices and variety of combinations ,I could not decide. I tried the avocado toast and my friend ordered the foigre  waffle. It took about 35 min to get out food but it was very tasty and I really enjoyed all the flavors of the avocado toast . The place is a hip breakfast spot like you would see at the strip , unique menus . I'll definitely be back to try other stuff on the menu because it all looked so good .    Cons : the shopping center it's in does not have enough parking to support the customers.  You will wait a while on a Sunday to get your food .

MRBIU-TRkwnoXYPwwwmp4w.text: I was able to try this place yesterday for lunch. 1st of all, I loved the decor. Reminded a little of being in someone's home. 2nd, the views of the strip & the mountains were amazing! Its on the 2nd floor of the building so it offers a great view of Las Vegas. The food was delicious & unique. I had egg tacos that were so good & I loved the plating! Our service was great too. I think we had Krystal & she was excellent. I'm excited to go back & have mimosas one of these weekends!

nuV13RRlyfxGbfmfow29Ug.text: My auntie took me and my family to this place for brunch! From the decoration to the menu, this place is all around unique and fun.  As you walk in you see a cute porch where you can request to eat with guests, kind of like a private section. And then inside everything is just so eye catching. They have a fun photo booth, with cute tea party hats. And a bar with an open pastry area.  The server was really nice, I could tell she was busy since she was the only server on the floor. But she did a good job giving all her tables the attention they needed.  She notified us that appetizers and pastries will come out quickly but entrees will take about 20 minutes since everything is made to order.  For the appetizer we ordered deviled eggs and empanadas. Sorry don't know the names but the empanadas were delicious!! Such a unique taste within their recipes.   For my entree I ordered the chicken and waffles and my boyfriend ordered the duck macaroni and another duck dish with an over easy egg(duck Benedict?)  My daughter got a side pancake and sausages.  My chicken and waffles was delicious as well! The waffle had some kind of cheese in the inside that didn't take away from the sweetness that it should have. And the chicken was cooked perfectly to pair along with my waffles. The taste again was so unique. Not like any regular chicken and waffles.  I got to taste a bite of the duck macaroni and that was so delicious as well. My daughters side pancake was huge.. I wasn't expecting that.  And as I looked around, if she were to order a kids meal it would've been served in a cute tin lunch box.  Overall a great experience for lunch. Very unique. I definitely recommend and I would come back.

COkNUkkhKAFXyD-pcc0lZw.text: Though dining in the southeast remains somewhat dull after dark there is no question that the area's Brunch scene is booming, Water Street's Hardway 8 recently joining the likes of CRAFTkitchen while Truffles N Bacon Cafe now shares a complex with The Coffee Class, but since July of 2018 the area's most creative morning plates have consistently come from The Stove at 11261 South Eastern Avenue.  A product of Established Culinary Management, or in other words the brainchild of Chefs Antonio Nunez and Scott Commings, it is on the second floor of a building with Las Vegas Boulevard views that guests will find Breakfast as well as Brunch daily, recently-promoted GM Summer Gates leading a youthful staff that offers an ideal blend of friendliness and professionalism.  Well appointed and still full of whimsy, though gimmicks such as a selfie-booth and "Twisted" Tea Room were smartly abandoned in favor of a focus on seasonality and customer service, guests will find comfort regardless of which room they are seated, while a recently updated menu features several new dishes alongside best-sellers ranging from simple Bacon and Eggs to Foie Gras atop Waffles.  Opting for a booth on the left-side looking in, at most times quieter than the primary dining room and even more so at 1:15pm, it was as a party of four that Breakfast began with Coffee, Cocktails and Pastries, the latter offered on a three-tier tower and highlighted by soft-centered Chocolate Chip Cookies plus fluffy Muffins given a touch of color amidst plenty of Blueberries and Butter.  Visiting the Restaurant for the first time with neither Scott nor Antonio present, a honey-soaked Salad of Peaches enjoyable despite sorely lacking for Nuts or Cheese compared to what @thestovelv shared on Social Media, it was on request that Empanadas were delivered in follow-up, the Short Rib expectedly tender and standing up nicely to two types of Chiles inside golden Pastry.  Henceforth focused on new items, though passing on Pecan Pie Pancakes is admittedly ill-advised, it was with serviceware re-set that grilled Bread Pudding arrived quickly, its intense sweetness likely to be polarizing amidst complex textures while an all new Sandwich from the "Lunch" section tantalizes taste buds thanks to Confit Duck Meat paired with Gruyere, Onions and housemade Orange Marmalade.  Globally influenced from Croque Madame to Vegan Tacos, a roadtrip south yielding Fried Green Tomatoes made into a Benedict with Eggs and Avocado, it is tapping Americanized Chinese that a King Crab Omelet reminisces of Crab Rangoon thanks to herbaceous Cream Cheese while included house Potatoes set a high standard by seemingly being fried, smashed, seasoned and fried again.  Finishing up savory, a plate of Huevos Rancheros from the acting Chef de Cuisine impressing with its slow-burn and cream-less Avocado "Crema," fans of Steak & Eggs should not pass on The Stove's cooked-to-order version brightened by house Chimichurri and usually served with Tortillas that were apparently forgotten on this particular afternoon.  FOUR AND A HALF STARS:  Recently celebrating one year since opening, the new menu from Chefs Commings and Nunez continues to push the envelope in terms of creativity thanks to some innovative dishes while still executing basics like Breakfast Potatoes and poached Eggs with finesse.  Not a flawless visit, though flavors and Ingredients are still exemplary, owners need to be sure both food and service remain up to standard when key personnel enjoy a deserved day off.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. The Stove 08/03/19
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. The Stove 08/03/19
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. The Stove 08/03/19: Muffins &amp; Cookies – Chocolate Chip Cookie, Blueberry Sugar Cookie, Blueberry Funfetti Muffin (2nd Tier)

EoIBBNU8YyA-jKqqpSadSw.text: We decided to try somewhere new for breakfast and where better to go than Eastern. At first glance, The Stove is slightly hidden by a much larger sign of the business located downstairs in the same building, which made us have to make a couple passes to make sure we were in the right area.  When we got inside, we were told there is about a 30 minute wait, which is completely fine. In my experience, a wait time usually means the food is worth it. The waiting area is a little awkward as you see sandwiches in between the dining area and bar, but the wait went by quick.  Once we were seated, we were given a menu for drinks/food. I started with my standard coffee. The waitress informed us everything is made to order so there is about a 30 minute turnaround, which made us start our order with the assorted pastries. After about 20 minutes, we realized that our pastry order was forgotten about, so we gently reminded them about it and they brought it right out. The blueberry Funfetti muffin was probably the best item we ate. After eating here he pastries, we waited for our food and wait is what we did. About one hour passed since our order when our food finally arrived. I ordered the chicken and waffle, which was supposed to be a Mac n cheese waffle. Not only did I not find Mac n cheese, I found a ton of onions, which I loathe entirely. That wasn't mentioned in the description. I did enjoy the chicken and the spicy syrup at least.  In addition, the restaurant is very loud. I felt like I was in a sorority with all of the screaming going. I literally couldn't hear my wife who was sitting across from the table from me. The restaurant is also a little cramped which puts your neighbors right on top of you. We had coffee spillers to our left and bottomless mimosas to our right. Not ideal.   I would give them 3 stars for the food, as it was pretty good, although pricey. They get 1 Star for the atmosphere though. The decor was neat and refreshing, but I felt like I was at a Delta Zeta party. And I don't appreciate being forgotten about. There's too many options for dining on Eastern to settle.

5sXwg7EXqhfJDRT_RdKxNw.text: 3 words: $10 unlimited mimosas! And they're absolutely delicious as well! Most places when you get all you can drink mimosas you can almost count on your waiter being very slow to get you refills and your juices taste like sunny delight. That is not the case for this place! The variety of juices is fantastic and they are all fresh squeezed and taste like magic in your mouth when combined with the champagne.  Now to get to the food: Delicious, flavorful, authentic, and presented beautifully. Absolutely loved every bite and also, what you see pictures is $4.5 on happy hour. It's a steal! Might just be the best brunch deal in town. Will be back here very soon and multiple times!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

9BKs3viFKXyDij1CEg_www.text: The Stove is truly a hidden gem here in the Anthem Henderson area.   I've had them bookmarked since they opened and I'm happy we finally made it out here. It was definitely worth the trip across town.  We arrived around 10am on a Saturday morning and were seated right away. The restaurant itself was cozy and the decor was pretty and relaxing.  We sat right next to the table where they set up all the dishes.   We had fun watching them put all the final touches on the plates before sending them out. It really made the experience more enjoyable.   For the food...everything that we ordered was delicious. Our buddy started off with the short rib empanada and all he kept doing was moaning and saying how the meat was so tender and how delicious it was. He was definitely happy with his meal.  The husband decided to go with the corned beef and eggs. Now they don't use that can corned beef stuff but corned beef brisket! The husband was amazed when he saw it on his plate.  The corned beef was not too salty but seasoned perfectly.  I went with the crabby patty and I love how they use real crab. It put the dish on a whole different level. I liked how they didn't just blob on the hollandaise sauce too. There was just enough and it didn't over power the whole dish. We all had no complaints about the dishes we selected.  Now I cant forget the yummy Instagram worthy drinks that we got. I'll be honest, after seeing the unicorn hot chocolate on Instagram and Yelp, I had to come and try it. The hot chocolate had huge marshmallows inside, topped with cotton candy.  Now if that wasn't enough, they also rimmed the mug with chocolate and sprinkles which added even more sweetness. Can you say diabetes in a cup?!? But it was oh so good! If you have a major sweet tooth like me, go get yourself a cup, you wont regret it.  The customer service we received was top notch! The gentleman that was helping us was so helpful and answered all our questions.  He even told us about the photo booth that we can use at our convenience.  This is definitely one spot you need to try

HXC-VL8Sti5vb5Xx2Fb9bQ.text: Amazing cute little brunch spot great view fast and friendly service. Will define you come again  Pork tacos were great nice and spicy

ZZBuaUObg0jV9TRJLMsGAw.text: What a disaster. When we arrived, 1/2 of the dining room sat empty with messy tables. We waited twenty minutes while the hostess bused one of them, requiring five trips to the kitchen. Another twenty minutes passed before a waitress noticed us. We ordered coffee from her, and after another twenty minutes, the coffee finally arrived. We watched as plates of food piled-up outside the kitchen, becoming worried that it might be our order growing cold. Alas it was someone else's order. We left by the time we drained our cups. After an hour and twenty minutes, we walked away hungry. Less than twenty minutes away, we found a similar menu in a professionally run dinning room at the Kitchen. Table. We recommend dining there instead.

CUGsBf5yZ2K6H26ydQBwcA.text: How was The Stove? I can sum up in 1 word: HOT. It's on the second floor, which is already hotter than being on the bottom. In that case, the a/c should've been on full blast. Everyone at our table was using a menu to fan ourselves. I will also add that the restaurant was out of a couple of ingredients for some of the cocktails that a few of my friends ordered. Felt bad for them being told "we're out" on a few different items. Other than that food was very good and the staff was nice. I went for brunch, ordered the flapjacks and biscuits and jam, with a side of bacon. All yummy, took some to go. Also ordered bottomless mimosas, the best flavor in my opinion was the Mango. Very well mixed. You could taste the Mango as well as the champagne. Will be back in the fall/winter for some of those flavored Latte's and Hot chocolates.

-AG9cNx4fwVruRDy-qCncw.text: I was looking forward to trying this place for brunch but I was very disappointed. I always look at the pictures beforehand to see what's popular and what looks appetizing. So I wanted to try the cinnamon roll with pecan sauce but they no longer serve it. So I tried the regular cinnamon roll. It was dry and had a very little sauce on it. But thankfully I ordered that in the beginning along with my main meal because it took an hour for my food to come. No exaggeration. 60 minutes to receive my main course. There was a couple who was sat before us and they received their food 10 minutes AFTER us. I'm not sure why it took so long but an explanation would've made the wait tolerable. By the time my food came, I was full from drinking coffee and water. So I didn't finish my crabby patty. The decor and outdoor area are nice but because of the wait, I had to give The Stove 2 stars.

XursqO9_N_nLRgITufV2Mg.text: Service is slow. I always end up with wilted greens. Not sure if they need more front of house or kitchen staff. It's a cute restaurant with a decent menu just needs better execution.

AO9AvyYAshnQjvu1sSjsGQ.text: No doubt this place has cute decor, and even  located on the second floor with mountain view and a quaint patio area.  Private room,  garnishing plants growing on a panel wall,  bar seating,  bright and inviting for Sunday brunch vibe.    The menu was intriguing with duck hash,  mac n' cheese waffles, pecan pancakes,  prosciutto frittata to name a few. I had the chicken and waffles,  piled high for a more dramatic plating. Since it was stacked on mac n cheese waffles,  there was no crisp to it. The chicken was seasoned, but I could have used some more spice.   My husband got one of the Benedict dish and it was just the norm.  Great potential,  reasonable prices,  love the vibe and feel of this pace.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken n waffles,  plus 2 different types of Egg Benedict.

LidKQ1ZxBYZA23R_UlfW4w.text: This was a disappointment. We made the drive down to The Stove. I had heard good things and wanted to check it out. The first thing we noticed coming through the door was the insanely loud music. Don't plan on a casual conversation, you have to yell to the people at your table to hear them. Not at all ideal for a relaxing breakfast. Our bow tie clad waiter came over and asked if we had been to The Stove before. We said we hadn't. The waiter said "Ok" and walked away. We would have loved to have ordered some coffee, but he didn't give us the chance. We had to flag him down to get him back just to get coffee. This is a breakfast joint, it should not be this tough. We had to flag him down again to order food.  The meals look fantastic, the presentation is outstanding. I had the farmhouse. It was surprisingly good (it's 2 eggs, the house potatoes, and your choice of meat- I had bacon). The house potatoes are a nice spin on the traditional hash brown. The Chiliquiles was another story. Cold and slimy with a strong funk overtone. Three bites in and my friend could not stomach another bite. I tried a small taste and couldn't bear a second. This plate tried hard, but accomplished nothing. The country fried steak was better. The chipotle gravy was a refreshing take on an old classic. The server neglected our table, one pass he filled 1 of the 3 coffee cups on the table. I thought he might come back with another pot but he never did. We finally had to flag him over to get our bill. It took over an hour for a meal that wasn't that impressive. By then all of our ears were ringing from the overpowering music.  We tried it, we were disappointed, and we won't be back. The poor service really pushed this one over the edge.
