Pyx8EobevFV4XQbA3SAUKA.text: Loved this place. Food and staff amazing.  We went there for brunch on Sunday make sure to get there early because it's packed!

8AWEvDcipPk_QWPb5580GQ.text: It's so unfortunate that I have to rate this place so low, because the food was absolutely amazing and the only reason it's receiving any stars at all. However, even with the incredible food, I doubt we will be back because the service was absolutely terrible. We went here for brunch's few days ago and it took us over 45 minutes to receive our drinks from the bar (they came out with our food), and even after receiving part of our drinks it took another 15-20 minutes to receive the rest. The reason we were given for this was because they had only 1 bartender and he hadn't bartended before. Along with that, I had to chase down our food because it was being delivered to the wrong table, because of the wrong table number on the ticket. Very lack luster overall service by our server who seemed much more interested in talking to his friends who sat at another table to get things right, and when he did check on us, he also had to explain how it was a "f***ing s***ty day". As someone who has been in the restaurant industry for over 10 years, what we experienced was absolutely inexcusable. Thanks for the food, maybe one day we'll give it another chance, but can't be certain.

PA2la00o4lNMBliTrG-U_A.text: The food was great.  The atmosphere was great. The servers were great.  Management was great. A wonderful way to spend 2 hours on Sunday afternoon.  Grab someone you love, or want to catch up with, or cheer up and EXPERIENCE THE STOVE

QDQoJTydtJKI-OloxSr_yg.text: Pretty good place, would recommend! People really are nice, and the price isn't bad, the price isn't bad either

n4MiNVeT6XvY7nfiQfiC3w.text: Tried out The Stove on a Sunday morning.. Only 3 other tables when we arrived around 7:40.  It is in the old Firefly place.. Love the view and decor.. We were sat right away. Hostess could have been a bit more personable,seemed too quiet and maybe not what you want your first impression to be.  Our waiter was nice but our drinks took way too long.. I think he actually forgot about us and them.. We did not get our coffee and hot chocolates for 25 minutes after we ordered them, and he came and told us they would be about 2 min, then 15 min later still.. The unicorn hot chocolate is a fun drink.. It is sprinkles around the edge, with 4 large marshmallow's and cocoa and whip cream, The Mexican hot cocoa was amazing and the Lavender Latte was also very good.. Our food was very good, although it did take about 40 min from order to table.. The pecan pancakes were good but dry. We were never offered syrup??  So eating them with out any was odd.. The poutine waffle egg dish was very good.. We also tried the PB&J biscuits.  which was a biscuit with Peanut butter mousse, jam bacon and Jalapeno..Over all we had a nice breakfast. I just wish the waiter had been a bit more attentive. We asked for water, he brought water for 2 glasses, ran out of water in pitcher, never came back to fill up my glass.. Then when we asked him, he said he would be right back, then forgot a second time..  Little things make a big difference.. It is pricey.. we spent over 70 on breakfast for 3 people..It does get busy too.  It is a nice spot for breakfast.. but the food takes a while to come out and the coffee took 25 min.. otherwise it would have been 5 stars..

cZZva3kL0koo8KSrd5SvtA.text: This is the fastest lock smith. they arrived with in 10min. They are very perfessional and friendly.

WCsCEuj9QTUDNhOYxfcL9A.text: I was really excited to try this spot, all the food looked really amazing. Our server was very friendly, I was a little disappointed with how long it took to come greet us. I got the Suckling Pig and my husband ordered The Full Monty, but he got chicken and waffles instead . He said what he got wasn't bad. He also ordered the Country Fried Bacon and that was good. I didn't care for the Suckling Pig, I felt the hollandaise sauce and bbq sauce didn't go well together and the biscuit is too clunky. Also, it's served with some spring mix salad, not breakfast for me . We both got the caramel latte and that was yummy! The restaurant itself has no "bufffers" for noise, like drapes or anything that absorbs sound and a few times during our time there my anxiety was up as people were basically yelling at each other over each other (if you know what I mean).  I would like to try it again tho, there looked like there was a lot of yummy dishes and even the best of the best have off days.

oiEkOlfh6pn0epEOWDKtXA.text: I think "The Stove" has one of the best breakfast places I'd ever ate. It has a bit of a wait for the food but it sure is worth it. I really suggest the country chicken benny or the crab benny. It was absolutely fantastic, and I am 100% coming back. The customer service is a bit off but it was because we were in a new area of the restaurant. I loved this place, I suggest you should go here for a family reunion or just for a joyful and delightful time.

68loPYW4yOGobHeoeHdZlg.text: Love love love the Stove! Perfect place to come for brunch with the ladies, family lunch, or a business meeting. From the decor, to the amazing menu and Chefs...It's definitely worth checking out!!!

pznuPGhqLU8t8jEoLbmK2w.text: This place tries way too hard to be hip. That being said, the food is amazing... Just as good, if not better, than The Kitchen Table.

abDNB9KwQwLo6yFQTo56vA.text: Great place for breakfast and lunch!!! Must try the crab benedict, the Indian chicken sandwich  super tender with amazing spices. Don't leave without trying the Mexican egg. Super friendly staff. Had to go two days in a row..for lunch and next day for breakfast

HMuAYpzLgMk1NzaaFGKtiA.text: Great service (we like mohawk Michael). The chefs are kind and active in making sure the food is good. I thought the chicken and waffles were good but my gf thought it was too spicy (it has a little kick in the syrup which is good in my opinion). The Suckling Pig Benedict was good. The Hangover Corndog is amazing though. You really have to try it. They serve fresh vegetables with their dishes which I love. Been here twice and will keep going.

WPHb2R-Y55FL_YO9Vtj3Rg.text: I am not going into details but the quality of the food was excellant, the coffee was better than most places we dine at and the service was very good.  There were a few problems, one was they were out of the breakfast dish I first ordered and we were the first and only people in the restaurant at the time.

HQN6DcAHa0vyuFqhBP-rGw.text: We have been back at least 6 times in the past two weeks. Spot on every time. The food is great and so is the staff, owners and the vibe. My new favorite spot.

wB7glyZhigx9VCIxeTCxHQ.text: This place is amazing. Total gem for the area. Blown away by the staff, the food, the whole experience...classy but relaxed. Great vegan selection -try the jack tacos. Hangover corn dogs and chicken and waffles also highly recommended. The whole vibe is very cool...there's a ton of superb gourmet breakfast and lunch options that are fun and creative. They offer a killer tea service too, all afternoon. Once you get there you don't want to leave. I'm in love.

WJqRDwvz3b2VKo3aOxbqIQ.text: Wow, what a great addition to the Henderson brunch scene. Menu is innovative and the quality here shows. The owner and staff are fantastic. My new to go place for breakfast/ lunch. A must try.

VnFEbxLLyYz4rKzaSCENWA.text: Amazing Food! The best cocktails! Mike is an amazing server that took excellent care of us! The owners are wonderful and sure made the place look great! Also have delish vegan options! Check this place out!

UidMXL5c1ZACJRoXRHqghQ.text: Hands down, no contest, the single worst experience I think I've ever had at a breakfast concept in Vegas. Terrible access to the facility. No parking.  It's on the second floor with poor signage so also adds to the confusion in locating. We had reservations and still waited 25+ minutes while I counted 9 tables open. We were walked to a table and then told to wait.  While waiting another group was sat by the same hostess. We stood there for another 5 minutes without any communication and were told we would have to continue to wait.  Also keep in mind we had a pregnant woman with us.  We asked if we should be sitting or standing in another location, since we were left in the middle of the room, or perhaps at one of the 9 open tables but were told by the hostess they would have to prepare another table and we would have to wait. Do not come here. Do not waste your time. There are 100+ breakfast places in this city to chose from.

iDqkeaopEJYu1M1XoZrYMg.text: Today we attempted to make our 2nd visit. The food and service were amazing our first time, which was a Friday, mid-morning. Today we used the online "call ahead". When we got there, just before 9:00am, no-one was up front. After waiting around 5 minutes the hostess came up and explained it would be a few minutes before we could be seated, as the kitchen was slammed. We waited nearly 20 minutes. While we waited, it seemed there was only one server (on Sunday morning?!?). The table of 4 men right by us had not been visited once l, by any employee, and had no food yet. Two other couples left without receiving service. I would guess that they had people call out sick, because there is no excuse for not having proper staff on a busy weekend morning. We also ended up leaving without being seated, or even receiving an update. It would have been nice if the hostess had explained the situation so we wouldn't have wasted 20 minutes.

Slr3AY-9q-1esqckh0f_mg.text: Ate here with friends. Fabulous food! Our server Colin was the absolute best!! Owner is a former Hell's Kitchen winner, now I know why! Highly highly recommend!

TZ9DucsRzyey20kH40bYgA.text: Drove almost an hour across town to get here.  I must say, worth the trip.  Short rib tacos were delicious.  Everyone in my group thoroughly enjoyed their meals as well.  Wait staff are super cute in their suspenders and extremely friendly.  Loved this place!

6laSHoyCBOgkukcvHw4gVw.text: I was really looking forward to eating here after several friends having a good experience. I waited for over an hour and my table for 2 was given to a different party. Needless to say I was dissatisfied.

zcA_e4Tuo3eueHxdUHz2kQ.text: This place is fantastic! Great location, decor, and staff! Colin our sever was fantastic! Chicken and waffles are amazing, cant wait to come back and try more items from the menu!

pd0XQ79D_z6WXKg4sNfUzg.text: Very nice ambience, owners so nice greeted us, Food delicious & presentation lovely. Great view of Las Vegas. From straight out of Dominguez Hills,Ca

tuHyhCA5ez5FLb7_OvU21w.text: Marco, Samantha and Raphael have great service always. The food and atmosphere is great. The menus has a great selection.

2DjBbdMRUjdNFFTfApyADA.text: We really enjoyed our breakfast. Everything was delicious and the mimosa was perfect . Great food and ambiance.  The smoked feature was very unique and intriguing. Definitely will be back !!!

JPhq5-OO4RlrXAnnyT8ZSw.text: The place is an excellent place for brunch. The staff is always nice and they make great recommendations. I have been here a few times with my wife and we are never disappointed. The Benedict's are very good. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for brunch.

WBkpb1oSD8YmT1PKaik9Hg.text: Located upstairs. Small selection for vegans but amazing flavor!! Delicious breakfast and will def come back for lunch and drinks another time. Cute atmosphere with benches, bars, and round tables!

duVEuZJj9JYUiEYLUvziVg.text: THE STOVE just celebrated it's one-year anniversary with a special dinner invite.  Usually only open for breakfast and lunch or for special hosted parties,  they opened for a great evening of unlimited food and drink. Prime rib, salmon, pastas, vegetables, wonderful stuffed olives, peppers and mushrooms, and plenty of appetizer plates, Scott Commings and Antonio Nunez prepared the amazing spread  and co-owner Steve Grodkiewicz was there to host us. We started with champagne and moved on to a great whiskey.  The view over the Las Vegas Valley is unlimited.  The deck of this second- floor establishment is great for a drink and a place to relax.  The Stove's Twisted Tea Room comes with a multitude of teas to pick from and every cup and saucer is purposely mis-matched.  With the most fabulous blueberry muffins, fresh baguettes, and an amazing menu, this was my 6th time there.  Their pecan pancakes are expertly made; they have a twist on the Eggs Benedict with chicken fried steak on their waffles, and an extraordinary table-side bananas foster.  Lunch is the best with a host of fresh salads like watermelon and sandwiches to pick from.  Try the duck macaroni or short rid empanadas, and maybe opt for the bottomless mimosas.  The private dining room can hold 45 guests, with a total capacity of 75.  Located at 11261 S. Eastern Ave. #200. Call 702-625-5216. Monday thru Friday 9-3, Sat and Sun 9-4.  They are making an announcement soon, can't wait to hear it.

mFN2S1HpORt-qcCGWY-P6w.text: While it's small the vegan menu is amazing! We had the skillet and vegan burrito which were awesome! I hope to see the vegan menu grow a bit (maybe some sweet options to balance out the savory?) but we'll definitely be back soon.

lUY32NrKShHNMa4cQ99kRQ.text: Fun place to have brunch! Drawback is the acoustics- very loud and cannot hear across the table. The food was good- lots of variety to try. Loved the decor- fun and modern. Enjoyed watching the chef add finishing touches to plates as they came out.

qV4dCyloO8ZHwTceNWd1gQ.text: This place is my favorite brunch spot! Cute on the inside, great food, friendly staff. Utilize the waiting list!

vkWoMaXPSvGSlUCaxE9zFA.text: Decided to check out The Stove today. I found this place after searching Yelp for a new breakfast place in the area. The reviews looked good and I must say, overall it didn't disappoint.   We were a party of three. I'm glad we arrived when we did (about 9AM), because they were packed with people waiting when we left. There was a section that wasn't open, but it appeared they weren't staffed for it.   They have a great menu with choices for everyone. My party had a variety of breakfast and lunch items and everything tasted great.   The kitchen was a bit slow, but its a minor thing.   The restaurant was LOUD when it got busy. I could barely hear the others in my party speaking. I think that's just the acoustics of the building, nothing this establishment could fix.   Great job!

5pIMazX1Bq9Nr5L_0tZutQ.text: It's hard to believe this restaurant has only been open for 6 days! My sis had the frittata, our friend the crab benedict, and I the vegan breakfast skillet. There was not a morsel of food left between the three of us. We were all so very impressed at the blend of flavors that each dish had. The menu had 5 vegan dishes with each seeming like much thought was put into each one. Thank you for that. I will definitely be back before I have to leave Vegas to go home.

uYN1RJHMvEWDS8r4A-dF7g.text: What can I say?! I had the crabby patties and the champagne fizz. Both amazing. The hubby ordered the chilaquiles, he loved them. My son actually ate the vegan nuggets (praise), and the lunch box presentation with the little maraca toy was a hit. Our friends ordered the egg tacos and pork Benedict, girl-friend and I 50/50 our Benedicts. Pork was slightly overwhelming due to large delicious biscuit and sweetness of pork, but good! Will come again!!

UKfPfryGtzxmZjk1ZKRHLA.text: What an amazing meal.   BlackBerry and mango mimosas.   Chicken fried bacon with habanero maple syrup and country gravy with sausage. Salmon smoked Benny and crab Benny both amazing! Blueberry Maple Stout beer, smooth and delicious!  Our waiter Landon was the best and our service was impeccable.   Antonio, one of the owners was walking around checking on everyone.   The personalized service was a nice extra touch.   The photo booth was an added shenanigan.  Will definitely be back!

ycif4Ll1fcz9-3ELDrRnvQ.text: Fun restaurant! Great place for a girls lunch.  Although the food could use improvement, especially for vegan and vegetarian options, it was still very good.  Has a great and unique atmosphere, especially for Vegas!

NPK-dlVNkahtI5aZq4jNfA.text: If I could give it 10 stars I would.  The food was amazing!  The staff were very attentive and the owner/chef was really interested in his customers!  I cannot wait to go

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

asKuvBvE-7DYELeI8mkZTg.text: Great food, interesting menu, good service, and lovely views. Check it out. Had the croque madame, no regrets. Excellent coffee too.

ZoD6fdoA0Sjm-UlRK1ABug.text: Tried The Stove for the first time today with a friend and her 2 year old son. Inside is really nice, airy with all kinds of herbs growing and really nice tables. After her son dropped several utensils, broke a plate and ripped the menu, the servers treated him like he was the guest of honor. They talked to him and asked him questions and seemed to take a genuine interest in making sure we had a great experience there while having a small child with us. The food was great too! We'll definitely be back.

SgBSwMKYD2HxtHQuWv5pcw.text: Love this place so much! Their breakfast corn dog situation is ridiculous and the view is amazing!

eHNWv8eFvyOIcuIMKkkviA.text: First the good: Food is creative and delicious! Bad: Takes a long time to get said delicious food to your table...but the reason we won't be back is the LOUD musician performing his amplified set in an already very loud atmosphere! Not soothing...can't enjoy a conversation...either unplug the amplifier or lose the entertainment. Oh, and the crumpled/stained paper menus are tacky...just sayin.

c58PsvxN1aXJFTKfIRL43g.text: Great atmosphere for brunch, service too a little long for sitting at the bar. I'll give it another try because the food was good!

oojw27W2CcBXnuL5Y7vtCA.text: I spent some time Andre at the coffee/drink bar. He is amazing, a talented mixologist. I host events, and he showed me what The Stove could do with themed drinks and parties. Their food is tasty, and a talented bartender makes it even better. I'll see you in a few days with my next client. Thanks, Andre!

otd5ajmHZZxxeGEfyKNYWg.text: My first time here and not so impressed.  Now the food was good but when it was put on the table in front of me it wasn't even warm.  Then trying to get the waiters attention to get hot sauce was impossible. I had to get up and ask the kitchen help. We felt like we were invisible.  Doubt I will ever go back.

berewNmfqqpl1P0yjSOnbw.text: I was very much excited to try this new place. I visited last Sunday with my friend and our Moms. Although we had checked in online we were waiting 45 minutes to be seated and our first waiter didn't acknowledge us for about 20 minutes. Then he left. Another 10 minutes went by without us having a menu or water. We are actually pretty patient people so we waited for another 5 minutes. Finally another waiter saw me and came over. I told him we hadn't ordered anything and it was our first time here. The second waiter was friendly however our food didn't come out until 45 minutes later. I give kuddos to the second waiter as he acknowledged that they were taking longer and he gave us a free appetizer to make it up. After a long 3 hour brunch we finished and had to wait to pay and give the first waiter my credit card. Service seemed very disorganized overall. Although I was disappointed by the service  I loved the ambiance, the food and the views the restaurant has. I would have to recommend their specialty banana pancakes because the chef comes out and prepares them infront if you while telling you a background story of where they originated from. Chef seemed humble and approachable and that was appreciated!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

sLyamQDLDnSG2XmPbBgXIg.text: The food is spectacular! Unlike anywhere in Vegas. The staff makes this place what it is. Between the owner/chef, chefs, manager, servers barista and hosts everyone makes you feel like family. Absolutely incredible and by far the best breakfast in town!   It's like cheers... But prettier, with a view, and Devine food

KjpztMv6T0zn0t7Qvjnz0A.text: Outstanding food and service! Love their drinks with brunch and always good to sit in the tea area.

LALugwLAP-cEpHJlpkBV9A.text: Awesome atmosphere. Food is spot on. Flavors are on point and the plate presentation is something you see out of a 5 star gourmet restaurant. The chef is super friendly. Anything you try you will love.

Hre4EvVgCRyr1aolwUf_Ng.text: Great place for breakfast! We loved our eggs Benedict. They have a lot of pastries too. Chef inspired interesting menu. It's not your traditional breakfast and the food is really good! Great atmosphere too.

34OKo7UG1cxkwHw6iVcbGg.text: Service is painfully slow, not easy place to get into as  a couple as larger groups given preference in seating, noise is impossible to converse in,  food is very good but not worth aggravation

cow9of61Zl430cejypwH7g.text: Been twice now and each time was great! Sitting at the bar was awesome and sitting in the tea room was beautiful with the view. Try coffee with lavender it sounds weird, but it's fantastic! Try the Benedict's, I had 2 diff ones and both were amazing! Great service, great food, and great view what more could you want?

UvNSjutZktSc_1bHgChrTg.text: Everything I try is always amazing! The staff is super friendly! Bottomless mimosas are the best in town!!   Mike is amazing, friendly, and fun!  Alec is great too! We love Landon! Antonito always comes over to say hi and see how you are liking your experience and food.   Make a reservation if you don't want to wait (online or telephone) or hang out in their photo booth room while you wait. It's fun!

6BN7Ak0ObmTRVY-mr0gdSQ.text: Everything start with the atmosphere, Marilyn and I walking into a very elegant unique an interesting location. We were greeted at the door by the host that immediately took us to our table and our host expedited the water order. 10 minutes later our server walked up and asked for drink order, our requested two cups of coffee, immediately severed us. Coffee was just," ok ",At this time our order was taken Marilynn ordered them fancy eggs and I, the country fried steak. The wait for the food was little long, but again atmosphere was amazing still awake was acceptable. Our food arrived and we started breakfast. The presentation was unbelievable I seen on photos. We started to eat food was amazing. My wife expressed that our food was unbelievably good, I would say the same thing but unfortunately I found the mishap on my plate wax paper that was embedded into the country steak batter. I have to say after calling server over everything was handled so professionally. Chef came over and apologized Major D came over and apologized and so did the server our meal was comped without asking. Still have to say that the food and environment was really good even after small mishap. I would truly come again and give the place a full benefit of the doubt. I'm giving this place 4 stars because in my heart I truly believe they deserve it

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Them Fancy eggs.
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Country fried steak.

45DQlzJ1kH__w2idM03KbQ.text: So excited for 7 days a week brunch!!! Came in late on fourth of July and we were not disappointed! We started with empanadas, had some birthday pancakes (which they sparkle at your table!!), Chicken and waffles (ahhhhmazzing!), Corn dogs and lots of champagne! We even took some muffins and scones home to munch on for a hangover breakfast the next day and my only regret is not getting more! The entire staff is so pleasant and customer service oriented, which my group and I love! The decor is so Instagram-able, they're growing their own herbs which is incredible! I can't wait to go back for high tea! Also there's a selfie room! After a few drinks,  I dare you not to go in there! I really wish I could give more than 5 stars!!!

k0o76WvwWrGdk8SZypBtxw.text: Absolutely loved it! The wait staff was very helpful, and answered all our questions. Do yourself a favor and check out the Krabby Patty, but ask them to warm it up. One of the best crab benedict's I have had!

rAYE2QjV8TRpQkMtndlkKg.text: Went there for lunch... not brunch...  the menu was extensive,the physical menu was dirty.  There were 5 selections for lunch eats, the description of the ingredients is poor.  When the food arrived, the sauce on the sandwich was so over powering that one could not recognize any other flavors.    The decor is quaint and well done... there must of been an issue with the AC because the temperature in the restaurant was over 80.  I would give another try for breakfast,

jQXaSUpBmaGLr5-6sj23ew.text: This place was amazing. The choice of foods, especially the exotic, discerning palate? The ambiance is a little loud and the service is good. I would definitely come back again. Oh yeah, they have a bar sitting area that is open to first come first served that the hostesses don't tell anyone about.

izW-GBOzVv3gBJ054rEEHQ.text: Good spot, but needs a little more frequent menu changes. Otherwise it's tough to go back weekly. That said, the items it does offer are good. Unique options not seen elsewhere. Strip quality, but not as pricey. Nice views, friendly waitstaff.

kDOS_D9TTv4557prPY5XDw.text: AMAZING!!!! I love the fresh pastries. The cinnamon roll is out of this world and worthy of being a meal on its own. If you do order it, be prepared to share. Delicious and addictive are two words that come to mind.

ItveHfICFdupo8E9NCxpew.text: This place is such a cute spot! There is a photo booth inside the restaurant so we kept ourselves busy until our table was ready. Our server was amazing and attentive. The entire staff came by to check on us during our meal which was super nice. Definitely try the salmon benedict and they have an amazing deal on bottomless mimosas. My only complaint is that there are too many good things on the menu so I'll have to make a few more trips to try everything out! Thank you to the staff for an amazing experience

wUUDFOB_Y_pvAZXOUYCguw.text: Why have an online wait list sign up, to just turn us away when we arrive? Well, that's exactly what happened to us. The online wait list estimated a 50 minute wait. That's fine, since it takes us about 30 minutes to drive there anyway. We finally arrive, and no one was there waiting, albeit, the tables were full of course (it was a Saturday after all). The hostesses informed us they have big parties (like 25+) right now and the Chef says they can't seat anymore people until the Chef says it's okay. They told us it could be another 45 minutes to an hour wait. They can keep their hipster food.

ybs9qsyLhF2QfQWc9D6Ndw.text: This place has been open for about 2 weeks and we've already gone twice!  cutest brunch spot, definitely what Henderson needed. 7 days a week brunch & unlimited mimosas!!!! (With different flavors)  Food is so good. Service is awesome, everyone is so helpful and attentive. Owner Antonio makes sure your experience is the best. Can't wait to go back and try a different item on the menu!!!

TZvoNp5X8UlYqUY3BQF8-g.text: Great food - great service. New favorite spot. Go find the menu. Moms and daughters - there are tea party's here. You will love it.

gNBd9MnKN8ZHOuJQ7Gq5-A.text: This place is definitely a place to come try! It's a super cute classy little breakfast house! The vibe inside is definitely amazing and the staff is so awesome and friendly! The food was delicious and everything is freshly made! I had the farmhouse!

ipmUKCD7fjJWg0g1QlK5AA.text: Awesome new place in the area. Me and the misses have tried pretty much every spot in the area and have to say this is one of our new favorites. The food is super tasty, fresh and just all in all on point. We tried the Empanada, Indian spiced chicken Sammy, and one of the breakfast salads all were delicious. Definitely trying the Foie next time. Yes they have Foie! The prices are reasonable as well. Add to that, the decor is super cool, as well as nice views. Service was top notch (thanks Orlando!), met one of the proprietors Antonio as well, very welcoming super cool and genuine guy. They put alot of heart into this place and you can tell. Had a phenomenal experience here and will definitely be back. Try them out! You won't be disappointed.

c1fX26Bp_LZvtDOoRAF0cg.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our experience at The Stove from the moment we walked through the door.  We were greeted right away with a friendly smile from the hostess, the decor was warm, the view was great & the energy from other guest was awesome.  After being seated, Mike & Doug made us feel right at home, & gave us amazing service to the end.  Landon & Antonio the Owner's / Chef came & introduced themselves & gave us some insight to their menu & creation.  I must say besides the wonderful service, the food was delicious.  We stared w/ the empanada's (which we LOVED), then Kale salad & the Smoked Chicken Soup (Their Take on Matzo Ball Soup, that gives Bubby a run for her money).  We will definitely return!

sBqW6AiXOmJJixkT0E52AQ.text: The ambiance, the staff and the food all are perfect. I ate the best egg white frittata I have ever had - like eating a cloud. Coffee is excellent - so is the berry protein shake! Can't wait to return and try other dishes and enjoy the tea room too!!

4fo8ZH4ZZkRE3FmDDmKhxg.text: Excellent food, cool atmosphere and the staff is awesome!  Must do and if you have little ones - unicorn hot chocolate is a hit!

HSwvWRWzB28_D9iuesD77g.text: Fabulous. Everything we've tried has been spectacular. Gorgeous place. Great food. Knowledgeable staff. You must go there. But you will have to wait

nSjWxkLvEip2KzoiVmNfgQ.text: Amazing food, and even better service!  Going back for sure!!!  The entire staff makes you feel welcome from the moment you walk in.  You can taste that there have been NO shortcuts in the food.  I can't wait to try the tea service as well!  I'd give this spot more than 5 stars if I could!!

QlkrzjqH94_mJ0pHHuLoEA.text: This was the most bizarre experience I've ever had at a restaurant. First of all, the menu on yelp does not match the physical menu we received there. There were tons of vegan options on the yelp menu, but when we went in, it was a tiny section with only 5 items. We got on their online wait list, but when we arrived, the waiter, Landon, told us the dining room was closed so we would have to sit in the tea room.. except the tea room wasn't set up yet and he was having his lunch in there. We explained it was our first time there and didn't have a preference where we sat, but he still seemed hesitant to have us sit in the tea room. Why would you accept an online reservation if you didn't have places for guests to sit?? It gets much weirder. Once we sat down, he asked us if we had ever heard of Kitchen Table, and then was awestruck and (in his words) "insulted" that we had never heard of it. He proceeded to ask us how long we've been living in Vegas that we had never heard of this amazing place. My fiance has been living and working in the Vegas hospitality industry for 13 years and never heard of Kitchen Table. The waiter couldn't believe it. Anyway, the whole deal with Kitchen Table was that The Stove had been opened by the same owners. He must have been the owner's son to have been so insulted, because no one would ever speak to a guest like that. Then he asked if we wanted to start with regular water or BLK water. When I asked what BLK water was, he hit me with the "what?!?! You've never heard of BLK water?!"  I felt like I was in high school being served by the popular girl and I was in chess club. It was so ridiculously unprofessional that when he walked away, I told my fiance I wanted to leave. I couldn't stand another minute of this man's insufferable arrogance and lack of interpersonal skills. So we left, went and had lunch at Vegenation where we always get exceptional service, and the food never disappoints.

7FqRzn29DiCTAaDyVjqGAw.text: Greer location! They have amazing food and even a delicious vegan menu. My only issues are that  often the music is so load you can't have a normal conversation with whom ever you are with which defeats the whole purpose of eating our with friends or family and the other thing is that you watch as some dude garnishes the dishes but I've seen him use his bare hands for this and touch all sorts of things before hand...

IK8gDi8nq9sHjZHmB6G1DA.text: Let's start at the beginning. We had a reservation and we waited 20 mins to be seated and we weren't served our meal for over an hour. The service was extremely slow. "Tea" in the tea room is why we went - we LOVE tea! This was NOT tea. The tea drink selection was fine, but why do they serve cream in a square cup that cannot pour? The meal was NOTHING! Tiny portions of BAD food. They served 1 raspberry Cut In Half! For 2 people! Tiny "scones" and homemade jam tasted like it had gone bad! The meat was incredibly spicy and it was the size you would serve in a doll house. The view is nice but why would they have a deer head in a tea room? Creepy! We left to go find some real food!

k8DIxZJ7aFB8hbxz4y_Dcg.text: I will give a 5 Star for decor, it's a very pretty restaurant. The service was excellent as well. I had the corned beef hash and it looked great when it came out however, it didn't live up to its looks. The meat was stringy and wet and had big pieces of fat, sadly the potatoes were very mushy. I will try one more time because I really want to like this place.

XPeKbjgkylLHpn5ysvsE1g.text: Tried the tea service. Was very nice tea choices and savories and sweets. 4 stars for quality of tea, food and china/pots. 2 stars for service/ambiance. Because all the tables around having meals, was more like a diner (as in Dennys) than tea service. Service rushed and infrequent...plus missing key components of tea: Had to physically get up and ask for sugar and cream (for tea!) and then again for a spoon ( to stir sugar and cream in my tea!) Our server nowhere to be found, so another assisted when we approached tea brewing area. Also, please put the cream and sugar in a creamer pitcher and sugar bowl. Paper packets and the hipster square creamer box are weird when you are drinking from dainty china.  The decor is cute, the regular menu food looked awesome, maybe that is what we will try next,and hopefully 5 stars. Overall still enjoyed the tea, treats, and got to linger with good friends and a lovely view.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Earl grey (before i could get cream and sugar)
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Tasty treats!

Ao9W8nuOmkRr7UUZLfCuUQ.text: The food, service and view were all great. I had, probably, the best avocado toast ever!

BdO5LtbtfHPtXMAFiCwDMg.text: Food was very good, prepared very tasty. Restaurant was extremely noisy, difficult to carry on a conversation with table mates. Server could have been more attentive. I will re-visit, hopefully for a more pleasant experience

gJ-Pivsr0JXONpVSAXk5jQ.text: Food is high quality. The menu is original and fun. They even bake their own pastries. But the wait for food is really long. It's understandable to wait for a table during busy brunch hours but the wait to receive food once ordered is extreme. It's not a fast food joint and it's ok to wait a bit for quality food but the wait goes past industry standard. This place is new so it seems they may be working on getting up to speed. I surely hope they do because everything else is great.

gCcFHopNQwjDm7z9qxznrw.text: Hands down this was among the best places to eat at.  Very innovative food.  Came here with another couple and we all LOVED what we ordered.  The chefs here are top notch and know how to make food above and beyond.  Super experience.  Colin our server was a pro!  Thanks Colin for taking care of us!!

6JzdRBCm5bhx_8Jhu2cJ5w.text: You must go online to reserve a table, but now I've gone and done online reso and wish all restaurants would do it. Very convenient and the food was great. Service was kinda slow, but I think I just had a dingy server. Everyone else seemed to be working pretty hard.

jKE_Kr2ZBMm6EgqyrNAXIg.text: Several people have mentioned that front end is slow. The issue starts in the kitchen, it is simply too small to accommodate the seating capacity given the variety and complexity of the offerings. And it seems to take longer than comfortable because the low, hard ceiling reflects noise in a room full of people waiting for their food.

rRHTGEJUdbMNv_0xMNL4UA.text: Deliciously lovely An open atmosphere allows for views of the surrounding hills. This second floor gem offers yummy attractions for breakfast & lunch. Large cups warm the soul with the best coffee.

1fStdzVpwatoAtMhvH0MnA.text: We came here for Sunday brunch and the places is very cute. It does get pretty busy but you can put you name on the waitlist online, with that being said we still waited close to 40 min for a table. The food is good but not amazing, portions are on the small side and service was decent. The mimosas seemed to be pretty popular and they do offer vegan options but this place was a little out of the way for us to make a second trip.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

oGIa-1aFSCBQZcUouQhzMQ.text: This place has one theme and that theme is "The Waiting game"... we placed a reservation AN HOUR AND A HALF before we arrived for 4 adults and 2kids, then we proceeded to wait an additional 40 minutes once we arrived. At this point I figured Paula Abdul and Chris Potter was going to walk out of the back because we finally got our table, which I might add was really just two small tables butted up together... aka no elbow room!  So we finally got a server to take our order, we asked for a rush order because of how long we had to wait at this point, about 20 minutes later our appetizers came out but still no refills on water I started to wonder if they charged for water by the glass because we didn't get any refills until we asked for some.   Around 30 minutes after the apps came out we were told that our food was the next ticket. We finally got our food but the youngest at the table (5yo) had to wait an additional 15 minutes and he didn't get his food until all of us we almost done eating. If there is one thing this place is quick on is to change you for eating there... we literally got asked if we were ready for our bill... we never got asked how the food was, if we needed condiments, if we needed anything else besides water, or even water refills.   This place really surprises me, if you come alone or with one other person you'll probably love it, but this was a complete surprise almost no customer service and a rush to get you to leave... very surprised...

OzyhPQEMZqWC3T40omc2JQ.text: Went for brunch on a Sunday at 12:30. Had to wait for a table which is expected but the place to wait was right by the kitchen door. When we were seated there were only cups for the 4 adults but not for the 4 children. The adults received water in a timely manner but the children didn't get any water. The server took our drink orders about 15 minutes after sitting  down. We also requested waters for the children at that time. 3 of the adult drinks came out in a timely matter but the iced tea didn't show up till about 20 minutes later after asking for water for the children again.   Our food took 50 minutes from time of order until it was delivered to our table. The kids meals came in lunch boxes which would have been a cute idea had the lunch boxes not been rusty. I get the idea of being kitchsy but this is still food and being placed so close to rust isn't appealing.   The food was only ok for the prices and the wait was totally unacceptable. The view of the valley was great tho. I hope that this was just a one off experience but even so it's not good business practice for a restaurant.  This space has been several different restaurants over the years. If our visit to the Stove is how they usually do business I won't be surprised when it turns up as another restaurant.

c8RBO6PGpoE6k3-MVhLPig.text: I have been to the Stove three times now, it's a great place to eat.  Everything is homemade so fresh grade flavors this is not your boring egg and I, the chef kicks butt and the views great. I would tell anybody that wants a wonderful meal from pancakes to sandwiches and great drinks and nice people go there

bGgbbDk8mccjOxptEtZdlg.text: I just came here with my sister and boyfriend and was pretty blown away. From what it seems, they have a seasonal menu, so don't be surprised if you come 6 months later and the menu is different. Currently they have man duck confit dishes. The duck confit mac & cheese was my abosulte favorite. There was mushroom, duck, and some spinach mixed in. I got the crabby patty and was a bit disappointed. For $20.00, I thought I would have my mind blown, but alas it was not the case. I loved the vegetables it came with, but I lost to the overpowered fishy/ocean smell. My sister ordered a burger, not realizing it was a burger. I forgot what the dish was called, but I think there was a "MAJA". It was in the lunch section. It had some indian spices and came with french fries. We ordered a side of a pancake to share as a dessert, and it was very tasty. Their vanilla bean syrup is delicious as well! Expect to spend quite a bit on your dishes, but at least your dishes will be unique! The service was good, and I loved the decor. They also have a photobooth randomly in the center of the restuarant. Check it out! The Stove is on the 2nd floor of the building so look up for the sign! (bottomless mimosas are $19.00 if you would like to get turnt)

M8jXBYuM1AhJayzCqPAWqA.text: Loud, slow service, rude patrons & there are too many tables very close together.  My friend and I walked out without ordering.

wfXPlho5YoTg-lD_fE55Vg.text: We had a great experience at The Stove the food is very good and great service too! Definitely recommend it.

pAghfAS73oJ17LBuPbdjhg.text: Have to update my review. I don't know how but the Stove keeps getting better and better.   The menu changes a bit with the season but they keep my favorites. I'm in a perennial diet so I just as for an omelette with veggies and meat. They do that and give me a salad in the side. Tasty and Leto friendly.   If you like hot chocolate you won't be disappointed. It's wonderful and a real treat on a cold morning.   The staff is fantastic and we're treated like family. In fact, there are pictures in the wall of some of the customers. I'm happy to say my wife, MIL, and I am on that wall.   Weekends can be very crowded so go early.

Ck9QcfnMneo1SEOmiTEaJA.text: "NEW" in TOWN?     This brand new extended brunch, breakfast, coffee & cocktail restaurant (opened 4 days ago) is a welcome addition to Anthem area.      The cappuccinos are EXCELLENT  (I had 2!) served in generous white cups creamy & smooth just ideal way to start my morning       The Stove menu is eclectic with a lot of twists on traditional Brekkie options~ including smoothies. Offering home baked pastries which are on display at the coffee /cocktail bar. We started with a blueberry muffin, tasty treat to begin with. We ordered the Avo Toast ( my FAV, I order this everywhere from Henderson NV to Charleston SC to Australia soooo I am kind of an expert...at least in my mind ) ABSOLUTELY stunning to look at and tasty too! A lot going on here next time I order this I will ask for the greens decoratively presented on top ~  to be along side and a little less dressed & for the dense crusty toast to be grilled on both sides, just MY preference ~      My hubs had the "Suckling Pig" pretty much a riff of Eggs Benedict with a twist replacing english muffins with Buttermilk biscuits adding smoked Pork & brown butter hollandaise~ ohhh and some jalapenos.... a SPECTACULAR presentation for sure and it was all consumed if you know what I mean. My hubs is a foodie for sure and commented "it WAS good, also commented there was a lot going on tho ~       The Stove is very welcoming as the staff & chef want you to be happy and FULL, as you won't leave hungry . Just  the Jacques Pepin quote on the wall, the bookcase above the kitchen window with antique lunch boxes, cook books and assorted "brick a brac" PLUS I liked watching the chef putting the finishing touches on each plate as it came out of the kitchen ~ NICE TOUCH    Overall a VERY pleasant way to start the day, OR KICK START your afternoon with a "Twisted" tea~

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. The Outdoor Patio
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Good Morning
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Avo Toast w/ a twist

YUfXqHBByJyHUgxMcEcdRg.text: Great place to drink Mimosas at 1 in the afternoon.  The food was all so amazing!. Great portions! The people working there are incredibly friendly. I always love asking for recommendations from the servers. And boy did they know how to recommend. I loved everything about this place.  I only hate that it's so far from my house because my GF and I have to drive so far to enjoy such amazing food lol.  I highly recommend this place

Y89vfcuRqvAkIZk1X29Vmw.text: Found this little gem for a brunch date. The atmosphere makes this place one of a kind! They had so many different areas for activities. It's not just your basic food joint! They have a bar with delicious pastry's, a team party room, the area you have delicious food and even a back room for events! The food is so amazing, with each dish have a fun creative flare to it!   Our server was awesome, I'm not lying, the best service I've had in a while! I couldn't decide between two dishes and asked him to surprise me! So It was between the avocado toast or the Savory French toast. This man brought me the Savory French toast, but added a huge side of guacamole! It may not seem like much, but that showed he really cared and he gave me the best of both worlds! In my opinion he killed it! Love this spot and i will be back!

DLyWsVNapoeKBaOzV09lqg.text: Food is excellent however the service is awful. Had same inept server the 2 times I've been there and each time the experience was bad. Inattentive, forgot food order, no refills on drinks just basically incompetent. Maybe it's just him but that server shouldve already been fired so my experience here has been bad at best.

Too49wo8lD4g0lrifX9TIQ.text: Just moved to Henderson and this place is AMAZING. Great ambience and a menu that really begs to be explored. We started with the pecan pie pancakes. They're sweet without being overwhelming and a portion that is LARGE. My wife is a New Mexican and got the chiliquilies. She remarked that they weren't traditional, but were delicious.   I had the maharaja. This is my favorite chicken sandwich is Vegas. Tandoori chicken with spices that will blow your mind. Definite suggestion is to come in with friends and share food.   Wait staff is friendly and helpful. I'm a customer for life.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

9WiBjn-xPtGybQkEUfqxDQ.text: The past 6 years after moving to this area I have seen food establishments come and go; from Firefly to Standard and Pour, and I am hoping that "The Stove" is third time's a charm and will stay! The esthetic decor of the restaurant reminds me of something I could see in SF/LA. The placement of the furniture and decorations/plants definitely made this spot bigger than it seems.   From beginning to end it was a great experience! The hostess greeted us and we were seated fairly quick. Alec, our server, was fantastic! He answered questions we had about some items on the menu and recommended some of his favorites and what he honestly thought about the food, which was nothing but positive feedback. I liked how they had a vegan menu that caters to all types of customers. All items are cooked fresh to order besides pastries, which are baked every morning.   Ordered:  -Short rib empanada= ingredients compliment each other and just the right amount of crunchiness.  -Croque Madame- Alec's recommendation & worth it. Reminds me of a monte cristo. Great combo of ingredients and breaking the egg yolk was definitely food porn worthy.  -Chicken n waffles- overall meal felt light, which I was surprised because the waffles had Mac n' cheese. Was not oily, salty, or too bready.  -Mexican hot chocolate=tasted like Christmas! Toasted marshmallows, hints of cinnamon, didn't seem like powder was used, real chocolatey taste.  -Vanilla iced coffee- was a little sweet but tolerable, wished they had milk substitutes but maybe over time they'll add that on.  The staff was friendly and I believe we had one of the owners come up to us to ensure everything was going well, he even recommended to check out the photo booth afterwards.   I would definitely come back and try more of their food options and to hopefully check out their tea room option they offer.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Short rib empanada
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Chix n waffles

ZpjY5bEmAnqJiRDWhyvc5w.text: This place is amazing best brunch hands down. They have such an amazing interior staff was so awesome they helped accommodate 10 people the night before! Will definitely be coming back here food was soooo good!

Lrudk-T3WMzpCdAUZnNrEA.text: This was a huge disappointment from start to finish. We walked in and the hostess just looked at us and said nothing until we asked her for a table. The table was dirty the coffee cup was dirty they didn't have any more coffee cups so my wife waited half way through the breakfast before she got her latte. The most amazing thing is I ordered the Brussels sprout hash and it came out with out any brussel sprouts at all! The staff said the owner was gone so things were in chaos, I guess call ahead and see if he's there before you go!  I would have expected my wife's coffee not to be on the check at least after all the mistakes, but I paid for everything and I will not be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Dirty coffee cup.

F7Q3wYK4-TGmGna5iAR-4A.text: Hands down, the best Breakfast/Brunch place ever (and I Brunch a lot!). The menu is exciting and has a little of everything for everyone. The blueberry scone itself (flaky, buttery, loads of blueberry with just right amount of sweetness) is worth all the burpees I'm going to have to do tomorrow. The cinnamon bun comes running on a close second, but I'm also a sucker for scones.   The "eggs and guanciale" was well balanced dish, clean in its flavors and fun if you want a lighter fare. The "country Benedict" is rich so definitely eat the greens on your plate to balance the sweet batter of the waffles. The "hang over corn dog" is to die for and, well.... lives up to its name. While we loved the "chorizo fritatta", we all agreed it could have used a little more chorizo (we like out meats!). Don't forget to wash your meal down with a smooth and warm cup of "lavender latte", though I wish they served almond milk .   With its refined and homey menu, the bright and welcoming ambience, and a super friendly staff, "The Stove" is nothing short of perfection. It's so nice to have a menu of foie without being pretentious.

7YJ0egreYMXa7V6FgrPcCw.text: Best new breakfast spot in Henderson! You have brunch, a tea room, a "calming" room, and a selfie booth. Originator of Kitchen Table, Antonio, has done it again. Taking food experience to a whole new level!   The food was amazing. The ambience is elegant. The prices reasonable. A MUST "dine in" if you're looking for a different level of brunch.

in3v-8m83rPzeTAiUVOD2g.text: For some reason Kitchen Table closed an hour early yesterday so we found ourselves at The Stove. My date got the country benny & I got the crabby patty (along with bottomless mimosas of course). The food itself was delicious but the mimosas were made with warm champagne. The service was the absolute worst. Basically we never saw our server again after we gave our drink order & my date had questions about the menu. Many servers walked by us & couldn't even glance in our direction or let us know they'd find our server or anything. Luckily I was able to flag someone down who identified himself as the owners son & he answered our questions & even took our breakfast order. After awhile someone came over (assuming he's the owner) & said the kitchen lost our ticket & he would personally make our food & comp the check. At this point we're both irritated but we're happy that they're rectifying the situation. Miraculously our food is out 5 minutes later.   I may or may not be back. The food was great but it seems like servers need to be retrained.

Yu2k15DbgiUp-bfs_YmTDQ.text: Great brunch/lunch place. 4 stars only because it took 40 minutes to get our food. Food and coffee were delicious! It was worth the wait. Great atmosphere and our server was wonderful. Definitely want to come back and try the formal tea service.

O59iFu0ewOgK-fwuB7vPNg.text: Very flavorful and unique dishes. I would recommend anyone looking for something a bit different to try out this place.

19tOSYiG499tKr-vRfjUnQ.text: Thoroughly enjoyed my second visit! The food is fantastic with so much variety but what the Stove really knocks out of the ballpark is their staff. On Sunday - the Owner Chef, Hostess, GM ( I think) and server all recognized me from two weeks ago! Brooke ( she's a keeper) even remembered that I liked extra ice!!!! So far my favs are the Avocado Toast and Crabby Benedict but I can't wait to go back and try more items!

h0swM_ZWhvrrsVn82PpICQ.text: This is my first time coming here and it was awesome. I was able to get in pretty quickly since we came around 8:15am. Didn't wait at all. As the morning goes on, it will get busy.   I had the white chocolate late and my wife had the cotton candy coffee. Both were great!  The kids had the birthday pancakes and were instant favorites.   My wife had the protein house breakfast-I was able to have some of her left overs since it was a healthy portion and my Shashuka was delicious. Highly recommend!!!

WjTEFUwMcuAYYt9JDxZozQ.text: Went around lunch time on the weekend so it was a little busy. Food was great, everything was quality!

03-pP_oZv5o1vulk1YNqDQ.text: Overpriced for no flavor. Our table had the corned beef and eggs, Traditional Eggs Benedict, pancakes (both plain and birthday cake), scrambled eggs, Creme Brulee oatmeal and the duck hash. With all of this you would think there was more than 1 person at the table excited and happy about what they were eating. Not even the coffee was worth it. The only person that enjoyed their meal was the one with the creme brulee oatmeal and the 1 year old with a bowl of fruit. The flavors on the Benedict all blended together, no salt or anything. The only flavor that could be picked out was the egg yolk. Not even a hint of the hollandaise sauce or the smoked ham. Nothing. A little pinch of salt goes a long way. I had to steal some of the corned beef just to get some sort of flavor. The corned beef and eggs had no seasoning. It was more of a brisket. The oiled potatoes were mushy. It was just bland. Not even the mustard had a flavor. Too sweet. The pancake tasted like flour. The syrup would have been good, but the bottles were so crusted over from the sugar (obviously not cleaned in a while) that we couldn't get any out. Tried a few bottles. Same for the birthday cake pancakes. Just floury. Duck hash had no flavor and nothing to it. The bathrooms were dirty and sticky. No toilet paper. Trash cans over filling. The whole place just had a very in kept feel. The waitress was a little pushy but good. She was on top of it. The side of scrambled eggs had no flavor and were spongy. Looked over cooked. There's a line cook that decorates the food in front of everyone to watch. They are more concerned about their show than the quality of their food. After we left, we went to another place to get a snack just to have something edible and get coffee that was drinkable. Do not understand the hype for this place. The wait time for this place would make you think it's amazing. Not so much.

zjKkxHO5-LhqO3lJAOLIag.text: I had the short rib empanadas to start and they were really good. Followed up by Crab Eggs Benedict and enjoyed it a lot. I will definitely go back to try other things.

z7dfhSQZ3gGomcGROZCoug.text: Stopped here as we were driving through town, it was delicious. Good coffee, great service, and the food was delicious. We ordered birthday pancakes, raviolis (with eggs, who knew?!), and corned beef hash, and would do it all over again. Crossing our fingers we get this restaurant in San Diego!

vuGh0niVNJhztwHjkSHMmg.text: The customer service is OUTSTANDING!! From the moment we walked in until we left our experience was awesome! Great vibe, and the food was delicious! Definitely becoming a regular!

VPjz25SIhNPtPPuINMpDkg.text: Love the overall environment, friendly staff and unique food offerings. They have an awesome vegan selection which can be hard to find.

5503R1CP19qAszxLdyUApA.text: Just finished eating here with three friends. I had flap jacks and the crabby patty. Yo, it was amazing. The rest of the group had the Suckling Pig Benedict, The Farm House and the Chilaquiles. Each of there's was equally amazing. Portions are perfect. There's a lavender latte that one of the girls had and she loved it.

Y1RIVCxuObX_CPJ8jE7eog.text: I'd like to go 5 stars, but I didn't feel it.  The food was really good, service excellent, but food was just not 5 star to me...I wish i could go 4.5, but not an option on yelp.  I had chicken and waffles by the way.

PuwkF6cKv0E9t7JROirdRw.text: AMAZING. Spotless service. Serves are super attentive and friendly. Food was delicious, banana flambe pancakes is a must try. I would recommend and will definitely go back.

WdjYHYXGNVp3xIY-F5t3YQ.text: Service needs work, waited over 45 minutes for a table. Normally this wouldn't be an issue if the restaurant was busy but it wasnt. Instead we noticed plenty of tables open that just needed to be cleaned Other guests and I sat waiting. When we finally sat down the server told us it would be another 30 minutes for food because they made everything "fresh" being in the restaurant business myself it is unacceptable to even tell the guest that. Eggs should never take more than 30 minutes to cook. I wish I had time to taste their food but because of such a long wait my family and I left hungry. The owner should take note that there were 3-4 other guest that walked out during the time were there. That's profit walking out the door, because the tables weren't flipped in a timely matter. Hopefully the service improves because this place has alot of promise.

XhpNQC8xMizhxgMOnC9qkw.text: Long wait and food not cooked properly (runny eggs).  It was cold too.  They try pretty hard though, so I'll give them another chance some other time.

Oh5-8w3II2ofKLYGgEW0-g.text: I was dragged here as part of a work lunch (party of 10)... the fact they open with "food will take extra long because it's made fresh" was kind of a tell tale. Then I find my dishes had elements that came from a can or prepackaged crap really says something. Jalapenos were like if canned quality and their fried onion garnish was stale, semi-wet out of a bag? I ordered the tomato soup, grilled cheese and deviled eggs... I got a bowl of fire roasted salsa much like from El Pollo Loco's salsa bar and the world's saddest halved slice of sourdough and with A Single slice of cheese and 2 mushroom slivers? And the deviled egg tasted like week old, over cooked hard boiled eggs with canned toppings... oh this was before taking 35min to order, then an extra 15min for a hot tea and then another 40min after that for my "food". In the end I ate most of the egg whites from the eggs and my sad sandwich... had two bites of the "soup". My potion was about $30...  The worst part was we were here for my boss's bday lunch and EVERYBODY hated it. Worst 2.5 hr lunch in history thus far.  I can see what this place is aspiring to be. It's wanting to be like a trendy restaurant plucked out of the Mission District in SF but it fails on pretty much every level. But it's priced similarly... I really do think their high yelp rating has got to be paid for.

3ndO2goR-vW_WDJ7VItS8A.text: I love this place so much. We've never eaten anything bad here. We love that the kids meal comes in an old school lunch box. Super cute. The attention to detail here is amazing. Everything is so detailed. Even the food. The time taken to make this quality food is outstanding. I love going here with my family. The only thing I hate is how long it takes me to decide in food because I want to try everything and they always have new stuff. I'll never get tired of this place.

jM-rH8wYHc6RZz4IGkPCeA.text: EXPENSIVE EXPENSIVE EXPENSIVE EXPENSIVE!!! it was two of us.. we ordered the deviled egg which was really good.. but it was like eating gourmet..just a taste...not a great idea for appetizer.. more like a tease.. I'll not mention the other stuff because the eggs were the best thing we ordered.. so I reccomend the devil eggs.. just don't show up hungry.. lol... this place was recommended... glad to have gone... even though it was loud as hell.. I would say.. it's not worth the drive.

F5qOnrrA-UszrnjD4F9-gg.text: Our first visit to the Stove certainly won't be our last!!!  Hard to decide what to try first but went with the chicken and waffles.  YUM!  And the chocolate monkey tea!  DOUBLE YUM!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

yOHc6g0mXa6O797cfKpCOA.text: Attended a birthday party, they charged $40 per person, way over priced for the food and service. They forgot my order and than didn't even acknowledge the fact, my friend had to remind them. Not going back there again.

Ju_AYM_Kbl2edQHW8uZiGg.text: Visited the Stove twice in the past 2 weeks. Both in the mornings for breakfast.   First visit I had the suckling pig benny and cup of regular drip coffee to drink. The cup size is about twice the size of coffee at a normal breakfast place. You get half and half or milk and a couple different options for sugar. They don't have flavored creamers.  Second visit I had the Farmhouse included 2 eggs (I had them poached), ham, house potatoes, and sourdough toast (came buttered). I had a choice between orange, strawberry, and blueberry jams. I chose strawberry, it was served in a small cup, and was a great choice. The ham was very good.   Both times I spent an avg of $12-16 per dish and $4 for coffee (with refills and to go cup of you request).

LdYs-SQl_QUe94ttmnoR5A.text: I had lunch with a group of 16 women yesterday. Arrangements were made two weeks in advance for this group and we were seated in the "tea room". First of all whatever they supposedly cleaned the floor with which was smearay looking made your shoes stick to the floor. I had flip flop sandals on and it literally sucked my shoes off. Once we were seated it took o e hour for before our orders were taken. Then almost another hour before meals started being served. My friend and I both ordered traditional Eggs  Benedict. It was barely warm and the English muffins were so hard you couldn't even cut them with a knife. It was one of the worst meals I have ever had. Meals started slowly being served. 4 of the 16 women were never served and everyone else was done eating before one of the 4 ladies that were not served got up and complained to the owner. He came into the room with all kinds of excuses like "we should have had a fixed menu" and "they weren't prepared for such a large group". They knew two weeks in advance when reservations were made the amount of people coming. I will never go back and most of the women in the group said the same thing. Service was terrible and so was the meal.  .

O2jfQX5s5sG8ighRdqsNFg.text: There are a lot of places to eat breakfast/ lunch in South Las Vegas, but not many restaurants have me thinking about the next time I visit.  The style of the restaurant has  a country cottage feel to it.   The staff is very helpful in showcasing the menu and topping off my coffee.  Sundays and for a limited time they have live acoustic music on Mondays.     The menu: Everything sounded good so I decided to look at pictures from previous yelpers.  Big mistake!  That just made it harder to make a decision.   Marcos our server made some suggestions and I ultimately decided on some banana fosters pancakes, short rib empanadas, and my wife got the crab cake Benedict.        The taste: Wife and I both really like the short rib empanadas with black beans, sour cream and green sauce to start.  I really could have ordered another one and could have left the restaurant happy, but no I decided to attack my sweet tooth and have the banana fosters!  To my surprise the Chef who made my Banana fosters is Hells Kitchen winner Scott Commings!  Oh, and yes it was delicious(good for 2 people).  I was able to steal a few bites of my wife's crab cake Benedict and I can say that the crab still had some of that ocean sweetness to it!  Came together well with the artichoke and hollandaise sause.      Final thought: I really like the design of the place. Very nice, comfortable main area with the live music did it for me. They have a nice party area that can be closed off from the rest of the world.  Very diverse menu, so you could say they definitely have something here for someone who's picky or just too open minded like myself.  The service provided by Marcos was great very personable.  In short "The Stove" has already got me thinking of my next visit!

7PgHz8OdKBIuGIzB8xHa2w.text: Eggggscellent brunch and highly suggest the breakfast tacos, chicken and waffles and poutine waffles. No booze this time, but the mimosas in the champagne flutes w/ built in straws looked amazing and fun

agNFuKAouphePk3v_H7rmw.text: Heard about this place from a coworker who said it was amazing in all aspects. Upon arrival (we made reservations online so there was no wait) we noticed immediately it was VERY loud! We sat across from each other and had to speak loudly to barely hear one another. There is a prep/garnish station/table outside of the kitchen where the servers add any additional touches. We noticed most dishes sat for quite a while with severs/staff walking past.  Other than that the staff was very attentive and amazing EXCEPT one guy. He had a kind of mohawk hair cut and he was the only one who wasn't moving. Everyone else walked with intent;  they had something to do and somewhere to go, trying to get people served and customers taken care of. Not this guy. He walked around the restaurant as if you had nothing to do and when he WAS working it was the slowest I'd ever seen someone move. At one point he had a small piece of paper or straw wrapper or something and playfully threw it at another server.  Rather than picking it up when it fell on the ground he kicked it under a table.. it was just all together strange.  I got a Benedict it was super good.  My friend on the other hand got the pecan pancakes and there were literally two pieces of pecan on them.  The flavor was great but it definitely wasn't what was explained on the menu. The flavor was great but seeing some pics posted here and reading the description on the menu, it wasn't what we expected. We mentioned it to the server and she called the manager over who agreed there should have been way more on her dish and "they probably got busy and didn't realize many pecan came out."

GkquelbO2ZQQAQZfjuopcQ.text: Honestly what a great place to come for breakfast or brunch or an early lunch. You really can't go wrong with any of there dishes my favorite is the Mexican egg. If you really like spicy, egg,potato and chorizo this will be your new favorite dish. The egg tacos are bomb! And the savory French toast is sublime. And the owner is just the sweetest. You won't be disappointed.

KSUWm93iFhldkm-giP7sqw.text: This is really a great spot. Came in for Sunday brunch and was wildly impressed with the set-up and decor.  We did have to wait about 20 minutes for a table but it's to be expected for a Sunday Brunch. The menu is broad and creative with a number of really appealing items; I had the chix & waffles which was good but I quickly developed plate envy when seeing my friend's Croque Madame and another's Country Fried Steak. The service was absolutely fantastic. Overall a great brunch spot.

kr0WaI4RlMsqmtnU2il6Og.text: Checked out the Stove yesterday and it exceeded all expectations! There were 9 of us and all of us loved our food! The staff are amazing and the space is very cool.  They have a coffee bar, pastries to go,  dining room, tea room (awesome) and a private room that is perfect for hanging out with friends. Get the short rib empanadas, the salmon benny, the dirty BLT or the BRG. So, so good. Well done Antonio and Scott!

XK7vM2Y60ebSr8Pryo-6AA.text: mediocre, at best...  very disorganized, the hostess was terrible..the place was 1/2 empty & we waited over 1/2 an hour for a table, after looking at empty tables the whole time..  the food looked great as it was coming out, but appearance ain't everything...way over-sauced & over-wrought...tasty but nothing special..  in general, both the food & the ambience dripped with pretension...not my favorite combination  our server, rachel, i think her name was, was great though..  way better options elsewhere if you want a hipster breakfast, try publicus or the sunrise coffee house...waaaay better food & non-snotty folks

1_Vi7C0bU7ejpymYxMcvlw.text: I stopped here for the first time on my way to Arizona. You go up the stairs and it's a small but really cute place decorated to make you feel totally at home. It was clean and service was kind and patient. We tried the dirty BLT, it had jalapeno bacon, avocado, and a sunny side up egg, the short rib empanadas, and the Mexican egg. It was all so fresh and full of flavor. But what ended up catching my attention was that on Sunday they have a brunch with live music and "tea time". I have a friend I just had to take for tea time brunch so we went back about a week later with a small group and tried a ton more food and had tea! I would recommend trying the pancake/sausage corn dogs. They were delicious!!! Really I don't think anything on the menu could be bad. The food was SO good. The only downside is I live kind of far away. Hopefully they'll open a closer location someday! :)

sVUz9qNuK2jihZqk0ENw0w.text: My partner and I are always trying to find new brunch spots around town as it's my favorite meal of the day, so I was eager to try this place out. We were immediately greeted with an estimated 1.5 hour wait time; granted, it *is* New Year's Day, so a busy restaurant was to be expected. But in reality, there were lots of empty tables and our wait wasn't longer than 20 minutes (we suspect their list had not been updated when we checked in). For a place called The Stove, the indoor temperature was closer to The Refrigerator. I opted to keep my jacket on. It took a bit for the server to get to us, so we sat for a minute with just ice water. That was the only time during the entire meal our glasses were that full. While we waited, we had time to visually dissect the restaurant: we noticed that the floors were pretty filthy and dirty dishes were left out--few only inches behind my shoulder on a counter. Overall, the aesthetic of the restaurant is very hipster, cool, and casual. I especially liked the suspenders each of the servers were sporting. Our server Krystal was upbeat and pleasant, and if it weren't for her, I would've given this place one less star. We ordered coffee and a cinnamon roll as an appetizer. It's comical because the header for appetizers on the menu reads "1st Things 1st," and yet the cinnamon roll got to our table last--well after we had been served our entrees which I will get to in a minute. The coffee came first, but I was met with an awkward situation when I had nothing to stir it with, and so I used my fork as did the table next to us. We could tell they were even more frustrated with the slow service than we were. The wait was a little on the long side for our food, but when it came, it looked Instagram worthy. Small note: we asked for his eggs to be over-easy, and mine over-medium, but we found there was little difference between them. Not a huge complaint. My boyfriend had the corn beef which was "alright," and I went with the country fried which I felt was over-seasoned. Still, I cleaned my plate. The food wasn't terrible, but for the price, I'd say it isn't worth it. We ended up having our appetizer as dessert; the cinnamon roll was good, but you could have switched it out with a store bought one and I probably wouldn't have noticed. Since it was quite a drive getting here anyway, I think it's safe to say I won't ever be coming back.   tl;dr: This place was alright. The food is pretty (and pricey), but nothing worth salivating over. The service was kind of slow and felt incomplete at times. And the restaurant could be a little cleaner too.

fjzIYmSNQaFeRN0E6wAu7Q.text: I'm not quite sure the allure of this place?  I've been twice this far and each time, we have had to stand uncomfortably at the front door or wait outside on their sunny patio for a table. It's always very busy and very loud.   Service is adequate, nothing great. But the food? The menu looks great but in talking to people at the tables next to me or my friends who go with me, the food is just...very average?? The last time I was there, I had to send my iced tea back because it tasted old and rank. Eggs have not been cooked the way I've requested. Muffins are not toasted, they're just glopped with sauce.  Between the noise and the wait and the average service and the average food, I am hard-pressed to say I want to try a third time?

RmbCjgT30nh3rFoghXdtlQ.text: The Stove is as good as it gets when searching for a nice establishment in Vegas from an out-of-towners POV. Sure, it's not that super luxurious feel you get from restaurants on the strip, but let's be honest, the best places are not on the strip. The place satisfies even the best of local choices. The menu was well thought out and the decor was very refreshing, especially with the wide open windows which offer a great view of the area. Yes this area gets busy around those hungry times, but it is well worth it. Try everything. You will not be dissapointed.

4ZpFxu6Q5n61aTshCCqDng.text: First off: I'm not usually. Trendy person, BUT get your a$$ here cuz this is the cutest, coolest place in Vegas!!! The top chef is amazing, owner amazing and I don't know where to start with how freakin homey this place is.  Came here for my going away and already missing Vegas. Live music, bottomless Mamos's (yes I had u at Mamosa) lol!!  Drinks, view, food, vibe. What else do u need? Nothing.  Truly in love with this place all 100% around.. xoxo

tFsEs4UGo1f80yq3YoquZw.text: I definitely anticipated this place would be better then it was. The food was great! It was busy and I could see that they made EVERYTHING from scratch and made to order. The reason why I didn't give this place 4 stars is because of the service. I can't even recall what my servers name was and i'm not sure if he was just in the weeds or maybe a little new at being a server, but he just seemed all over the place. We only got checked on once after receiving our food and it took a long while before getting our check after asking for it a few times. Right after picking up our payments, he ran by our table and asked us if we wanted free birthday cake pancakes because it was a made by mistake. Given that it was my birthday my friends said yes right away. A part of me was thinking, he should've offered to put it in a togo box since he knew we were literally cashing out, ready to go. Since they were free, I was just like oh well i'll just try some and then ask for a box. I'm usually not a fan of birthday cake flavored anything, but I tried it anyways. I would probably not order it... didn't see anything that special about it. I will probably be back and hope that my experience next time will be different. I ordered the poutine waffle fries and it was delicious!! I've never tried gravy on waffles, but I found it oddly satisfying. Definitely something I would come back for.

xZQ_UMn8Vm5Mhml25vry0g.text: We went early on a Saturday morning to avoid the crowds and were successful as we were the only ones seated at 0730.    As others noted it was a little chilly inside, but I credited that to being 40' outside and we were seated at the big windows.  When the door opened a cold breeze would whip in but I felt more sorry for the hostess than us!  The service was very good, drinks were quick and refills were offered frequently.  We met some friends there so if there was a wait for the food, as others suggest, we were not troubled at all as we had much to talk about and welcomed the time to visit.  And...  good things take time!  I had the banger and eggs poached with house potatoes instead of the potato mash and my SO had the traditional eggs benedict.  Both were delicious, I want to try the country benedict next time, but he will stick with the traditional.  When he finds great eggs benny he does not waver, and he said they were very very good, as did our friend who ordered them as well.  We will definitely be back, early again for sure to avoid the crowds.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Passion ice tea with a pretty straw (paper).
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Banger and poached eggs, very good.

4y0gimeFknJU-6VAdHExtA.text: OMGosh.  The Stove is like a fresh spring in the middle of the desert.  So refreshing, not a typical "vegas" restuarant.  The food is fresh and unique with so many wonderful options.  My niece chose The Stove as she had just completed her RD exam wanted to check it out and I wanted to celebrate with mimosas. I would not typically try an unknown place, which would have been my loss in this case.  Our wonderful server Crystal was a pleasure and made sure we were happy every time she came by.  A total sweetheart.  The manager Summer made sure to check in on us as well and truly cared about making sure our time there was above expectations and it was.  I can guarantee you we will be back regularly.  I highly recommend The Stove.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. The Crabby Patty

OyWHIm5g2iDldRhanY6I6Q.text: Great food and atmosphere.  The sake coffee is great! The dining area is open concept.  They have a cute photo booth.  My son enjoyed his meal in a lunchbox.
