5Nuc35Kj4OGuquj4XfPODw.text: Clean and friendly staff!! Alec our host was very knowledgeable about the menu and gave us excellent recommendations.  We will return with friends and family next time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Suckling Pig Benedict &amp; Flapjacks

zba36GTC-qzFLkVcszLxlA.text: My wife and I went on Sunday 8/18/19 around 11am the place was very busy and we were quoted a 30 to 45 min wait. We waited in the waiting area on the  outside patio. After 45 mins pass by we were about to leave due to nobody in the staff notifying us do note it is just the two of us and we saw multiple groups walk out and still nothing. I decided to go up to the host and she stated they texted us but we never received anything. So then they sat us down immediately and apologized. So keep in mind if you are waiting and it seems like it's taking to long make sure to ask them for a update because they just might forget about you like they did about us. After sitting down we were greeted by a server named Alec he was by far the reason why I'm giving this place 3 stars. His customer service was perfect and literally saved this place from a really bad review. Anyways we went ahead and ordered the bottomless mimosas at $19 per person. We tried the different flavors they had mango, strawberry and hibiscus all were very tasty. For an appetizer we got the empanadas which were perfect. We then ordered our main dish I got the suckling pig Benedict and my wife the crappy patty. Both dishes were great. After 2 and a half bottles of champagne later our server Alec gave us a complimentary cookie for dessert which was a great gesture. Total was $89 pretty pricey but worth it. So if you decide to try this place out make sure you're prepared to wait awhile for a table and if it seems like too long ask the host for an update.

Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Crappy patty

xIc4ADsNjslTWlPj9qg_yw.text: Stopped in for breakfast on a Thursday morning.  They had a reasonable amount of customers.  The staff was friendly and efficient.  My wife had the Full Monte and I had the Cornbeef with eggs.  We both throughly enjoyed our meals and were vey happy with the food. The coffee was excellent.  The view from the restaurant is excellent!  The kitchen area is open to the restaurant, which normally I enjoy watching the staff work, but unfortunately there were some things that I did not enjoy.  None of the kitchen staff were wearing aprons, hair nets or hats.  Even worse you could see dirty grease on the back wall around the broiler.  Even though the food was good, the condition of the kitchen leaves me a little disenchanted.

A2q6lBM521XVZ_cK0IeUfQ.text: The food was excellent the service was great the owner manager chef was awesome. My breakfast was the best breakfast I had had in a long time. The atmosphere was full of energy and everyone seem to enjoy their food. This is the type of place and service I love to have wherever I go. Can't wait to go back.

JwOBGP5j0PRlgE-Y69ay-Q.text: Fantastic cuisine, beautiful modern interior, French and upscale food that is delicious, friendly staff, but to top it all off the owner/manager is one of the kindest and professional individuals I have met. Great place on all points.

ZRUXQSz5w7nmLQMBgz1Xwg.text: Yoooooo,   $19 bottomless mimosas at 7am YES PLEASE LOL  The vegan eggs Benedict was amazing and i get it EVERYTIME I come.   I've NEVER had subpar service, in fact, the owner comes out and tries his very best to greet every table. He even gets his "hands dirty" so to speak. Brought me glasses of champagne to the table and drank with me for my bday (which is pretty normal because I've seen him do it with others) but he doesn't get plastered. Just a dope ass environment that is very "family" like. You just feel at home with EVERYONE here.   PS: don't miss the photo booth!!!

gMMAOQbBc_Y6ZGaxrjXd-g.text: We thought we were in for a treat when we saw the Unicorn Hot Chocolate on the menu... and it was definitely a treat! Our bartender suggested the Butternut Squash Hash and it was just as amazing as she has described. However, our BLT was disappointing. In my opinion, it's hard to fuck that sandwich up. But The chef at The Stove did just that. First, what kind of BLT only comes with two slices of bacon?! They also forgot the sundried tomatoes. Simple mistake. But waiting 15 minutes for them to bring it to us, is not! The service was good but VERY slow. There seems to be more hype than deserved here.

1N-3QCkbreK4k8XMFZpazw.text: OMG. You have to try this place. Everything is made from scratch! The food is amazing. No salt and pepper on the table. Everything is perfectly seasoned. I recommend your first time come with friends so you can taste everything. 5 of us enjoyed coffee, mimosas, a pastry basket (get this), Egg Tacos, chicken n waffles, quack n cheese omelet, chicken fried steak and chilaquiles. Everything was done perfectly! Serving sizes were perfect as well. Service was exceptional. Staff gave us awesome recommendations. They really new the menu. If I could rate them higher I would! Get here early. We arrived at 8:00. By the time we finished our meal there was standing room only. You will not be disappointed.

j-YwZl_k8fZ-03AA42abbw.text: Very popular brunch spot with bottomless mimosas. I would definitely recommend and will definitely return!

gIXupN47HLKuL2sKCQJSEQ.text: Croque Madame is the bomb, though the last time I went it was a bit skimpy. Surprisingly the Savory French Toast seemed to be an open faced Madame for a dollar less. Maybe Gruyere cheese is that much more expensive than Swiss?? Ladies loved the mimosas and the Bloody Mary with sake isn't too shabby (no hard liquor here). Service is usually top notch and we like the bright airy atmosphere. I like that they aren't afraid to try something different. A little room for improvement but this is a go-to spot for us, especially with out of town guests.

lSzRa3-j8Cm0hCCyAUm8UA.text: The Stove is 5 stars in every aspect!! The menu is unreal, I literally wanted to try everything. I went with the Benedict Crabby Patty and also had some short rib empanadas and tried the vegan tacos. It was all incredible! The atmosphere is so cute and fun, they have party rooms available and a photo booth and a patio, it's on the second floor so the views and natural light through the large windows are stunning. The servers were so nice and the owner was there and was really sweet and truly cares about his customers. I'll be bringing everyone I know here!

MpEFDnjb5xlvvRHnXOFZTg.text: Haven't had the food yet, it's been like 2 hours and maybe 3, I actually don't know because I'm delirious from from starvation, service is extremely slow... but from a far the food looks alright. Place is a cool setting. Hope everyone is having a great time eating while i sit here with my blueberry muffin that was given to me for such a long wait... the muffin is tastes so good, feels like I haven't had food in days.  Update: shortly after I received my food... I tried to snap a photo before I put it in my belly but my hands were so shaky from the lack of nutrients... all in all it was great :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Deliciousness

rMFEMA7_-gPYOiR1e8HdDg.text: Absolutely yummy! I ordered the creme brulee oatmeal and the chicken and waffles and they were both divine. My friend ordered the watermelon salad and the country fried steak and she really enjoyed her meal as well! We both had a watermelon mimosa which is something we didn't know we needed until we took our first sips and were sent to a new world of mimosa flavors! All of the ingredients were so fresh and flavorful! Alec amd Krystal were incredibly great waiters! I live all the way on the opposite side of town in Aliante but I cannot wait to make the trip back out to Henderson for this delicious restaurant!

SwMkR9N0uyiH46iHl-kcTg.text: What a great new addition to Henderson! A classic breakfast menu with a twist here and there. You must try the Unicorn Hot Chocolate, Chilaquiles, the Crabby Patty and Chicken and WAFFLES! Not just an ordinary waffle... a MAC N' CHEESE waffle! Don't forget about the unlimited Mimosas served DAILY and their adorable Tea Room !  In a hurry? They have a walk up bar serving pastries and coffee all day long!

Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Crabby Patty, Chilaquiles, and French Toast!

tPtlz9vWkX-fcJWQDAffKA.text: Tea time!  My 17 year old daughter and I decided to check this new spot out (3 weeks new).  I called Sunday morning and asked if I could make a reservation for two in the tea room for same day at 2:30.  The receptionist was friendly and efficient even though I could hear how busy the restaurant was.  She got me booked which we were thankful for.  We arrived 15 min early and the hostess walked us right in.  There was only three other tea tables booked along with ours.    Our server was a lady named BROOKE.  Welcomed us and told us if we had any questions about the tea or the menu to go ahead and ask as she dropped off a couple glasses of water.  She was very friendly and gave us a few minutes to look over the menu.  We decided on ordering the FORMAL TEA, UNICORN hot chocolate, pastry basket, sausage corn dogs and my daughter wanted some cheese curds that wasn't really on the menu but they rang it up as a side for us.   The presentation of all the foods was absolutely wonderful!  Thank you to the chefs and workers that prepare the plates. Well done!  The only thing that I didn't particularly like but my daughter loved was the unicorn hot chocolate, tasted more like cinnamon to me than hot chocolate.    Prices were spot on.  The bill wasn't too expensive considering everything we ordered and how yummy everything was.   The only real negative for me was that it was very loud in the main dining area and a little loud for my liking in the tea room but hey... it's a hot, trendy, NEW spot that people are going to want to come to so I guess that's to be expected.   Thank you to The Stove and Staff!  We will definitely recommend.

NB03QP1C0ALHLAjv-SP0VQ.text: I can't yet give the stove 5 star because i didnt eat their meals. Today i went for a little coffee/tea social. I tried their blueberry muffin and hibiscus tea. I am in love with the ambiance of this place. It is sectioned into 3 areas. The first is the main dining hall, the second a tea lounge, and the third a coffee room wherw you can chill and use the wifi. It's very instagramable. The muffin was very tasty and the tea perfectly refreshing. Its located on the second floor so the natural lighting and the views were amazing. I will be back like tomorrow.   UPDATE:  I loooooove it. Every person in this restaurant was nice from the hostess, to our waiter, to the tea expert, and the awesome chefs who come over to talk and make sure you are enjoying your experience. I ate the chiliquilies this time and it was big enough to split with my friend. The flavors were satisfying and delicious. I was also happy with the prices.

gZIyD6hLVmzfKUkcaj9NoA.text: Food: I was hoping for the cinnamon roll that I'd seen a picture of here on Yelp, but they said they don't make it anymore even though it was popular. Not sure why? Also, they were out of black tea (huh?) and I had to go with Earl Gray Creme which was really gross and I didn't drink it.   Pecan pancakes - I did not care for these. 3 large, very dense pancakes. Some bites were extremely salty, like they didn't fully mix the dry ingredients. I didn't even eat half.   Pulled pork eggs Benedict- my husband ordered this and it was more like a lunch plate with the BBQ sauce. He said he didn't care for the biscuit and preferred the more traditional English muffin.   Ambiance: small, cute space with a great view of the snow on the mountains.   Service: attentive, but not observant.  I'm not one to complain but you could see I hardly ate or drank my food.   Location: we had trouble finding this place because all we could see was The 052 bar, but my husband looked up and noticed the round logo on the 2nd floor above the bar.   We will try this place again since it's a cute brunch place and a convenient location, but next time on a Sunday and I'd order something else.

ucGmHaevMcZgOpkyLsoSRQ.text: Great place, especially for a foodie.  Very unique food. A little pricey but worth it!!!

NpmVjliX8Pa-KqGBsx9gHw.text: How does this place have 4 stars? We were so excited walking in & seeing all the cute decor but it all went downhill after that.   To start off, the guy's review below that stated that this place Is called The Stove but that it should've been called The Refrigerator, spot on. It was freezing cold! Even with our jackets on, it did not suffice. When we had walked-in there apparently was an employee next to us the whole time but we were never greeted. We had to wait for another gentlemen finish seating his guests to then be recognized. We had made a reservation prior, but apparently that didn't matter. There were many tables open & we weren't seated until we had asked another server what was going on.   We had ordered 3 different lattes off the menu: the apple pie latte, lavender latte & the tres leches latte. All 3 were pretty bland & did not taste like the names of the lattes. I would say the apple pie was the worst--it was more like water with some coffee & the aroma of apples. At first they messed up the order & gave us two lavender lattes & a tres leches, so I had to wait for the other latte. This was the first of many times we had to wait throughout our dining experience!  We had to wait almost an hour for our food to arrive. The food was just okay, nothing amazing. But then one of our orders were incorrect. They quickly changed out the dish for the correct one but then this one was cold in the middle.   I mean the server was cool. He let us know that they'd give us a small discount for the food taking forever but what about the incorrect orders, cold food & horrible lattes? We wanted to come back to try the tea but probably won't return ever again. Wasn't worth it.

Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. Chocolate croissant...we asked for ham &amp; cheese.

gX9RjsXt9r1SVmu6ewJmNg.text: Been here 2x. First time ordered the chicken N waffles: so gross. Chicken was rubbery & grey in color. Second time had the salmon benny: food was cold and the egg was basically soft boiled. No runny yolk like a typical Benedict. My wife enjoyed her French toast dish but both times I've been here have been a waste of time & money. Decor is cute but the food misses the mark. I should also note: when I mentioned to the staff during my visit about the chix/waffles - the guy was a total ass.

l-UIamrKsAcdfH42IzFO8A.text: I love this place for brunch- their menu is pretty extensive without being overwhelming and in the four times I've gone, I liked each item... their benedicts are all gold. The $19 bottomless mimosas are awesome because they serve the champagne separately so you can add as much to your juice as you'd like. Hostess and wait staff are always friendly and helpful. The only con is the acoustics in the building are weird so it gets loud when crowded.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. crabby benedict.
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. short rib empanadas.97

sxZFcK4PHCDQEf6LbJWa8g.text: Third time back here in a matter of weeks and frankly all I can say is third verse same as the first!  Rachael waited on us and she was amazing everyone who works here is so nice and they are so helpful! Seems like they all enjoy their jobs!  But wanted to highlight our food from this visit so hubby did the traditional Benedict and wow. Delicious ! My friend did the pig version and again amazing and I did the shumai maybe (can't remember what it was) but basically stewed tomatoes in a skillet with an egg and a little arugula and feta. It was an Israelite dish and loved the smaller portion but still could not finish it. What a pack of flavors!! Next time I am trying the unicorn hot chocolate for sure! And the other thing I LOVED as I don't have kids and can't tolerate a screaming child that the parents ignore is they serve the kids meals in plastic and in a lunch box!!! Soooo thoughtfulness everything they do is so full of LOVE!!   Funky location so keep your eyes open. They are in a little strip center right off Eastern but upstairs! So the views really are beautiful and especially if you have a larger party and sit in the "front room". But anywho. Michael was our server and he was delightful!  He had an awesome personality and was super friendly! We asked about a couple of items as to what to order and made some choices. And here is what we ended up with (btw all the pics are accurate on yelp for their food! It all looks and tastes THAT GOOD!  This was our first time and will NOT be our last! We had an order or the French toast (you get three huge slices and topped with beautiful fresh berries), the avocado toast with poached eggs that were perfectly cooked on top and an order of the crab Benedict. I have to say I tasted all three dishes and every one of them (each a distinctly different flavor) were amazing!  Also the bananas foster done table side looked incredible also!  The crab Benedict had a lovely hint of Tabasco in the sauce and the potatoes they sat on were delicious. Loved the toast on the avocado toast as it was delicate and not too crispy to cut the inside of your mouth but light enough that it was not dense. Really amazing food and as I said Michael, our server, made us feel right at home and was super funny!  Oh but go hungry the portions are stout but I Gaurantee you will eat it!

wxPnaSjkNthu873C31iAbQ.text: I've been wanting to try the place for ages! So glad I did. First of all the decor and set up is really cute and cozy. It's not very big but we never felt crowded. The menu is very interesting and eclectic. Scones biscuits, avocado toast, short rib tacos, corn dogs, soup, salad and vegan options. Very hipster, in a good way.  Service was good staff was friendly  Food was really good! I had the  tacos and the meat was so tender and flavorful.   My friend had the PB and j biscuit and I had total food envy when it came out. It looked so delicious and she said it was killer!   The best thing about this place is the price. You get quality food for a steal. Highly recommend!

ykclGlfoLnW7y7XWCzsqGQ.text: Ok so first of all I have to talk about how adorable this place is. From the table to the ceilings to the wall decor to the couch area it's just all so cute. The kitchen is open and the staff are friendly.  Now the food is fantastic as well. I'm vegan so I had the vegan Benedict.-delightful! I had a non-vegan friend with me and she loved her food as well. The only real critique is that is is a bit pricey, but hey when you have that kind of quality you can charge for it!

5NBW524lIVH7T9u0-oBuVw.text: Great new spot in Henderson. Highly recommend. Try the  waffles and bennies. Bring your friends as it's a great group setting as well.

qQAY5D3cJOWNhWd6RMbXYg.text: Cute decor and I can totally see why people would come in here for the ambiance alone. I asked the bartender what I should get since it would be my last chance in that restaurant and he told me to order the pork eggs benedict. The poached eggs were yummy but the biscuits were so dry underneath it probably could've cracked a tooth honestly. I couldn't tell what the yellow sauce was on it but tasted like a nacho cheese sauce that gave me the worst heartburn of life. Deadass had to stop by a CVS and pick up an anti-acid. Also why are the Bloody Mary's mixed with Sake instead of vodka. LMK

NrFSVgG23r2XNPI-rdhSnw.text: The Stove is our go-to brunch spot. We like to consider ourselves brunch connoisseur, always down to try out new spots, but when given the choice we always find ourselves coming back here and bringing friends time and time again. You can't beat the variety of their menu - they have something for everyone, including vegan options. The herb wall they have by the expo line is my favorite. The fresh pressed juice they make in-house is amazing with so many flavor choices. And you just can't beat the atmosphere - you can look around the room and just tell that everyone is really enjoying themselves. Top notch surface from the servers to the bussers to the cooks in the kitchen, everyone there is working hard to make it an enjoyable time for their guests. No doubt we will continue to make this our regular spot and encourage everyone to try them out!

hDY2MYw3shp13qx7JpT7aw.text: Hands-down number one most amazing brunch place in the Henderson/ Las Vegas area! Every item on their menu is amazing and I know because we have tried all of them LOL the entire staff is so friendly and chef and Tonio always comes out to say hello and check on his guests... Such a personal touch that is always appreciated! We will continue to go to this restaurant every chance we get!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

cKsLiEwnAME9vush5SpKUQ.text: This place is amazing! I've read a few of the less than stellar reviews and I just don't get how anyone can not like this place. I understand a bad experience, a bad server, busy loud restaurant, long wait, but the food here is incredible! The only complaint I could possibly have is the long wait, which is a tell tale sign of how great this place is. Usually a 3 hour wait. So go very early or very late to avoid the long waiting list. I would also complain that this place should be open for dinner because I could only imagine what an amazing dinner menu it would be!  You can't go wrong with the table side banana fosters pancakes! The shortrib omlet was incredible! Really everything I have had here has been very good.

zFj5UgWVHRCl4D9owdUM6A.text: Food was very good but the only flaw I had with my experience was the long wait time for our food. We waited almost an hour for our food to come out and noticed everyone in the dining room had the same reactions too. They make the food to order so I guess it takes time. But still, an hour is a bit long...I guess don't come here on a Saturday afternoon for brunch if you don't have time to wait....(also I think some bread and butter would a nice touch while we wait...) I would come back because the food is delicious but not on a weekend.

eyWf4aWmZ374U8L0QDSsjg.text: Vintage vibes, inclusive vegan options alongside my meat eating honey bun :) love this place, great service and fantastic food!  Aside from the food and coffee! I especially liked the selfie room

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

5_OR1bOaFIg8nUIax5nBgQ.text: My husband and I love coming here when we visit his family in Henderson. His fam are regulars here and the staff is so friendly and welcoming, they make us feel right at home. I got the egg white frittata and my hubby got the eggs Benedict (we're told they are very accommodating and will cook up anything you want, doesn't even have to be a menu item!)  My favorite part of the frittata was the cauliflower puree, to die for! Tastes very earthy and I'm impressed they could extract that much flavor from the humble vegetable. My husband's eggs Benedict had a creamy hollandaise sauce and the ham had the perfect amount of salt for the dish. Their bread is also toasted well - weird thing to notice but it's crunchy and buttery, not just an afterthought like most places.  Can't wait to come back next time we visit!

RxSvQ9c1EtJbUa0z6k8ThQ.text: Favorite local brunch place. Food is top notch, great atmosphere. First time was to celebrate Valentine's day with my fiance, and I've come back with girlfriends for brunch. Gets busy but you can get in line ahead of time on their website. Friendly staff as well!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

KVzb2UCFFvaknBzqLjks2A.text: Service was awful! My wife and I came here for breakfast. We waited 5 minutes for someone to take our order... 5 more minutes rolled by and no one acknowledged us. Ten more minutes passed and still no one. Twenty minutes people! Twenty minutes passed and we didn't even get water. The annoying thing is that a couple that came in the restaurant after us got their order taken already. I can't even tell you about the food because after 25 minutes of waiting, we just stood up and left. My wife talked to the hostess on the way out about their terrible customer service and someone (I'm guessing the manager) chased us down to apologize. Also, he must have known we were ignored all this time because he knew exactly what to apologize for when he saw us leaving...  We eventually decided to go to Mr Mamas Breakfast and Lunch. Right off the bat, we were greeted with smiles and hospitalities. I joked with my wife, asking her "how long do you think we'll get water?"  Less than 3 minutes, our waitress already filled our glasses and offered us coffee. And Mamas  is packed. It's not as empty as The Stove. The Stove had 5 tables including ours so I didn't understand what took them so long to acknowledge us. They only noticed when we got up to leave.   I never got the chance to eat at the stove, and I don't think I'll ever want to after this morning's experience.

Ap8zVkMV905Tidcflty8PA.text: Let me fair the food is excellent, the presentation incredible, we waited for the food over and hour, the wait to be seated was also and hour. They seam to be under staff on the weekend or the kitchen is not the correct size for the restaurant, I have been here on weekday and the service was much better. Lest hope they figure it out

GW4ruGk4q4cKX7Py_59Pag.text: Well worth the wait!!! We ended up having to wait a little bit all of the champagne cocktails at the Uber cute bar made it completely fine Hahahah! When we sat the staff were amazing and friendly and overly accommodating! When the food arrived we were beyond amazed at how great ALL of the food and pastries are! The Crabby Patty was my absolute fave but everything is amazing!!! Must try the Creamsicle Mimosa!!!! So... if you have to wait... don't be bummed cuz it's well worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

Mgq0s12xf47smw8P9XMfyg.text: First walked in and no one was in the front to seat us and we waited for 5 minutes till i just walked up to a waitress and asked if we were suppose to seat ourselves. She apologized and sat us down. It was a weekday and it wasn't busy when we arrived.  A lot of open tables but they were not cleaned.  While we were waiting for the food, i noticed that they had no one cleaning the tables. Not sure if they were short staffed or is someone wasn't doing their job.  Food was okay but some of the items weren't the things that we ordered.  recommend changing the names of the food items. I ordered tacos and they are more like tostada. Food took a bit to come out but waitress did say it would since everything is fresh.

Q-x-uB0899UlyZLwd0yvYg.text: I think my wife and I have a new favorite breakfast spot. She has been here before, and I am happy I was able to try this place with her.   First, thank you to the wonderful service we received.   My wife loves the farmhouse breakfast with the country toast, and recommends getting a side of their strawberry jam. The entire plate is delicious, especially the thick cut bacon.   I had the Shasuka, that I was eager to try after seeing the photos. This is the best tomato based breakfast dish. Even my wife was taking some of the tomato sauce to put on her scrambled eggs.   I would recommend coming here and getting a reservation if possible.

W_1TVWzKeKPaYhGGu6mD1g.text: In Vegas for a conference and found this sweet surprise!!  Food prepared with attention to freshness, balance of flavor and and connection to your customers is a beautiful thing.  You had me at the Herb and Micro-greens wall!  The Brussels Sprout Hash was so good!  The entire experience was lovely! I'll come back every time I'm in Vegas. I'm a fan.  You should eat here..often.

pRWj7lVdsPrnJfO4n3P6vA.text: Staff was friendly but for not being that busy around 1 pm the food took a while to come to us. My corned beef dish was temperature hot and the eggs and potato were good but they should not call their corned beef corned beef. It was boiled pot roast with zero flavor. No salt and zero flavor. I could have boiled a cheaper cut at home and it would have tasted better! Hesitant if I'd be back

KF7yy4kv0FMSf5ir7VVx1A.text: Absolutely INCREDIBLE!! From the decor to the service and of course not to mention the amazing food! Had some friends visiting town and I've wanted to come here for a while and I'm so glad I did! I had the savory French toast which was everything I could of asked for and more, I love French toast but I don't like it sweet so the fact that this is on the menu made my whole day!! My friend got the chicken and waffles. And let me tell you the waffles have mac & cheese inside of them, I lost my mind when I had a bite! The most delicious waffle I've ever had in my whole life!!! I can't wait to keep coming back, my for sure favorite new spot for brunch in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

JIyYJeZAPgF-uHFK15A5bQ.text: This was our fourth visit in two months, love the food and the decor and the service has been excellent. That being said, we only go during the week, have heard about the weekend crowds so that's an easy choice. Took my family the other day from out of town and we were seated quickly, servers were great, even got to chat with both of the owners.  Have sat inside and outside and never felt neglected. Food is consistently delicious although my friend's Monte Cristo was very doughy but had Short Rib Tacos, yum!  Avocado toast and also the salads are delish. Definitely glad to have this 'gem' in the neighborhood!

6p-0WKHuSsqrNSF9cpyZug.text: Even with reservations we waited over an hour for a table.  It is not that they didn't have empty tables because the back half of the place was empty.     The food is ok but it is not worth waiting for it.   You can get food as good or better in other places like Kitchen Table.    The pastries tasted store bought and not fresh.    Won't be coming back.

k4OSWc9CWKBN1eZAlNLPFg.text: I love trying new places and The Stove did not disappoint. The food was fresh and delicious, the chef knows what he is doing and he is doing it very well :) We tried the savory french toast and the suckling pig, both were cooked to perfection, can't wait to go back and try everything on the menu.

N6jnwwr9ZBNUPFez_8n0kQ.text: We wanted a great spot to do breakfast as a family... something that was worth the time getting out the door with two little ones on a busy Saturday.   We were pleasantly surprised with how amazing this new spot is. From the fun and eclectic modern decor to the creative mouth-watering dishes, this place is absolutely worth it.   Whether for a family breakfast or a birthday celebration, I would recommend coming here! Servers were super kind and helpful... the food was memorable and beyond different from anything else in the city! And the chef Antonio is so personable and extremely talented at what he does!   We will be back! Thanks for an epic experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

B1VkFXFksY3SYXQYEoX1DQ.text: Nice modern restaurant.  Our second time eating lunch there. I ordered the Crabby Patty. First time was absolutely delicious. The second time not so much. The sauce was very sour and too much of it on the plate. The Chorizo Fritata was dry (maybe serve it with salsa). Also it was regular sausage not chorizo. We will go again. There are other dishes that sound really good. The cooks need to be consistent.

tzLOQrqTmVH0teAk1nOd_A.text: Nice ambience cute place. Food was ok but my friends love it . They are the one who recommended going here for breakfast. I personally would not come back  again on my own however I would def take my kids or friends for them to check out this place if they decided to come with us to town.  It is well put together but I feel the food isn't for us and hubby agree. We ordered pastries, empanadas short ribs, Mexican eggs as our appetizer. Hubby and friends got corned beef , eggs tacos & I got monte cristo. Love the homemade jam but I feel my meal was a little greasy and of course after sharing the appetizers I was too full to finish my meal so I took it home and the more it sit, the more greasy it got . Place is always busy and there is no reservation except they will hold your table for 10 min and will text you to let you know your table is ready. We were #6 on the list and still #6 while waiting at home for approx 30 min so we drove there, make our presence known and within 15 min we were seated.  My friend cell showed at that time we were #5 on the list

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States. My monte cristo. I love the clear plate it came on. The food , not so much

Z6Ed1kmEToszCdJJaJTkkw.text: Loooooved it. Had the farmhouse breakfast. Simple but so dang delish. Coming back here with a group next. Place is decorated so dang cute. Photo ops for dayzzzzz yo. Server was so charismatic and attentive to us. Would think it was a place for just chicks but loved all the diverse groups of people who were dining here. Goes to show their food is sought out by everybody. K I'm done. Thanks.

Tnk_GTJCZnfLlToxdfVIiA.text: I was really excited to go to the tea room for tea with my friend.  Unfortunately, There is no separate tea room just a corner in the back room.  Issues- You are only allowed one tea to choose from.  The waiter kept telling us they were out of"tea biscuits" then they were out of variety of "petite fours" so we only had one. They put us in a two top so the waiter said he couldn't give us each a tower as they normally do.  Why did we make reservations if they couldn't be ready for a tea party?   Positive- an eclectic restaurant with a variety of foods on the regular menu.  I will try this restaurant one more time, only I will be ordering from the regular menu, because the regular food looks amazing.

ZHvt7qkW2wsDGCmogdYLEA.text: Walked in about 10 minutes before they were going to close (I don't recommend doing that), they still served us as if we were there an hour earlier and let us eat at our leisure.   Our host and server were genuine and informative.  They let me try a new wine I never had before I committed to a glass.   The menu is meant to please a wide spectrum of food lovers, from the foodie foodie (ie pork belly, micro greens, etc.) to the vegan (what vegan has had a vegan Benedict?) and everyone in between.   The pork belly Benedict was well worth it.  The plate was full and  thoughtfully put together.  The sandwiches are sizable and filling.   Can't wait to try more entrees, but even more so just hang around with a cup of coffee or tea on the weekend.   PS- just moved here, so it will be nice to make this spot a regular hangout.

U0oGjUlIiTKDTebQ4aHi3g.text: Everything was AMAZINGGG!! We arrived 4:45pm and it was Wednesday...NOBODY was there. Alec our server still welcomed us with such excitement, bartender Andre made the most fabulous drink, and Chef YO (yes that's his name he's from Russia) made our food to PERFECTION !! That was my first time going & i will be coming back. The food, drinks, environment, VIBE was the best. We had BGR burger witch has to be my favorite burger I've ever had, and also waffle foie. Thank you for such amazing hospitality.

photos.caption: Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Stove - Henderson, NV, United States

22ai9ZVOT0455IxEeWaA7g.text: Adorable place, excellent food, perfect service! Definitely a must try! I got butternut hash with gluten free cinnamon toast! My friend got short rib empanadas! We spilt the crabby Benedict! They spilt the benedict so mine could be gluten free! The server did that without me even asking. My boyfriend got croque maddam!

vOC9Bx-daOMbWyh8wGJEGA.text: Yummy!  Another wonderful local place. The decor is unique and a nice spot to hang out with friends. The menu had a nice mix of new and traditional items. They have a wonderful selection of baked goods, but it runs out fast.

v2mybGeiuKjfSGyVMLddMA.text: Definitely my favorite brunch spot in town! Bottomless mimosas 7 days a week, the cutest seating area and scenery, and the service is fantastic. Tons of yummy flavors for mimosas and the food is great. Mike always takes care of me and has been a phenomenal server ever since my first time here. Alec is great too. Was just in this weekend for a big party and our server wasn't really friendly or up to par, I mentioned something to mike and he really made the rest of our brunch 100x better. Thanks Mike & Alec!

R4OmcJHnJXwQOIhnRrxvVQ.text: What an amazing place to have breakfast. The food is excellent, the service is superb,, and they are on What an amazing place to have breakfast. The food is excellent, the service is superb, and the ambience is always relaxing.

4FAr6AjpPPVpX2298wt4cg.text: The Eggs Benedict puts most to shame and the bottomless mimosa brunch is incredible! Good local vibes with incredible staff and service!

NF8wt0jLaV87bNA85O4Nfg.text: We received a gift certificate to The Stove for Christmas, and have been there twice, now. It's easy to see why this restaurant has gained such popularity. The food is innovative, fun and delicious! The Monte Cristo was just heavenly comfort food. Battered and deep fried, not exactly diet fare, but this delight was worth every calorie. And the Crabby Patty gives eggs Benedict a seafood flare, with perfect hollandaise, of course. It's a noisy, busy place, and you'll wait for a table, but it's worth it!

fdryciSLXFzhYPTb3itVeQ.text: Amazing all the way around  Food is excellent  Chef & owner always saying hi to guests and very involved  Atmosphere on point  Photo booth is an amazing idea  Great job  New favorite restaurant

-_lyM18N81hAUTarZV_Zbg.text: This place has an outstanding chipotle gravy.  The chicken fried steak was amazing. The server was caring and lovely but a bit disconnected, but nevertheless good. But what gets this place the award is the fact that Antonio, the owner is permanently here and gently care.  Be back for sure!

PfS_7HGDwE2yopJHZ-SWZA.text: Second Time Around: The food here is so friggin good! The server messed up my friend's order, which was an honest mistake and was corrected, but otherwise the service was excellent. Now that it's not brand new it's realistic to get a table. Had no problems being seated this time. Did the same thing as last time by putting my name on the waiting list online before driving there (I don't know how effective this really is??). Coffee tasted better this time too (maybe it's because my experience was better?). I would recommend this place to anyone, and I've already sent people here. I will upgrade to 5 stars when I go back again if this place is consistent. Pastries are made in-house. I will definitely be back at least for those. Kudos. I hope this place stays.  (Original Review) The coffee wasn't bad. Was excited to eat here. Put my name in online in anticipation of a wait. Didn't end up getting to eat at all because they were busier than expected and I now have to go back to work.  The hostess didn't update/ or come to get me until I was already leaving.  I'm really bummed, and now I have to be hungry all day until I get off work.  I will update my rating if I am able to eat here at some point. So far, I would say stay away if you are on lunch break in the middle of your

gP386Ma7AVCYYMej2eWE4Q.text: Dope!!! Service was great and the food was even better! Went for breakfast while out in Vegas visiting my daughters and they loved the food as well.

OYHqIgOEezxycb9J4wk__A.text: The stove is a work in progress. I've come here 4 times. I eat off the regular breakfast menu and the vegan menu. The French toast is really good and so is the vegan scramble. But it's not that good. I'm quite disappointed in the vegan menu. Their stuff on the vegan menu is bland, overpriced, and small portioned. The regular menu is supposedly delicious. But I give this place 2 stars because the wait is ridiculous. I waited 45 minutes to be seated and then waited an hour and 15 minutes for the food to come. And on top of that they forgot stuff that we ordered. This place, could be better. Honestly I wouldn't waste 2 hours just for "good" food.

HT1wr8ZisKlWq2o62OsMYA.text: Reserved the tea service for six for office Holiday get together. Sad to report that It was badly executed. Food was below average and pricey for high tea. Had to ask for spoons. Had to ask to get some sort of jam, clotted cream etc. for biscuits, which was very dry. They did bring a nice lemon curd and blueberry jam, but ran out of clotted cream. They placed us in a back room with no other guests but was dissppointing in it's decor and feel. Dirty bench seat-not wiped down from last guests and dirty dish rag left at another table. The main restaurant area seemed busy and food looked good as we walked by. I think they need more experience on providing tea service. The nice male server did say they were busy trying to set up for a party of 100, but I do not think that should be an excuse.

dXO0XsV_VjCr8iBk3XDaTQ.text: The food was soooo good!!!! We loved the patio area , we would definitely be back!  It is also a kid friendly restaurant which is a plus got us !

90xBwRc0XR9SQDZFjjefUA.text: Food is good and portions are generous. Nice atmosphere...good brunch/lunch spot and also good for private groups.  Service is a bit slow so plan to be there a little longer than your normal lunch spot.

qOgsg1bi3b2AWyAMD6Ov1g.text: Ate here with my mama after a spa date, arrived just after 1pm we ordered the short rib empanadas which I wouldn't order again (i love empandas and short rib) however you can't taste anything besides the peppers they used two kinds and it was over kill way to spicy for our liking!  Next my mother and I both ordered the crab benedict I requested a side of avocado with mine as well they charged $5 for the avocado (yikes) which wouldn't have been to bad if I received my avocado with my order unfortunately it arrived at the final two bites!   The crab benedict and smashed potatoes fortunately were delicious, however my mother cut her mouth on a crab shell (looked like a shark tooth) still I would order this again because it tasted really good, id just chew carefully :( .. Ohh server seen the shell and said she would let the chef know, unfortunately I didn't have time to speak to a manager. No apology of any kind, very disappointing... its my hope this was just a bad day because i have heard such good things about this place.

zwT9NMWHH8liIea6m3BXgw.text: I had always wanted to try this place out but, it was closed each time I attempted. It was packed to the hilt on a Wednesday morning which should say, alot for how they do business. The use an texting app to notify you when your time is up to be seated which is pretty nice. They have this amazing porch outside that honestly is WASTED space since the views we're amazing and, I could not figure out why they did not turn that into table space. Anyways, the food was phenomenal right down to the piping hot fresh muffin! The presentation was on point and, they had a chef out on the floor seasoning food which added a bit of showmanship to the experience. The portions where a little small but, they served it on an massive flat glass plate which different. Everything was perfectly seasoned and, the waiter was probably the best I have ever had. My only gripe is the pricing in comparison to the portions but, still I would urge anyone to give this place a shot because, it was amazing!

BmXPgnP18gLqwEshjOtRmQ.text: Had the pleasure of trying The Stove today for lunch and everything we ordered was delicious! Outstanding personal and friendly service. Love the decor, the atmosphere, and the overall feel. We ordered the short rib empanadas to start followed by the avocado toast with poached eggs, the corned beef with poached eggs, and the Full Monty.  All items were cooked to perfection and the flavors were spot on.  And for cocktails they use Sake since they don't have a liquor license, just beer and wine, but wow, you wouldn't miss it. The cucumber saketini was refreshing and the creamsicle drink was so yummy, also.  Highly recommend you try The Stove!

GT3kGqpgWL6Rd9bQYSRsuw.text: You are crazy if you've not been here nor less heard about it! The Stove is your ultimate brunch spot for food, girls time, hopefully you see your grandma take a champbong like a G (like I did), and eclectic service from Mike and Summer! Poutine waffle fries what?!?! I was charmed on my first visit and I'm hooked (or obsessed) now on my second. Well done ladies and gentlemen!

FJ_CmSx37I9np3lcjTEmag.text: Saw the many positive reviews and we decided to try it. Location is a bit challenging first time since their logo on the building is so small compared to the other establishment sharing the building. It's on the 2nd floor.   Menu is varied and fresh, decor is charming, open and reflects a upscale country kitchen. Two main dining rooms and one room for larger parties.   Service was excellent. Friendly and upbeat. Owner, Antonio, came over to check on us and very engaging and server Rebecca was attentive and a joy to engage with. View to the valley and Strip in the distance with mountains is a True bonus. Worth a visit.

WEtNey7nQ1RtOJd_sRYBNg.text: Really wanted to give 4.5 star actually. This is a cute place.  It reminds me of San Francisco. Majority of the dishes are good.

F8iedN7Kf93PNColI0tngw.text: Elegant and bustling brunch venue. Everything we ordered was extraordinary. The service was fantastic (which should be cautioned if ordering the delicious bottomless mimosas).

sZB3Z78RVtMVBKXoXQmemQ.text: If it's your day off or it's a holiday and you want to take advantage of your free time, don't go to this place. Food is all right not bad but but not sure it's worth the wait knowing that there are other great food places with less wait. Place is nice and the waitress was very nice. It just feels very unorganized as far as the timings from wait to food prep. Waiter said it's because everything is made from scratch which I'm sure is True before the restaurant opens but you don't make a sauce or bread or meat from scratch when you order, only the eggs
